original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “it is a downfall” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur @46b zhen /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur @46b zhen /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfall, the absence of downfall, the training, and the restoration should be understood through the basic transgression, the preparatory stage, and the completion of the preparatory stage.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sde snod gsum las mdo sde ma gtogs pa la 'dul ba nyid dang / chos mngon pa las 'dul bar gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la brnyas thabs su gyur pa brjod pa na khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis sde snod gsum las mdo sde ma gtogs pa la 'dul ba nyid dang / chos mngon pa las 'dul bar gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la brnyas thabs su gyur pa brjod pa na khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The basic transgression is as follows: If a monk disparages the Vinaya or the Abhidharma, which are part of the Vinaya, from among the three scriptural collections, except for the sūtras, he commits the basic transgression of disparaging.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa nyid du gtogs pa so sor thar pa dang / de rnam par 'byed pa dang / gzhi dang / phran tshogs dang / gzhung bla ma'i tshig la brnyas thabs su gyur pa brjod pa'i tshig re re la na smad pa med do /

translated: Here, the specific words are applied according to the specific types of contempt, and each specific word is established as a specific downfall, not according to the specific types of recitation.

original: gang dag gis dge slong rnams 'gyod pa dang / yid la gcags pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ba bslab pa'i gzhi phran tshogs rab tu phra ba 'di dag gis zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa bton pa dag gis ci bya zhes zer ba'i tshig re re la na smad pa med do //

original: de'i tshe na sngon shing mkhan rgan zhugs byis pa rmongs pa mi mkhas pa mi gsal ba zhig gis shing ljon pa bcad nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang byed du bcug go //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sngon shing mkhan rgan zhugs byis pa rmongs pa mi mkhas pa mi gsal ba zhig gis shing ljon pa bcad nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang byed du bcug go //
translated: At that time, an old and decrepit carpenter, a foolish child, unskilled, unclear, and ignorant, cut down a tree and had a temple built for the saṅgha.

original: de shing ljon pa de la gnas pa'i lha kha dog shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de mtshan mo nam sros pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de shing ljon pa de la gnas pa'i lha kha dog shin tu 'das pa gang yin pa de mtshan mo nam sros pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la der song ste phyin nas /
translated: The god who lived in that tree, whose complexion was extremely beautiful, at the end of the night went to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's two feet,

translated: and sat to one side. In this way, by the power of the god's complexion, the entire Jeta Grove was filled with a great radiance.🔽Then the god said this to the Blessed One:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha des 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha des 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Blessed One, Blessed One,

original: btsun pa sngon shing mkhan rgan zhugs byis pa rmongs pa mi gsal ba mi mkhas pa zhig gis bdag gis gnas dang / gling dang / skyob pa dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / gnas mal dang / gzhi dang / rten gyi zhugs shing ljon pa gang lags pa de bkum nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang bgyid du stsal te /

translated: Venerable, in the past, an old and decrepit carpenter, a foolish, confused, unskilled man, killed a tree that was his home, island, refuge, protection, defender, bed, foundation, and support, and had it made into a dwelling for the Saṅgha.

original: btsun pa dgun gyi dgun ni ring //
analyzed: btsun pa dgun gyi dgun ni ring //
translated: Venerable, the winter is long,

original: dgun smad kyi dus kyi tshe ni tshes brgyad kyi bar la 'od ma 'gas pa'i gser ma dag ldang zhing /
analyzed: dgun smad kyi dus kyi tshe ni tshes brgyad kyi bar la 'od ma 'gas pa'i gser ma dag ldang zhing /
translated: and in the last month of winter, for eight days, the frost and snow will rise.

original: btsun pa bdag gi bu phrug dag ni chung na bdag gis ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gi bu phrug dag ni chung na bdag gis ji ltar bgyi /
translated: Venerable, my children are young. What should I do?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha zhig la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha zhig la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to a god,

original: lha khyod kyi gnas su lha 'di'i gnas byin cig /
analyzed: lha khyod kyi gnas su lha 'di'i gnas byin cig /
translated: “God, give this god your abode.”

original: lha des 'di lta ste ston pa'i bka' lung gis rang gi gnas su lha de'i gnas byin no //
analyzed: lha des 'di lta ste ston pa'i bka' lung gis rang gi gnas su lha de'i gnas byin no //
translated: The god gave his abode to that god, as if by the word of the Teacher.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: Then, when the night had passed, the Blessed One sat down on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he had sat down, the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag ma dang lha kha dog shin tu 'das pa zhig mtshan mo nam sros pa dang nge'i gan du 'ongs te 'di skad ces zer ro zhes lha des ji skad gsol pa'i tshig ba zlas nas bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Monks, a goddess of surpassing beauty came to me in the middle of the night and said this. ” The Blessed One repeated the goddess’s words.

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar lha dag de skad ces kye ma sh'akya'i bu'i dge spyod rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar lha dag de skad ces kye ma sh'akya'i bu'i dge spyod rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Monks, the gods say, ‘Alas, the Śākya sons have lost their virtue.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes smod par byed /
translated: They have lost their wholesome qualities.

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They are disparaging,

analyzed: kha zer ba byed pa de ni mi mdzes shing tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: scolding, and criticizing. That is not good, that is not fitting. ’”🔽Then the Blessed One thought,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought this:

analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung ba de ni dge slong shing ljon pa gcod par byed pa las gyur pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Whatever little misfortune occurs is due to the monks cutting down trees.”

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na /
translated: The Blessed One thought, “Monks, that being so,

original: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: monks should not cut down trees.

original: gcod pa na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcod pa na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'brog gnas na 'brog gi gnas mchog na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'brog gnas na 'brog gi gnas mchog na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Āṭānāṭiya forest grove.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcad par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa mdzad pas /
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Master of the Dharma, the Well-Gone One,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis shing ljon pa bcad par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla dag gis zhugs shing ma mchis pas mkhar lan dag btang bar gyur to //
translated: the monks’ hands were put to work making a bridge because there were no trees.”

original: kun dga' po ngas dge slong lag gi bla'i kun du spyad pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: kun dga' po ngas dge slong lag gi bla'i kun du spyad pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
translated: “Ānanda, I will establish rules for the monks’ hands to work.

original: dge slong lag gi blas zhag bdun nam brgyad kyis shing ljon pa gcod par 'gyur pa ni shing ljon pa de'i drung du dkyil 'khor bya zhing spos dang / me tog dang / gtor ma yang sbyin par bya /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi blas zhag bdun nam brgyad kyis shing ljon pa gcod par 'gyur pa ni shing ljon pa de'i drung du dkyil 'khor bya zhing spos dang / me tog dang / gtor ma yang sbyin par bya /
translated: If a monk’s hands are put to work cutting down a tree, he should make a circle around the tree, offer incense, flowers, and a bali,

original: rgyun chags gsum pa yang klag par bya /
analyzed: rgyun chags gsum pa yang klag par bya /
translated: and recite the three-part prayer.

original: yon bshad pa yang bya zhing dge bcu'i las kyi lam dag gis bsngags pa yang brjod par bya /
analyzed: yon bshad pa yang bya zhing dge bcu'i las kyi lam dag gis bsngags pa yang brjod par bya /
translated: He should also explain the virtues of the ten paths of virtuous action.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gi bsngags pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag gi bsngags pa ma yin par yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should also speak in dispraise of the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: 'di skad ces shing ljon pa 'di la lha gang gnas pa de gnas gzhan tshol cig //
analyzed: 'di skad ces shing ljon pa 'di la lha gang gnas pa de gnas gzhan tshol cig //
translated: He should say, ‘Whatever god dwells in this tree, he should seek another dwelling place.

original: shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten gyi 'am /
analyzed: shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten gyi 'am /
translated: This tree will be used for the work of the stūpa,

original: chos kyi'am / dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi'am / dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: or for the work of the Dharma, or for the work of the Saṅgha.’

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma bdun nam brgyad kyis shing ljon pa de gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma bdun nam brgyad kyis shing ljon pa de gcad par bya'o //
translated: After that, in seven or eight days, that tree should be cut down.

original: gal te 'gyur ba ston na gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur ba ston na gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: If it shows a sign of change, it should not be cut down.

original: 'on te mi ston na gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi ston na gcad par bya'o //
translated: But if it does not show a sign, it should be cut down.

original: dge slong lag gi blas kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong lag gi blas kun du spyad pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who is a master of ritual does not practice as prescribed, he commits an offense.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the present case.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar ni mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, for a while, established the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yong na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yong na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the rules: The Blessed Buddha was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: de'i cho na dge slong drug ste dag rang gi lag gis shing ljon pa gcod cing gcod du 'jug par yang byed /
analyzed: de'i cho na dge slong drug ste dag rang gi lag gis shing ljon pa gcod cing gcod du 'jug par yang byed /
translated: At that time, six monks cut down trees with their own hands and made others cut them down.

original: rtsva sngon po rnga zhing brngar 'jug par yang byed /
analyzed: rtsva sngon po rnga zhing brngar 'jug par yang byed /
translated: They mowed green grass and made others mow it.

original: me tog dga' thog cing 'thog tu 'jug par yang @48b byed nas //
analyzed: me tog dga' thog cing 'thog tu 'jug par yang @48b byed nas //
translated: They plucked flowers and made others pluck them.

original: gzhan mu steg can dag shes ldan dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong ba 'di dag ni de ltar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan mu steg can dag shes ldan dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong ba 'di dag ni de ltar byed de /
translated: Other tīrthikas said, Sirs, these śramaṇas, sons of the Śākya,

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di dag kyang de ltar byed pas /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di dag kyang de ltar byed pas /
translated: do this, and these brahmins and householders do this as well.

original: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbong 'di dag dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di dag la byed ni ci yod /
analyzed: sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbong 'di dag dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag 'di dag la byed ni ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between these śramaṇa sons of the Śākya and these brahmins and householders?

original: bsam pa ni ci yod /
analyzed: bsam pa ni ci yod /
translated: What are they thinking?

original: tha dad du bya ba ni ci yod /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni ci yod /
translated: What are they doing?

original: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dag bya bar sems zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: su zhig dge sbyong mgo reg 'di dag la bsod snyoms sbyin pa dag bya bar sems zhes smod par byed /
translated: Who would think of giving alms to these shaven-headed śramaṇas?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They disparaged,🔽and criticized them.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident as the basis, with this event as the basis, with this occasion as the basis, gathered the community of monks and questioned the group of six:🔽“Is it true, monks, that the group of six did this?”🔽“Monks, this is not in accordance with the Dharma,🔽it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not proper,🔽and it is not allowable for renunciants.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs las da'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs las da'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon
translated: The Blessed One, having seen ten benefits, established the training rules for the disciples and recited this in the Monastic Code:

original: par bya ste /🔽sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig gam /
analyzed: par bya ste / sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig gam /
translated: The Buddha laid down this precept:

original: 'jig tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig tu 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: If you destroy or cause to destroy a seed-collection or a spirit-dwelling, you commit an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The person is one of the six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod zhen /
translated: The affliction is desire.

original: nyes pa nis bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa nis bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig pa'o //
translated: The fault is destroying a seed-collection or a spirit-dwelling.

original: de las sa bon gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa bon lnga ste rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / thog gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon nyid ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de las sa bon gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni sa bon lnga ste rtsa ba'i sa bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / thog gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon nyid ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Among them, a seed-collection is five kinds of seeds: root seeds, stem seeds, joint seeds, cutting seeds, and fruit seeds.

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa bon gang zhe na /
translated: What is a root seed?

original: gal sgang dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang / bong da dkar po dang / gzhan yang rtsa ba btab pa las rtsa ba nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal sgang dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang / bong da dkar po dang / gzhan yang rtsa ba btab pa las rtsa ba nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a root that is planted, such as ginger, turmeric, black pepper, long pepper, and white yam, and anything else that is planted as a root and grows as a root.

original: sdong bu'i sa bon gang zhen /
analyzed: sdong bu'i sa bon gang zhen /
translated: What is a stem seed?

original: shing kanytsa dang / ka pi ta la dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum w'a ra dang / nya gro dha dang / gzhan yang sdong bu btab pa las sdong bu nyid skyes ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shing kanytsa dang / ka pi ta la dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum w'a ra dang / nya gro dha dang / gzhan yang sdong bu btab pa las sdong bu nyid skyes ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The seed of a tree is the seed of a tree, such as the kaṇṭakī, the kapittha, the aśvattha, the udumbara, the nyagrodha, and the seed of any other tree.

original: thog gu'i sa bon gang zhe na /
analyzed: thog gu'i sa bon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the seed of a creeper?

original: bu ram shing dang / 'dam bu dang / smyig ma dang / rgya mtsho nas 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang thog gu btab pa las thog @49a * //🔽gu nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bu ram shing dang / 'dam bu dang / smyig ma dang / rgya mtsho nas 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang thog gu btab pa las thog @49a * // gu nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The seed of a creeper is the seed of a creeper, such as sugar cane, bamboo, reed, and the seed of any other creeper.

original: 'gas pa'i sa bon gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'gas pa'i sa bon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the seed of a tuber?

original: aardza ka dang / sardza ka dang / pha nindza ka dang / bhu stri na dang / dzam bhi ra dang / gzhan yang 'gas pa btab pa las 'gas pa nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: aardza ka dang / sardza ka dang / pha nindza ka dang / bhu stri na dang / dzam bhi ra dang / gzhan yang 'gas pa btab pa las 'gas pa nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The seed of a tuber is the seed of a tuber, such as the arjaka, the sarja, the pīlu, the bhurja, the śimśapā, and the seed of any other tuber.

original: sa bon gyis bon gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon gyis bon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the seed of a plant?

original: s'a lu dang / nas dang / gro dang / mon sran gre'u dang / mon sran sde'u dang / yungs kar dang / gzhan yang sa bon btab pa las sa bon nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: s'a lu dang / nas dang / gro dang / mon sran gre'u dang / mon sran sde'u dang / yungs kar dang / gzhan yang sa bon btab pa las sa bon nyid skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: rice, barley, wheat, beans, peas, mustard seed, and whatever else is planted and grows from seed.

original: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: 'byung po'i gnas zhes bya ba la //
translated: “A dwelling place for creatures” means

original: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni grag spur dag dang / phye ma leb dag dang / sprang bu dag dang / til dang phub ma zab dag dang / sbrul dang sdig pa dag dang / sbrang bu tre ma bu ga dag dang / treel ta ka dag go //
analyzed: 'byung po zhes bya ba ni grag spur dag dang / phye ma leb dag dang / sprang bu dag dang / til dang phub ma zab dag dang / sbrul dang sdig pa dag dang / sbrang bu tre ma bu ga dag dang / treel ta ka dag go //
translated: creatures such as ants, butterflies, moths, spiders, scorpions, bees, and centipedes.

original: de dag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'o //
translated: “A dwelling place” means a tree.🔽If he destroys them

original: de dag 'jig gam /
analyzed: de dag 'jig gam /
translated: or has them destroyed,

original: 'jig tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa dang / snyol ba dang / gcod pa dang / 'bigs pa dang / 'tsheg bdag bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
analyzed: 'jig tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa dang / snyol ba dang / gcod pa dang / 'bigs pa dang / 'tsheg bdag bdag nyid kyis byed dam gzhan byed du 'jug na'o //
translated: if he digs them up or has them dug up, if he cuts them down or has them cut down, if he breaks them or has them broken, if he pulls them out or has them pulled out, if he burns them or has them burned, if he buries them or has them buried, if he scatters them or has them scattered, if he does it himself or has it done by others,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshe par byed /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshe par byed /
translated: They burn, harm, and cause sentient beings to fall into the lower realms, such as the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.🔽They burn, harm, and cause sentient beings to fall into the lower realms, such as the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: They burn, harm, and cause sentient beings to fall into the lower realms, such as the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: gzhan yang ji srid ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na /
translated: Moreover, as long as that downfall is not confessed and disclosed,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: it obscures virtuous dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is called a downfall.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnams par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnams par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of downfalls, non-downfalls, trainings, and restorations through the main part, preparation, and preparation for preparation.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the presentation of the main part downfalls is as follows:

original: dge slong gis sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas kyis bon dang / khye'u kha 'thob par rung bar ma byas pa ma nyams pa nyid du shes bzhin du tha na rtsa rgyud yan chad thabs ji ltar yang rung bas nyams par 'dun pas rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang nyams par byas na /
analyzed: dge slong gis sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas kyis bon dang / khye'u kha 'thob par rung bar ma byas pa ma nyams pa nyid du shes bzhin du tha na rtsa rgyud yan chad thabs ji ltar yang rung bas nyams par 'dun pas rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang nyams par byas na /
translated: A monk, knowing that a collection of seeds, a place where spirits live, or a child is not fit to be destroyed, and not having made it unfit to be destroyed, destroys it himself or has it destroyed by someone else, by any means, even by a blade of grass,

original: nyams par bya ba'i sdong bu dang / 'brul la sogs pa'i grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams par bya ba'i sdong bu dang / 'brul la sogs pa'i grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i gnas 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then for each collection of seeds and each place where spirits live that is destroyed, he commits the actual downfall of destroying a collection of seeds or a place where spirits live.

original: sa bon @49b lnga po rtsa ba'i bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tog gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon ma nyams pa nyid du rung bar ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sa bon @49b lnga po rtsa ba'i bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tog gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon ma nyams pa nyid du rung bar ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the five seeds—the root seed, the seed of a cutting, the seed of a bulb, the seed of a joint, and the seed of a leaf—are not fit to be destroyed because they are not fit to be planted or they are already spoiled.

original: shing ljon pa dang / rtsva sogs pa skye ba dag gi tha na rtsa rgyud yan chad ma nyams pa nyid rung bar ma byas pa dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: shing ljon pa dang / rtsva sogs pa skye ba dag gi tha na rtsa rgyud yan chad ma nyams pa nyid rung bar ma byas pa dag la na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a fault to not make suitable the growth of trees, grass, etc.

original: nyams par bya ba'i thabs sprug par bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyams par bya ba'i thabs sprug par bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a fault to not make suitable the means of destroying, such as threshing, etc.

original: nyams par byed pa'i yo byad rtsva dang / 'dam rdzab dang / sa rdul dang / khu tshan dang / 'chag pa dang / 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / skyang nul dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sa gzhi skam por 'jog pa la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyams par byed pa'i yo byad rtsva dang / 'dam rdzab dang / sa rdul dang / khu tshan dang / 'chag pa dang / 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / skyang nul dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sa gzhi skam por 'jog pa la sogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a fault to not make suitable the articles for destruction, such as grass, mud, dust, ashes, walking, pulling, circles, smoothing, wind, sun, and placing on dry ground.

original: gzhan yang lus kyi yan lag dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des 'phangs pa sems can du bgrang bam yin pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus kyi yan lag dang / de dang 'brel pa dang / des 'phangs pa sems can du bgrang bam yin pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: Moreover, it is not a fault to not make suitable any part of the body, or what is connected with it, or what is projected by it, or any non-sentient thing.

original: sa bon dang skye ba nyams par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bla na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba nyams par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bla na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not a fault to not make suitable any intention to destroy seeds or growth.

original: rang dang gzhan gang yang rung pas byas sam /🔽byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gang yang rung pas byas sam / byed du bcug pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: Whether it is done by oneself or by another,🔽there is no offense if one does not regret it.

original: nyams par gyur pa na dngos gzi lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa na dngos gzi lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is insane.🔽In the case of seeds, for each seed that is damaged, whether internally or externally,

original: sa bon la ni sbubs dang / thog gu dang / snye ma'i nang dang / phyi rol na nyams par bya ba'i 'bru grangs ji snyed pa re re la ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sa bon la ni sbubs dang / thog gu dang / snye ma'i nang dang / phyi rol na nyams par bya ba'i 'bru grangs ji snyed pa re re la ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go //
translated: such as in a pod, a husk, a bunch, or on the outside,🔽one is to be established in a downfall.

original: skye ba la ni nyams par bya ba sdong bu'i grangs ji snyed pa re re la ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go //🔽nyams par byed pa'i yo byad kyang sa de na 'bru gcig gam /
analyzed: skye ba la ni nyams par bya ba sdong bu'i grangs ji snyed pa re re la ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go // nyams par byed pa'i yo byad kyang sa de na 'bru gcig gam /
translated: In the case of sprouts, for each sprout that is damaged,🔽one is to be established in a downfall.🔽The implements of damage are whatever substances are used to damage a single seed🔽or a single sprout.

original: sdong bu drung pa gcig la bsnun pa'i rdzas ji snyed par re re la /
analyzed: sdong bu drung pa gcig la bsnun pa'i rdzas ji snyed par re re la /
translated: For each of those,

original: ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ltung ba re rer rnam par gzhag go //
translated: one is to be established in a downfall.

original: shing ljon pa la sogs par rang gi gnas nas rtsa ba bton du gdon pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bton na bton pa de gnas gzhan du bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: shing ljon pa la sogs par rang gi gnas nas rtsa ba bton du gdon pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas bton na bton pa de gnas gzhan du bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang na smad pa med do //
translated: If one pulls up a tree, etc. from its place, by the method of pulling up its roots, etc. , even though it is pulled up, it is not reprehensible, because it is to be regenerated in another place.

original: nya lcibs dang / nya tshong dag chu nas bton na skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yin du zin kyang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nya lcibs dang / nya tshong dag chu nas bton na skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yin du zin kyang na smad pa med do //
translated: If one pulls out a fish from the water, or a bird from its nest, even though it is to be regenerated, it is not reprehensible.

original: sa bon dang skye ba gzhan dag la gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba gzhan dag la gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If one has the idea that the seed and the sprout are different, it is not reprehensible.

original: sa bon dang skye ba la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If one has the idea that the seed and the sprout are the same, or if one is in doubt about it, it is not reprehensible.

original: shun pa dang / phri dang / 'dab ma skya bo dang / @50a * //
analyzed: shun pa dang / phri dang / 'dab ma skya bo dang / @50a * //
translated: If one cuts the bark, the branches, the dry leaves,

original: me tog kha byed ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa de dag gi rtsa bar gyur ba rang bzhin las ma bye ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: me tog kha byed ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa de dag gi rtsa bar gyur ba rang bzhin las ma bye ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: or the flowers and fruits of a tree, which are not the root, it is not reprehensible.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sa bon dang / khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag gis ma nyams pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sa bon dang / khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag gis ma nyams pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa bo nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is the seed, and the boy who is not fit to be spoken to.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, there is a downfall of the main part with eleven limbs.

original: sa bon dang / khye'u kha 'thon ba rung ba ma byas pa dang / ma nyams pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / thabs gang yang rung ba dang / nyams par byas pa nyid do /
analyzed: sa bon dang / khye'u kha 'thon ba rung ba ma byas pa dang / ma nyams pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gang yang rung ba dang / thabs gang yang rung ba dang / nyams par byas pa nyid do /
translated: The seed, the boy who is not fit to be spoken to, the non-defective state, oneself or another, any suitable means, and the act of defiling.

original: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs pa ra na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs pa ra na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is missing, one is guilty of a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du sa bon dang / skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du sa bon dang / skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfalls of seed and birth, but has not reached the main part, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each main part that one has begun, there is a minor offense.

original: sa bon dang sdong bu nyams bar bya ba'i grangs ji snyed par re re la sbyor ba'i nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang sdong bu nyams bar bya ba'i grangs ji snyed par re re la sbyor ba'i nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each seed or stalk that is damaged, there is a fault.

original: de dag la nyams par byed pa'i yo byad bsnun pa'i rdzas kyi grangs re re'i sbyor ba la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: de dag la nyams par byed pa'i yo byad bsnun pa'i rdzas kyi grangs re re'i sbyor ba la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each substance that is used to damage them, there is a fault.

original: tshi gu ma bcom bar ril mid byed pa la nyes byas so /
analyzed: tshi gu ma bcom bar ril mid byed pa la nyes byas so /
translated: If one swallows a seed without breaking the husk, there is an offense.

original: gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes gzhogs kyis bcol na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes gzhogs kyis bcol na nyes byas so //
translated: If one says, “It would be good if this were cut down,” there is an offense.

original: sa bon dang skye ba ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one damages a seed or a sprout, or if one is unsure of it, there is an offense.

original: shun pa dang / phri dang / 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pas de dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: shun pa dang / phri dang / 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pas de dag la nyes byas so //
translated: If one damages the bark, the sap, the yellow leaves, the open flowers, or the ripe fruit, there is an offense, because these are considered to be half-dead.

original: autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i chu ba gcod pa dang / pha bong gi dreg pa 'chu na nyes byas so //
analyzed: autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i chu ba gcod pa dang / pha bong gi dreg pa 'chu na nyes byas so //
translated: If one cuts the stalk of an open lotus flower, or if one digs up the roots of a tree, there is an offense.

original: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pas de la nyes byas so /
analyzed: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pas de la nyes byas so /
translated: The fault is committed when one designates as half-grown that which has not grown roots, having sown the seed-element.

original: sa 'bus pa dang / sha rmo dang / sha ba la dang / snod dang gsol la sogs pa'i rlan rnams kyang phyed skyes ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pas de dag la yang nye byas so //
analyzed: sa 'bus pa dang / sha rmo dang / sha ba la dang / snod dang gsol la sogs pa'i rlan rnams kyang phyed skyes ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pas de dag la yang nye byas so //
translated: The fault is also committed when one designates as half-grown that which is already grown, such as a sprout, a shoot, a stalk, a vessel, a plate, and so on.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas pra mo ste /🔽sbyor ba ni snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas pra mo ste / sbyor ba ni snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The fault of a fault of preparation is a minor fault.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi @50b sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi @50b sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation is the same as the preparation of the fault, and the preparation of the preparation of the fault is also a minor fault.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //🔽ltung ba med pa ni nyams pa nyid dang / rung bar byas pa dag la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o // ltung ba med pa ni nyams pa nyid dang / rung bar byas pa dag la ltung ba med do //
translated: It is a minor fault.🔽There is no fault when one is impaired or has made it suitable.

original: deng 'dun ba dang / der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: deng 'dun ba dang / der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no fault when one is not intent on it or does not perceive it as such.

original: phongs pa'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyis gcod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: phongs pa'i tshe rdzu 'phrul gyis gcod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one cuts with magical power when in need.

original: 'u sh'i khu tshan la sogs pa dob ba dang / 'chag pa dang / yan lag la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul dang byed pa la de dag gi bsam pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'u sh'i khu tshan la sogs pa dob ba dang / 'chag pa dang / yan lag la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyang nul dang byed pa la de dag gi bsam pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one digs the earth, walks on it, or draws lines on it with one’s limbs, etc., with the intention of making a mandala or a design, or for the sake of one’s health.

original: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa de ni mi thar na bcad pa la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa de ni mi thar na bcad pa la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one cuts grass, etc., when in need, but one must untie it if it is tied, or if it is bound with kuśa grass, etc., one must untie it.

original: dge slong du ma rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa de dag gis mi thar na de dag las dge slong gcig gis bcad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong du ma rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa de dag gis mi thar na de dag las dge slong gcig gis bcad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if many monks are bound with kuśa grass, etc., and one of them cuts it.

original: sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin pas sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa de nyams par byas kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin pas sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa de nyams par byas kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one destroys the nature of seeds, because it is not an offense to destroy what is morally neutral.

original: mes rig pa dang / mtshon dang / sen mo dang / ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang / rnyis pa dang / phyung ba dang / bkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / bcad pa lta bu dag gis rung ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: mes rig pa dang / mtshon dang / sen mo dang / ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang / rnyis pa dang / phyung ba dang / bkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / bcad pa lta bu dag gis rung ba nyid yin pas /
translated: It is suitable if it is a wound from fire, a weapon, a fingernail, or a parrot, or if it is a wound from a snare, a wound from a thorn, a burn, a boil, a cut, or a bite.

original: des de dag la dge slong gis brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos kyang mi dgos la /
analyzed: des de dag la dge slong gis brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos kyang mi dgos la /
translated: If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.

original: de dag nyams par byas pa la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de dag nyams par byas pa la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.🔽And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.🔽And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.🔽And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.🔽And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.

original: 'brul la sogs pa dag brtag pas rung bar byed pa ni ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du de la bsdad mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'brul la sogs pa dag brtag pas rung bar byed pa ni ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du de la bsdad mi dgos te /
translated: And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.

original: brtag pa tsam byas pa nyid rung ba yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: brtag pa tsam byas pa nyid rung ba yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
translated: And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.🔽And if he damages it, there is no offense.🔽If a wound is suitable for a monk, he does not need to rely on another to examine it.

original: 'brul la sogs pa dag brtag pas rung bar bya ba la me dang rlangs pa nyid ni 'dra bas de gnyis gang gis brtags kyang rung ba nyid yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'brul la sogs pa dag brtag pas rung bar bya ba la me dang rlangs pa nyid ni 'dra bas de gnyis gang gis brtags kyang rung ba nyid yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
translated: And if he damages it, there is no offense.

original: rgun 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag me'i brtag pas rung bar byas pa la spyi'i tshems spyi bungs su bcer ba la mes phyogs gnyis sam /
analyzed: rgun 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag me'i brtag pas rung bar byas pa la spyi'i tshems spyi bungs su bcer ba la mes phyogs gnyis sam /
translated: If grapes and so on are burned by fire to make them suitable, and then are placed in a general container, if they are burned on two or three sides by fire, they are suitable for all.

original: gsum la brtag na thams cad rung ba nyid yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gsum la brtag na thams cad rung ba nyid yin pas de la ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense for that.

original: dge slong gzhan gyi mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa mtshon dang / sen mo la sogs pas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar byas pa nyid ni dge slong gzhan rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa mtshon dang / sen mo la sogs pas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar byas pa nyid ni dge slong gzhan rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do /
translated: Except for making them suitable by the fire of another fully ordained monk, if the five types of seeds are made suitable by a knife, fingernails and so on, they are suitable for another fully ordained monk. Therefore, there is no offense for that.

original: @51a * // rung bar byed pa'i dge slong nyid la ni sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @51a * // rung bar byed pa'i dge slong nyid la ni sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the fully ordained monk who makes them suitable commits the downfall of destroying a collection of seeds.

original: mes rung bas byas pa ni de byed pa'i dge slong la yang sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur la de za ba la yang dge slong gis btsos pa za ba'i gsog 'jog gi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes rung bas byas pa ni de byed pa'i dge slong la yang sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur la de za ba la yang dge slong gis btsos pa za ba'i gsog 'jog gi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are made suitable by fire, the fully ordained monk who does that commits the downfall of destroying a collection of seeds and if he eats them, he commits the downfall of storing and eating what is cooked by a fully ordained monk.

original: rung ba'i khang pa ma yin pa'i sa rung ba ma yin par 'bru la sogs pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa ma yin pa'i sa rung ba ma yin par 'bru la sogs pa gzhag ste /
translated: If one places grain and so on on an unconsecrated surface in a place that is not suitable,

original: dge tshul la sogs pas mes rung bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pas mes rung bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin pas /
translated: then if a novice and so on consecrates it with fire, it is consecrated and

original: de la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: there is no offense.

original: sman zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcangs pa chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi ba ste /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcangs pa chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi ba ste /
translated: One should not eat medicine that is to be held for seven days or for life unless it is mixed with cold water.

original: des gtor na rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: des gtor na rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is mixed with water, it is suitable and there is no offense.

original: thun tshod du rung ba yang chu grang mos ma gtor bar btung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba yang chu grang mos ma gtor bar btung bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not drink what is suitable for one period unless it is mixed with cold water.

original: des gtor na rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: des gtor na rung ba nyid yin pas de la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: If it is mixed with water, it is suitable and there is no offense.

original: zhag bdun pa la ni mes rung bar bya ba mi srid do //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la ni mes rung bar bya ba mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to consecrate with fire that which is to be held for seven days.

original: rung bar bya ba ni gang gis dus su byas kyang rung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba ni gang gis dus su byas kyang rung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Consecration is that which is suitable to be done at any time.

original: bza' ba'i dus kho nar bya bar ni ma nges so //
analyzed: bza' ba'i dus kho nar bya bar ni ma nges so //
translated: It is not definite that it must be done only at the time of eating.

original: de dag ni rung bar bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pas zhar la smos par zad kyi skabs 'di'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag par gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rung bar bya ba dang 'brel pa yin pas zhar la smos par zad kyi skabs 'di'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag par gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since these are related to what is permissible, they are mentioned incidentally, but they are not included in the presentation of downfalls in this context.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall for beginners, those who are insane, those whose minds are disturbed, and those who are overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du sa bon dang / skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du sa bon dang / skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training is that a monk should train in not engaging in any way in the downfalls that destroy seeds and sprouts in all places and at all times.

original: dge slong lag gi blas mchod rten dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi don du shing ljon pa dag gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lag gi blas mchod rten dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi don du shing ljon pa dag gcad par bya'o //
translated: A monk who is a skilled worker should cut down trees for the sake of a stūpa, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: gcad par bya ba'i phyir sta gon bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du nyi ma bdun nam /
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i phyir sta gon bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du nyi ma bdun nam /
translated: In order to cut them down, he should prepare by reciting the following mantra in front of the tree for seven days:

original: brgyad nas de'i drung du dkyil 'khor dang / dri dang / ma tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang gtor ma sbyin pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa dang sbyin pa bshad par byas nas /🔽lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa 'di dag gnas gzhan tshol cig / shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten dang / chos @51b sam /
analyzed: brgyad nas de'i drung du dkyil 'khor dang / dri dang / ma tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang gtor ma sbyin pa dang / rgyun chags gsum pa gdon pa dang sbyin pa bshad par byas nas / lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa 'di dag gnas gzhan tshol cig / shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten dang / chos @51b sam /
translated: the drawing of the mandala, the offering of scents, flowers, incense, lamps, and food, the recitation of the three-part formula, and the giving of the gift.

original: dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas /
translated: Then he should say, “Whatever gods are dwelling in this tree, seek another dwelling. This tree will be used for the purposes of the stupa, the Dharma, and the Sangha.”

original: dge slong lag gi bla /
analyzed: dge slong lag gi bla /
translated: The monk who is the ritual master

original: smra ba pos rang gi lag dar te mi gcad par khyim pa shing mkhan la sogs pa la shes par gyis shig ces zur gyis bsgo ste gcod du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba pos rang gi lag dar te mi gcad par khyim pa shing mkhan la sogs pa la shes par gyis shig ces zur gyis bsgo ste gcod du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: should not cut the tree himself, but should instruct a householder, such as a carpenter, to do it.

original: de ltar shing ljon pa de gcod du bcug pa na gal te me 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar shing ljon pa de gcod du bcug pa na gal te me 'byung ba 'am /
translated: If, when the tree is being cut, it catches fire,

original: khrag 'dzag pa 'am /
analyzed: khrag 'dzag pa 'am /
translated: or blood flows from it,

original: yal ga 'gul ba 'am /
analyzed: yal ga 'gul ba 'am /
translated: or the branches shake,

original: lo ma lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na /
analyzed: lo ma lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na /
translated: or the leaves fall off, and so on,

original: de'i tshe lag gi bla des mchod rten nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe lag gi bla des mchod rten nam /
translated: At that time, the one who was the king’s priest then is none other than this one.🔽

original: chos sam / dge 'dun bsod nams kyi zhing la sbyin pa dang / ser sna dag gis bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun bsod nams kyi zhing la sbyin pa dang / ser sna dag gis bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: At that time, the one who is the hand of the preceptor should praise or disparage the field of merit, such as a stūpa, the Dharma, or the Saṅgha, with gifts, and with stinginess.

original: de ltar byas kyang mi 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mi gtong na shing ljon pa de gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang mi 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mi gtong na shing ljon pa de gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: If, even though he has done that, he does not give up the transformation, such as not speaking, then that tree should not be cut down.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed de bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed de bcu gcig pa bshad zin to /
translated: The eleventh, the downfall of destroying seeds and crops, has been explained.

original: // /'phya ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // /'phya ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the downfall of mocking

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandakanivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun gyis gnas mal 'bogs pa dang / zas la bsko bar bskos pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa gyad bu nor dge 'dun gyis gnas mal 'bogs pa dang / zas la bsko bar bskos pa'i tshe na /
