analyzed: 'dun pa la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having understood the situation, gathered the saṅgha of monks and asked the monks,🔽“Monks, is it true that you are doing this?”🔽“It is not suitable for a monk to do this.🔽It is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not in accordance with the Vinaya.🔽It is not suitable for a monk to do this.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: He criticized them in many ways.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he established the following training rule for my listeners:

original: bsgo ba rnal gzon na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: bsgo ba rnal gzon na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If you do not comply with a monk’s instructions, you commit an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
translated: The place was in Kauśāmbī.

original: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
translated: The person was Saṅgharakṣita.

original: nyon mongs pa ni log thabs byed pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni log thabs byed pa /
translated: The affliction was wrong-doing.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'o //🔽de la bsgo ba rnal gzon na zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i bsam bas /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'o // de la bsgo ba rnal gzon na zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i bsam bas /
translated: The offense was a monk not complying with a monk’s instructions.🔽“If you do not comply with a monk’s instructions” means that you do not comply with a monk’s instructions with the intention of not complying with his instructions.

original: ngag dang / tshig dang / tha snyad dang / skad dang/ brjod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / tshig gi lam dang / ngag gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed brjod na'o// ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag dang / tshig dang / tha snyad dang / skad dang/ brjod pa dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / tshig gi lam dang / ngag gi las dang / ngag gi rnam par rig byed brjod na'o// ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “You commit an offense entailing confession” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “What is an offense entailing confession?”🔽“Not complying with a monk’s instructions” means:

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this [downfall] should be understood through the main part, the preparatory act, the preparatory act of the preparatory act, the downfall, the absence of downfall, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gleng par gtogs pa bsgo ba tshig gis rnal gzon par 'dun pas gzhan brjod pas rnal gzon na bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gleng par gtogs pa bsgo ba tshig gis rnal gzon par 'dun pas gzhan brjod pas rnal gzon na bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the main part of the downfall is as follows: If a fully ordained monk, when ordered by other monks to do something that is part of a legal procedure, acts in a way that is contrary to the procedure out of a desire to act in a way that is contrary to the procedure, he commits the main part of the downfall of acting in a way that is contrary to the procedure.

original: dge slong rnams kyis gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba @55a * //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba @55a * //
translated: If the fully ordained monks order him to do something that is part of a legal procedure,

original: tshig gis rnal gzon pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: tshig gis rnal gzon pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in acting in a way that is contrary to the procedure.

original: rnal gzon par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rnal gzon par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he has any of the usual attitudes of a person who desires to act in a way that is contrary to the procedure.

original: ci tsam du gzhan 'dri ba la lan gzhan 'debs pa thams cad la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ci tsam du gzhan 'dri ba la lan gzhan 'debs pa thams cad la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he answers a question with a different question.

original: 'dis log thabs smras so //
analyzed: 'dis log thabs smras so //
translated: This is a deceptive statement.🔽

original: zhes nyan pa pos don go ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zhes nyan pa pos don go ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the listener understands the meaning.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gis gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba tshig gis rnal gzon pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong gis gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba tshig gis rnal gzon pa'o //
translated: The agent of this downfall is a monk who is being admonished for engaging in disputes and who refuses to comply with the admonishments.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall is accrued by the following ten factors:

original: dge slong gis dang / gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba dang / de'i tshig gis rnal gzon pa dang / der 'dun pa dang / dge 'dun gyis de'i grangs su bcug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dang / gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba dang / de'i tshig gis rnal gzon pa dang / der 'dun pa dang / dge 'dun gyis de'i grangs su bcug pa'o //
translated: a monk, being admonished for engaging in disputes, refusing to comply with the admonishments, being intent on that, and the saṅgha having included him in the proceedings.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall is accrued by the preparatory stage of a serious transgression.

original: ji srid du bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as the monk who is being admonished for engaging in disputes has not reached the point of refusing to comply with the admonishments, he has committed a serious transgression.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparatory stages of the actual downfall that he has undertaken, he has committed a serious transgression.

original: dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong nyams pa dang / ma chags pa'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one orders a monk who has broken his vows or who is not celibate, it is a minor offense.

original: dge slong ma'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one orders a nun, it is a minor offense.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i bsgo ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one orders someone who has not taken full ordination, it is a minor offense.

original: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa'i rtags can dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i bsgo ba la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa'i rtags can dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / dud 'gro'i bsgo ba la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If one orders a renunciant who is not a Buddhist, someone who wears the attire of a layperson, a nonhuman, or an animal, it is a downfall.

original: gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gleng bar gtogs pa'i bsgo ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not order someone who is supposed to be ordered, it is a minor offense.

original: cang mi smra bas rnal gzon na nyes byas so //
analyzed: cang mi smra bas rnal gzon na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not respond to an order by remaining silent, it is a minor offense.

original: mi dran no zhes rnal gzon na nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi dran no zhes rnal gzon na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not respond to an order by saying that one does not remember, it is a minor offense.

original: nyan pa pos don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyan pa pos don ma go ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not understand the meaning of what one hears, it is a minor offense.

original: dge 'dun gyis de'i grang su ma bcug pa la nyes byas so //🔽sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis de'i grang su ma bcug pa la nyes byas so // sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i lhung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: If one does not join the saṅgha when ordered to do so, it is a minor offense.🔽The minor offenses that are downfalls are subtle downfalls.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many subtle downfalls as there are ways of engaging in them.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation is a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The actual basis is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni der 'dun pa med pa dang / gzhan la brjod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni der 'dun pa med pa dang / gzhan la brjod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has no desire to kill, or if one tells another person.

original: gal te brjod par bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar gyur pa yin na gzhan brjod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te brjod par bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar gyur pa yin na gzhan brjod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: If one is to be killed, there is no offense if one tells another person.

original: de'i @55b phyir gsad par bya ba mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba la re zhig me 'di shig / re zhig skom 'thung shig / re zhig gang la so shig / nam mkha' mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i @55b phyir gsad par bya ba mthong ngam zhes 'dri ba la re zhig me 'di shig / re zhig skom 'thung shig / re zhig gang la so shig / nam mkha' mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, if someone asks, “Have you seen the one to be killed?” one may say, “First put out this fire! First drink this water! First eat this food! First sharpen this knife! First look at the sky!

original: sen mo mthong ngo //
analyzed: sen mo mthong ngo //
translated: First look at my nails!”

original: don dam par ni sems can nam gsad par bya ba mthon ngo zhes smra na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni sems can nam gsad par bya ba mthon ngo zhes smra na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one says, “In the ultimate sense, I have not seen any sentient being to be killed,” there is no offense.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i lhung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i lhung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not relying on a monk who is being expelled for not complying with a decree in any place and at any time.

original: gang du che bzhi nyid bya dgos par gyur ba'i gnas der bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang du che bzhi nyid bya dgos par gyur ba'i gnas der bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not rely on him in a place where he is required to do the four-month probation.

original: gnod pa'i sgo ma bcad pas che bzhi dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i sgo ma bcad pas che bzhi dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not do the four-month probation if the door to confession has not been opened.

original: dge slong gis bsgo ba'i tshig gis rnal gzon pa dang cang mi smra bas na rnal gzon pa dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis bsgo ba rnal gzon pa dang cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa'i grangs su mi gzhug par mi bya'o //🔽bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis bsgo ba'i tshig gis rnal gzon pa dang cang mi smra bas na rnal gzon pa dge 'dun gyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis bsgo ba rnal gzon pa dang cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa'i grangs su mi gzhug par mi bya'o // bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: A monk who is being expelled for not complying with a decree in any place and at any time should not be made to sit in the last row of the Sangha by a monk who is being expelled for not complying with a decree in any place and at any time, or by a monk who is being expelled for not complying with a decree in any place and at any time by remaining silent.🔽The monk who is being expelled for not complying with a decree in any place and at any time should be made to sit in the last row of the Sangha in the following way.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i rdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i rdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: The bedding should be laid out, the gandi should be struck, and the monks should be summoned by having the announcement made three times.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o //🔽'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o // 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: When the entire Saṅgha is present and agrees, a single monk should make the announcement.🔽This is how it should be done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit down and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: ‘Venerables, please listen!

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa ni ltung ba byung yang chos bzhin du slar mi bgyid de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa ni ltung ba byung yang chos bzhin du slar mi bgyid de /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita has committed an offense but is not making amends for it according to the rule.

original: 'di la dge slong don 'tshal ba /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong don 'tshal ba /
translated: The monks who know what is right and who want what is right,

original: phan pa 'tshal ba /🔽bde ba 'tshal ba /
analyzed: phan pa 'tshal ba / bde ba 'tshal ba /
translated: who want benefit,🔽who want happiness,

original: bde ba la reg par 'tshal ba /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par 'tshal ba /
translated: who want to be happy,

original: grub pa dang / bde ba 'tshal ba rnams kyis gzhi des glengs kyang /
analyzed: grub pa dang / bde ba 'tshal ba rnams kyis gzhi des glengs kyang /
translated: who want success and happiness, have brought this up.🔽If the Saṅgha is ready, it should agree to the monks’ announcement to Saṅgharakṣita.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bsgo ba rna la gzon na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i grangs su stsal to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bsgo ba rna la gzon na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa bsgo ba rnal gzon pa'i grangs su stsal to //
translated: The Saṅgha is now announcing to the venerable Saṅgharakṣita

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: cang mi smra bas rnal gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa ni 'di @56a * //
analyzed: cang mi smra bas rnal gzon pa'i grangs su gzhug pa ni 'di @56a * //
translated: The one who is silent is to be counted as one who is patient.

original: ltar bya ste /
analyzed: ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: After arranging the seats and ringing the gong to ask if there is any business, he should inform the monks properly.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba bya'o //
translated: When the entire Saṅgha is seated and in agreement, a monk should make a motion.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should sit and say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa 'di ltung ba byung yang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa 'di ltung ba byung yang /
translated: This Venerable Saṅghasena has committed an offense,

original: chos bzhin slar mi bgyid de /
analyzed: chos bzhin slar mi bgyid de /
translated: but he does not make amends according to the Dharma.

original: 'di la dge slong don 'tshal ba /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong don 'tshal ba /
translated: The monks who know the meaning,

original: phan pa 'tshal pa /🔽bde ba 'tshal ba /
analyzed: phan pa 'tshal pa / bde ba 'tshal ba /
translated: who seek benefit,🔽who seek happiness,

original: bde ba la reg par 'tshal ba /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par 'tshal ba /
translated: who seek to be happy,

original: grub pa dang bde bar 'tshal ba rnams kyis gzhi des glengs kyang /
analyzed: grub pa dang bde bar 'tshal ba rnams kyis gzhi des glengs kyang /
translated: who seek accomplishment and happiness, should bring this up as a basis.

original: dge slong rnams la cang mi smra bas rna la gzon na /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la cang mi smra bas rna la gzon na /
translated: If the monks remain silent, they are to be counted as patient.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable,🔽the Saṅgha will agree to the Saṅgha’s giving the monk Aṅgulimāla a censure transaction for his speaking in this way.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa'i grangs su stsal to //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa cang mi smra bas rna la gzon pa'i grangs su stsal to //
translated: The Saṅgha has given the monk Aṅgulimāla a censure transaction for his speaking in this way.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i ltung byed de bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsgo ba rna la gzon pa'i ltung byed de bcu gsum pa bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of disobeying an instruction to confess one’s faults has been explained.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Compendium of Determinations, a commentary on the monastic code

original: bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
translated: Volume Twenty-One

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The introduction to the downfall on bedding and seats has two parts: a section on the rules, and a section on the exceptions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The section on the rules. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Prince Jeta’s grove, in the park given by Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis sangs rgyas la sogs ba dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag gcig gis sangs rgyas la sogs ba dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
translated: The saṅgha of monks had already arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so /
translated: but the Blessed One was still in the state of post-meditative absorption, having accomplished his alms round.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu ldas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon bar sgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu ldas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon bar sgrub par mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas remain in the state of post-meditative absorption, having accomplished their alms round, for ten reasons.

original: lda gang zhe na /
analyzed: lda gang zhe na /
translated: What are those ten?

original: nang du yang dag 'jog bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa la lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / @56b 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pa dang /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa la lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / @56b 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pa dang /
translated: They are: the wish to remain in meditative equipoise; the wish to teach the Dharma to the gods; the wish to see the sick; the wish to inspect the sleeping quarters; the wish to establish the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya;

original: don 'di ni bcom ldan 'das gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon bar sgrub pa mdzad do /
analyzed: don 'di ni bcom ldan 'das gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon bar sgrub pa mdzad do /
translated: The Blessed One, wishing to inspect the bedding and wishing to establish a basis for training the śrāvakas in the Vinaya, was staying in Śrāvastī and had manifested the alms round.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas lde mig bsnams te kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas lde mig bsnams te kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, knowing that it had not been long since the saṅgha of monks had left, took his key and went from park to park,

original: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
translated: from temple to temple,

original: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
analyzed: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
translated: from house to house,

original: 'chag sar dang / gol bar gshegs shing mthar gyis gshegs pa na khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang zhig ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: 'chag sar dang / gol bar gshegs shing mthar gyis gshegs pa na khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang zhig ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: wandering and gradually arriving at a large temple.

original: de'i tshe na khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang de na gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla ga ba med par gzhag cing dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po yang 'dus par gzigs nas /🔽ae ma'o zhes gsungs shing smad nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang de na gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla ga ba med par gzhag cing dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po yang 'dus par gzigs nas / ae ma'o zhes gsungs shing smad nas /
translated: At that time, he saw that in the temple of the great house, many beds were left uncovered and a great untimely cloud had gathered.🔽He said, Alas! and criticized them.

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: He thought,

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pa gas pa dang sha dang / khrag dag btsir cing btsir cing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pa gas pa dang sha dang / khrag dag btsir cing btsir cing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
translated: The faithful brahmans and householders, squeezing their flesh, blood and bones, give gifts and make merit.

original: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed do snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed do snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: The monks do not know the proper amount and consume it without discrimination.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po de phyir dgag pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po de phyir dgag pa mdzad de /
translated: Thinking this, he magically stopped the great untimely cloud.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyis dgag pa mdzad pas de steng gi bar snang la chu lon lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul gyis dgag pa mdzad pas de steng gi bar snang la chu lon lta bur gyur te /
translated: Because the Bhagavan stopped it with his magic, it became like a dam in the sky.

original: mtha' nar bar 'dug cing shas cher bcom ldan 'das la sdod cing 'dug go //
analyzed: mtha' nar bar 'dug cing shas cher bcom ldan 'das la sdod cing 'dug go //
translated: and he remained there, mostly in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas mal rab tu mang po de dag skyabs yod par brubs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas mal rab tu mang po de dag skyabs yod par brubs nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having had the many beds and bedding carried to a sheltered place,

original: dbyar gyi na bza' ras chen bsnams te /
analyzed: dbyar gyi na bza' ras chen bsnams te /
translated: took the great cloth of the rainy season

original: sku bsil bar bzed nas bang rim na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sku bsil bar bzed nas bang rim na bzhugs so //
translated: and sat on the terrace to cool his body.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po de dgag pa'i rdzu 'phrul de slar bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po de dgag pa'i rdzu 'phrul de slar bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew his miraculous power to stop that untimely great cloud.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul de slar bsdu bar mdzad nas 'brug grags shing char gyis gshong dang thang thams cad tshim par gyur to //🔽de @57a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzu 'phrul de slar bsdu bar mdzad nas 'brug grags shing char gyis gshong dang thang thams cad tshim par gyur to // de @57a * //
translated: When the Blessed One withdrew his miracle, thunder roared and rain satisfied all the valleys and plains.🔽Then the Blessed One,

original: nas bcom ldan 'das sku bsil nas zhabs gnyis bsil te /
analyzed: nas bcom ldan 'das sku bsil nas zhabs gnyis bsil te /
translated: having cooled his body and washed his feet,

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: went to the monastery to enter into meditation.

original: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das gal nga der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das gal nga der song ngo //
translated: Then the monk who had gone for alms, having received alms, went to the Blessed One.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, by the very nature of things, ask the monk who has gone for alms, “Monk, was the food good?

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas /
translated: Did you satisfy the community of monks?” and they ask them in this way to make them happy.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam / dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa /
translated: So the Blessed One asked the monk who had gone for alms, “Monk, was the food good?🔽Did you satisfy the community of monks?”

original: btsun ba te por zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par bgyis so //
analyzed: btsun ba te por zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par bgyis so //
translated: He replied, “Venerable, the food was good and I satisfied the community of monks.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol du zhabs gnyis bsil te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol du zhabs gnyis bsil te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having finished his meal, washed his feet outside the monastery,

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slad du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: and then entered the monastery for the sake of proper seclusion.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: Then, in the evening, the Blessed One rose from his seclusion and took his place on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he had sat down, the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag ngas 'di na dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par shes nas lde mig khyer te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas 'di na dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par shes nas lde mig khyer te /
translated: “Monks, knowing that it had not been long since the community of monks had left, I took my key

original: kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
translated: and went from park to park,

original: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
translated: from monastery to monastery,

original: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
analyzed: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
translated: from house to house,

original: 'chag sa nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar song zhing mthar gyis 'gro ba na /
analyzed: 'chag sa nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar song zhing mthar gyis 'gro ba na /
translated: from walkway to walkway, and so on,

original: khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang zhig ga la ba der phyin na /
analyzed: khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang zhig ga la ba der phyin na /
translated: until I came to a certain monastery called Mahāvihāra.

original: khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang de na gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla gab med par gzhag cing dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po 'dus par mthong ngo //
analyzed: khang pa chen po'i gtsug lag khang de na gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla gab med par gzhag cing dus ma yin pa'i sprin chen po 'dus par mthong ngo //
translated: In the great temple of the great house, he saw many beds and seats set out in the open, and a great untimely cloud gathering.

original: mthong nas kyang ae ma'o zhes byas te smad nas /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang ae ma'o zhes byas te smad nas /
translated: Having seen that, he said, Oh! and criticized it,

original: 'di snyam du bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad ba can dag gis pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag @57b dag btsir cing btsir sbyin pa dag sbyin /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bram ze dang / khyim bdag dad ba can dag gis pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag @57b dag btsir cing btsir sbyin pa dag sbyin /
translated: thinking, The faithful brahmins and householders give gifts after squeezing their skin, flesh, and blood.🔽While they are making merit, the monks do not know moderation and consume without discernment.

original: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong ngag drod mi shes pa dang so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod do snyam du dgongs shing dge slong dag khyed kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba la drod ran par yongs su longs spyod
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong ngag drod mi shes pa dang so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod do snyam du dgongs shing dge slong dag khyed kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba la drod ran par yongs su longs spyod
translated: Thinking this, he said, Monks, you should consume the offerings of the faithful with moderation.

original: pa dang / spang zhing yongs su longs spyod pa dang / dus su yongs su longs spyod pa dang / brtag cing yongs su longs spyod pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyod na legs so //
analyzed: pa dang / spang zhing yongs su longs spyod pa dang / dus su yongs su longs spyod pa dang / brtag cing yongs su longs spyod pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyod na legs so //
translated: “It is good to use in moderation, to give up, to use at the right time, to use after examination, and to use gradually.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drod ran pa dang / spangs pa dang / dus dang / brtag pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drod ran pa dang / spangs pa dang / dus dang / brtag pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One praised moderate use, giving up, the right time, examination, and gradual use.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi khri'am /🔽khri'u 'am / stan nang tshangs can nam /🔽la ba 'am /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi khri'am / khri'u 'am / stan nang tshangs can nam / la ba 'am /
translated: Seeing the ten benefits of laying down the rules, he said, “Therefore, the training should be undertaken in this way:

original: sngas sam / gor bu blag ba med par bting ngam 'dir du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: sngas sam / gor bu blag ba med par bting ngam 'dir du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: ‘If a monk spreads out or has someone else spread out a sitting mat on a bed or bench belonging to the Sangha, or a woolen or cotton sheet, or a pillow, or a mattress, and then departs without putting it away or having it put away, or without informing anyone, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If a monk goes there without being invited, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rab tu mang po /
translated: The persons were many monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed pa /
translated: The affliction was not knowing the proper amount and not being discriminating in one’s use.

original: nyes pa ni gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla gab med par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gnas mal rab tu mang po dag bla gab med par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The fault was that many beds and seats were left outside.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background of the allowance is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag 'gron pa don mthun dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ba na ri brags shig tu phyin nas /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag 'gron pa don mthun dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ba na ri brags shig tu phyin nas /
translated: Many monks were traveling with a caravan. They arrived at a hill station.🔽They began to look for a place to stay. A man said to them,

original: de dag gis ri brags der gnas btsal bar brtsams pa dang / ri brags de na gtsug lag khang zhig yod na de dag la mi zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis ri brags der gnas btsal bar brtsams pa dang / ri brags de na gtsug lag khang zhig yod na de dag la mi zhig gis smras pa /
translated: “There is a temple here. You can stay there.”

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gtsug lag khang du mi gnas sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gtsug lag khang du mi gnas sam /
translated: “Noble ones, why don’t you stay in the monastery?”

original: bzhin bzangs mi gnas te /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs mi gnas te /
translated: “Good man, we don’t stay there.

original: kho bo cag ni 'gron pa don mthun la rag las pa yin pas /🔽gal te kho bo cag gtsug @58a * //
analyzed: kho bo cag ni 'gron pa don mthun la rag las pa yin pas / gal te kho bo cag gtsug @58a * //
translated: We are dependent on the caravan.”

original: lag khang du gnas par gyur na 'gron pa don mthun gyis kho bo cag bor te 'gro bar 'gyur ro //🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: lag khang du gnas par gyur na 'gron pa don mthun gyis kho bo cag bor te 'gro bar 'gyur ro // des smras pa /
translated: “If we stayed in the monastery, the caravan would leave us behind.”🔽“Noble ones, go and sleep in the monastery.

original: 'phags pa dag bzhud la gtsug lag khang du gzims shig dang / 'gron pa don mthun cha ba'i dus kyi tshe bdag gis 'phags pa dag bslab bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bzhud la gtsug lag khang du gzims shig dang / 'gron pa don mthun cha ba'i dus kyi tshe bdag gis 'phags pa dag bslab bar bgyi'o //
translated: When it is time for the caravan to leave, I will wake you.”

original: de dag gtsug lag khang du dong ste gnas mal bshams nas nyal lo //
analyzed: de dag gtsug lag khang du dong ste gnas mal bshams nas nyal lo //
translated: They went to the monastery, set up their bedding, and went to sleep.

original: nang par 'gron pa don mthun chas te glang tha ma bkal zin pa dang / de nas mi des de nas song ste dge slong de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: nang par 'gron pa don mthun chas te glang tha ma bkal zin pa dang / de nas mi des de nas song ste dge slong de dag la smras pa /
translated: In the morning, the caravan set out. The last ox was loaded, and then that man went to the monks and said,🔽“Noble ones, get up!

original: 'phags pa dag 'gron pa don mthun chas kyis myur du spyon cig / de dag ji srid du lag pa dag snyol bar byed /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag 'gron pa don mthun chas kyis myur du spyon cig / de dag ji srid du lag pa dag snyol bar byed /
translated: They were washing their hands,

original: so shing 'dor bar byed /
analyzed: so shing 'dor bar byed /
translated: throwing away their tooth cleaners,

original: gnas mal dag gtod par byed pa de srid du /
analyzed: gnas mal dag gtod par byed pa de srid du /
translated: and assigning the sleeping places.

original: 'gron pa don mthun thal bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'gron pa don mthun thal bar gyur nas /
translated: The caravan was turned into ashes.🔽As they were going along, they were robbed by bandits.

original: de dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ba na chom rkun pa dag gis bcom par don gyur nas de dag mthar gyis gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / de dag dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag phyi bzhin 'brang zhing 'dong ba na chom rkun pa dag gis bcom par don gyur nas de dag mthar gyis gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / de dag dge slong rnams kyis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: They eventually arrived at the monastery, and the monks saw them and said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: “Welcome, venerable sirs. Welcome.

original: ji ltar bde bar brgyus sam //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar brgyus sam //
translated: Did you travel well?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bde bar brgyus re skan /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bde bar brgyus re skan /
translated: “Venerable sirs, we traveled well, but we were robbed by bandits.”

original: ci nyes / tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slod rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci nyes / tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slod rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong 'khod pa dag la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa dag la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: “You should entrust it to the resident monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong 'khod pa dag la bcol bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas mnyan yod na khyim bdag gnyis shig 'khod pa de gnyis phan tshun khon yod cing /🔽gcig ni dad pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong 'khod pa dag la bcol bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas mnyan yod na khyim bdag gnyis shig 'khod pa de gnyis phan tshun khon yod cing / gcig ni dad pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: When the Blessed One had said, “You should entrust it to the resident monks,” two householders who were living in Śrāvastī had a mutual grudge against each other.🔽One was faithful,

original: gcig ni ma dad pa dang ldan pa yin nas /
analyzed: gcig ni ma dad pa dang ldan pa yin nas /
translated: and the other was faithless.

original: dad pa can gyis bsams pa /🔽kho na spel bas ci bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa can gyis bsams pa / kho na spel bas ci bya ste /
translated: The faithful one thought,🔽“What’s the use of harboring a grudge?

original: lon zhi bar byas te song la rab tu 'byung bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: lon zhi bar byas te song la rab tu 'byung bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I’ll settle it and go forth.”

original: de rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas dge slong zhig gi gan du rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas dge slong zhig gi gan du rab tu byung ngo //
translated: He went to Jetavana, where he went forth in the presence of a monk.

original: khyim bdag ma dad pa shos des rgyal byed kyi tshal du rab tu byung ngo zhes mi zhig las thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag ma dad pa shos des rgyal byed kyi tshal du rab tu byung ngo zhes mi zhig las thos nas smras pa /
translated: A certain householder, who was the most unbelieving of all, heard from someone that the Buddha had gone forth into the Jeta Grove. He said,

original: ci de mi 'jigs pa'i grong @58b khyer yin nam /
analyzed: ci de mi 'jigs pa'i grong @58b khyer yin nam /
translated: “Is that a city of fearlessness?

original: kho bo der yang song la gnod par bya'o //
analyzed: kho bo der yang song la gnod par bya'o //
translated: I will go there and harm them.”

original: dge slong des thos nas de rgyal po'i khab tu 'phags pa dang / des bsnyags so //
analyzed: dge slong des thos nas de rgyal po'i khab tu 'phags pa dang / des bsnyags so //
translated: The monk heard that and went to Rājagṛha, and the householder pursued him.

original: dge slong ni dus su 'gro zhing dus ma yin par mi 'gro la /
analyzed: dge slong ni dus su 'gro zhing dus ma yin par mi 'gro la /
translated: The monk went at the proper time and not at the improper time,

original: khyim pa ni dus su yang 'gro / dus ma yin par yang 'gro bas dge slong de ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig tu zhugs pa dang / khyim bdag des mthong ngo //
analyzed: khyim pa ni dus su yang 'gro / dus ma yin par yang 'gro bas dge slong de ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig tu zhugs pa dang / khyim bdag des mthong ngo //
translated: but the householder went both at the proper time and at the improper time. The monk entered a monastery in a mountain village, and the householder saw him.

original: dge slong de nang par snga bar langs te /
analyzed: dge slong de nang par snga bar langs te /
translated: The monk got up early in the morning

original: dge slong rnams la gnas mal gtad pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la gnas mal gtad pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: and assigned the sleeping places to the monks. The monks said,🔽“Venerable, you are a guest. You should take the best sleeping place.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam 'di ni dogs pa dang bcas pa yin gyi 'di nas ma 'gro shig /'di ni lam gzhan yin gyi de nas song shig / de lam de nas song ba dang / khyim bdag des bsnyegs nas shin tu brdegs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam 'di ni dogs pa dang bcas pa yin gyi 'di nas ma 'gro shig /'di ni lam gzhan yin gyi de nas song shig / de lam de nas song ba dang / khyim bdag des bsnyegs nas shin tu brdegs te /
translated: He went that way, and the householder pursued him and beat him severely.

original: lhung bzed kyang bcag / chos gos kyang dral nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyang bcag / chos gos kyang dral nas /
translated: He broke his alms bowl and tore his Dharma robes.

original: tha ma ma shi tsam du byas te btang nas de gtsug lag khang de nyid du phyir phyin pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: tha ma ma shi tsam du byas te btang nas de gtsug lag khang de nyid du phyir phyin pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: He left him for dead and went back to the monastery. The monks asked him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir khyod gnas skabs 'di lta bur gyur /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir khyod gnas skabs 'di lta bur gyur /
translated: “Venerable, why are you in this condition?”

original: des gnas skabs 'di dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod nas yang smras pa /
analyzed: des gnas skabs 'di dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod nas yang smras pa /
translated: He told them what had happened, and then said,🔽“I’m going to leave the monastic life.”

original: gal te kho bos tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bstan pa ltar ma byas na kho bo gnas skabs 'di 'dra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: gal te kho bos tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bstan pa ltar ma byas na kho bo gnas skabs 'di 'dra bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs so //
translated: “Except in such circumstances.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab ba 'dod pa dang // bslab ba la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab ba 'dod pa dang // bslab ba la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, spoke in praise of the Dharma connected with that, increasing it, and expanding it.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore the former was a rule,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: but this is an exception.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang dag dge 'dun gyi khri'am /🔽khri'u 'am / stan nang tshang can nam /🔽la ba 'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang dag dge 'dun gyi khri'am / khri'u 'am / stan nang tshang can nam / la ba 'am /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: sngas sam / gor bu @59a * //🔽bla gab med par bting ngam /
analyzed: sngas sam / gor bu @59a * // bla gab med par bting ngam /
translated: ‘If a monk puts out or has put out a bedding of the saṅgha—a bed, a bench, a mattress, a pillow, a mat,

original: 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: or a cloth—in the open air, and then leaves without putting it away or having it put away or asking another monk to do so, except if the circumstances are right, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this rule is Vaiśālī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
translated: The individual is a follower of the Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no corruption or offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: As for “a monk,” it is a follower of the Buddha.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: As for “of the saṅgha,” it is of the saṅgha of disciples of the Buddha.

original: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
analyzed: khri'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
translated: As for “a bed,” it is a bed.

original: khri'u 'am zhes bya ba yang khri'u'am zhes bya ba yang khri 'u nyid do //🔽stan nang tshangs can nam zhes bya ni shing bal can no //🔽la ba 'am zhes bya ba ni la nyid do //
analyzed: khri'u 'am zhes bya ba yang khri'u'am zhes bya ba yang khri 'u nyid do // stan nang tshangs can nam zhes bya ni shing bal can no // la ba 'am zhes bya ba ni la nyid do //
translated: A mattress is a mattress.🔽A blanket is a blanket.

original: sngas sam zhes bya ba ni sngas su gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: sngas sam zhes bya ba ni sngas su gzhug pa'o //
translated: A pillow is a pillow.

original: gor bu zhes bya ba ni gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: gor bu zhes bya ba ni gru bzhi'o //
translated: A square is a square.

original: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni ma g-yogs bar ro //
analyzed: bla gab med pa zhes bya ba ni ma g-yogs bar ro //
translated: An uncovered place is one that is not covered.

original: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: To spread means to spread oneself.

original: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no /
analyzed: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no /
translated: To cause to spread means to cause another to spread.

original: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: To not gather up means to not gather up oneself.

original: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: To not cause to gather up means to not cause another to gather up.

original: dge slong 'khod ba la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang 'dug pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod ba la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang 'dug pa la'o //
translated: To the monks who are present means to those monks who are present there.

original: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni bcol ba ni rnam pa lda ste /
analyzed: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni bcol ba ni rnam pa lda ste /
translated: To not ask means to not ask in four ways.

original: gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gnas mal 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gnas mal sdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug cig ces bya ba nyid ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gnas mal 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gnas mal sdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug cig ces bya ba nyid ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is: This is the temple, Look at the temple, This is the bed, Gather the bed, and Lock the door.

original: gal te dge slong med na dge tshul la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong med na dge tshul la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no monk, he should ask a novice.

original: gal te dge tshul med na khyim bdag la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge tshul med na khyim bdag la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no novice, he should ask a layman.

original: gal te khyim bdag med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no layman, he should look in the four directions, hide the key, and leave.

original: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na kho bos phyogs che ge mo zhig tu lde mig sbas kyi long shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na kho bos phyogs che ge mo zhig tu lde mig sbas kyi long shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he sees a monk on the road, he should say, I hid the key in such-and-such a place, please take it.

original: de nas song nas zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs na'o //
analyzed: de nas song nas zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs na'o //
translated: Then, having gone means having abandoned the vicinity.

original: de'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu dgu tshun chad de /
analyzed: de'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu dgu tshun chad de /
translated: Its vicinity is up to forty-nine fathoms.

original: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
analyzed: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
translated: And that is from the very front if it is not surrounded by walls, etc.

original: bskor ba la ni sgo gang nas so //
analyzed: bskor ba la ni sgo gang nas so //
translated: The circumambulation is by whichever door.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag @59b ste'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag @59b ste'o //
translated: Except for such conditions means except for such conditions as those.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no // de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: A downfall means as before.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this through the basic transgression, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the presentation of the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gnas mal khri dang / khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang / gor bu la sogs pa gnas mal gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa ma bsdus sam /🔽sdud du ma bcug gam //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gnas mal khri dang / khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang / gor bu la sogs pa gnas mal gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa ma bsdus sam / sdud du ma bcug gam //
translated: Here, the actual downfall is defined as follows: A monk who has been appointed to do so, or who does it himself, leaves a bed or seat belonging to the community—a bed, a bench, a mattress, a woolen blanket, a pillow, a cushion, or any other article that is part of the bedding—outside without putting it away or having it put away.🔽He then goes beyond a distance of forty-nine fathoms without taking leave of the other monks who are staying there.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan tshun du ma gyur kyang rung de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs te gnas mal phan tshun du gyur na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyang
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan tshun du ma gyur kyang rung de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs te gnas mal phan tshun du gyur na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyang
translated: If he falls asleep or enters meditative absorption while the bedding is being moved, even if he does not move,

original: rung ste / gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung ste / gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: he commits the actual downfall of improper bedding.

original: dge 'dun thams cad kyi gnas mal la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad kyi gnas mal la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no downfall if the bedding belongs to the whole community.

original: gnas mal khri dang // khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang // gor bu dang / dre'u rdog dang / dbyam po dang // be'u ras la sogs pa gnas mal gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gnas mal khri dang // khri'u dang / stan nang tshangs can dang / la ba dang / sngas dang // gor bu dang / dre'u rdog dang / dbyam po dang // be'u ras la sogs pa gnas mal gyi yan lag tu gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bedding is a bed, a bench, a cushion, a woolen mat, a pillow, a mat of sasa grass, a mat of eraka grass, a mat of goat hair, a mat of strips of cloth, or a mat of bark, and it is any of the bedding accessories.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa la na smad pa med do //🔽ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa la na smad pa med do // ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bedding belongs to the Saṅgha and the monk puts it outside under the open sky, either by himself or by having it carried there.🔽There is no offense if the monk does not put it away or have it put away, or does not ask a monk who is present to do so.

original: brjed pas kyang rung ma brjed par blo sngon du btang bas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: brjed pas kyang rung ma brjed par blo sngon du btang bas kyang rung ste /
translated: There is no offense if the monk does so either unintentionally or without remembering.

original: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan tshun du ma gyur pa la yang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gnas mal phan tshun du ma gyur pa la yang na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk goes beyond the distance of forty-nine fathoms, but the bedding is not moved.

original: de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms pa zhugs pa la sogs pas gnas mal phan tshun du gyur na 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las ma 'das kyang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms pa zhugs pa la sogs pas gnas mal phan tshun du gyur na 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las ma 'das kyang na smad pa med do //
translated: If one falls asleep or enters meditative attainment in that very place, and the sleeping place changes places with another sleeping place, there is no offense if it does not exceed the measure of forty-nine cubits.

original: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las kyang 'das la gnas mal phan tshun du yang gyur pa la @60a * //
analyzed: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las kyang 'das la gnas mal phan tshun du yang gyur pa la @60a * //
translated: There is no offense if it exceeds the measure of forty-nine cubits and the sleeping place changes places with another sleeping place,

original: na smad pa med do //
analyzed: na smad pa med do //
translated: but the monk does not sleep there.

original: spyod pa ni byed pa dang 'dra bas gzhan gyis gnas mal bla gab med par bting ba la spyod pa gang yin pa de 'gro ba dang / de nyid na 'dug pa ni rang gis 'ding bar byed pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni byed pa dang 'dra bas gzhan gyis gnas mal bla gab med par bting ba la spyod pa gang yin pa de 'gro ba dang / de nyid na 'dug pa ni rang gis 'ding bar byed pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: Since the conduct is similar to the action, if a monk uses a sleeping place that another monk has spread in the open air, and if he stays there, it is as if he had spread it himself.

original: gal te bdag gcig pu spyod spyod na bdag nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gal te bdag gcig pu spyod spyod na bdag nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he uses it alone, there is no offense.

original: gzhan yang gnyis cig car spyod spyod pa la ni /🔽phyis langs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis cig car spyod spyod pa la ni / phyis langs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: If two monks use it at the same time,🔽there is no offense if one of them gets up later.

original: gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na gzhon pa shos la na smad pa med do /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na gzhon pa shos la na smad pa med do /
translated: If they both get up at the same time, there is no offense if the younger monk gets up first.

original: gal te gnyi ga lo mnyam pa yin na gnyi ga la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga lo mnyam pa yin na gnyi ga la na smad pa med do //
translated: If both are of the same age, there is no offense for either.

original: gnas mal gyi nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad de /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad de /
translated: The area around a bed means within forty-nine cubits.

original: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
analyzed: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
translated: If it is not surrounded by walls, etc., it is considered to be the immediate vicinity of the bed.

original: bskor ba la ni sgo gang nas te /
analyzed: bskor ba la ni sgo gang nas te /
translated: If it is surrounded, it is considered to be the immediate vicinity of the door.

original: de las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de las 'das pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes beyond that.

original: gnas mal gyi phan tshun ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi phan tshun ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The area around a bed is of three types:

original: rlung gis bzlog pa dang / char pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa dang / sril la sogs pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gis bzlog pa dang / char pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa dang / sril la sogs pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa ste /
translated: the area where the wind blows from the bed to the other place; the area where the rain falls from the bed to the other place; the area where the dust blows from the bed to the other place.

original: phan tshun rnam pa de gsum las gang byung yang rung ste na smad med do //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam pa de gsum las gang byung yang rung ste na smad med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes beyond any of these three types of areas.

original: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ma gtogs pa dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa /
analyzed: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ma gtogs pa dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa /
translated: The country where one is sent is a country where there are monks who are not shameless, who are not sick, who are not old, who are not infirm, and who are fully ordained.

original: lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa la bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gnas mal 'de te zhes bya ba dang // gnas mal sdus shig ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa la bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gnas mal 'de te zhes bya ba dang // gnas mal sdus shig ces bya ba dang /
translated: The five types of assigning work to those who have the same view and the same name are: “Clean this temple.” “Look at the temple.” “This is the bedding.” “Gather the bedding.”

original: sgo lcags chug cig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sgo lcags chug cig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not do any of the five types of requests to a person who has the same view and the same name, such as, “Go to that monastery,” “Go see that monastery,” “Go to that bed and seat,” “Go collect that bed and seat,” or “Go lock the door.”

original: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du song ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du song ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes for the sake of alms.

original: phan tshun du gyur pa dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa gnyi ga 'am gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: phan tshun du gyur pa dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa gnyi ga 'am gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one goes beyond the boundary of the monastery or the boundary of the region, or both.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid rang ngam /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gnas mal nyid rang ngam /
translated: The agent is the Saṅgha itself or someone appointed by the Saṅgha.

original: bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa byas pa lta bu ni byed pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa byas pa lta bu ni byed pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: The basis is a bed and seat that is not covered.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung par 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis is five factors.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas @60b mal nyid /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas @60b mal nyid /
translated: The Sangha’s bedding and seats.🔽One has not put it away oneself or had it put away by someone appointed;

original: rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa dang / ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: rang ngam bskos pas bla gab med par gzhag pa dang / ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: one has not gathered it in or had it gathered in;

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nye 'khor las 'das sam /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nye 'khor las 'das sam /
translated: one has not asked the monks who are present; one has gone beyond the vicinity;

original: de nyid du gnyid log gam /
analyzed: de nyid du gnyid log gam /
translated: one has fallen asleep right there;

original: snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / phan tshun gsum po rlung gis bzlog gam /
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / phan tshun gsum po rlung gis bzlog gam /
translated: one has entered meditative absorption, and so forth; one has been stopped by a third person, by wind,

original: char pas rim pa gzhan slebs sam //🔽sril la sogs pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa gang byung yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: char pas rim pa gzhan slebs sam // sril la sogs pas rim pa gzhan slebs pa gang byung yang rung ba'o //
translated: by rain, or by water;🔽or one has been stopped by a snake, and so forth.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //🔽sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ji srid du gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do // sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te / ji srid du gnas mal gyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If any of these conditions is not fulfilled, the downfall is a partial defeat or a serious violation, depending on the circumstances.🔽The downfall is accrued by the preparatory action of the downfall of the monastic code related to bedding and seats, until the actual downfall is committed.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each preparatory action of the actual downfall, a serious violation is accrued.

original: gang zag gi gnas mal la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi gnas mal la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for using a seat or bed belonging to a person.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gnas mal la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for using a seat or bed belonging to the community of nuns.

original: phan tshun dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa'i mdun rol du sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: phan tshun dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa'i mdun rol du sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for engaging in sexual intercourse in a place that is beyond the boundary or beyond the vicinity.

original: spyod pa ni byed pa dang 'dra bas gzhan dang gnyis cig car spyod spyod pa la ni sngar langs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: spyod pa ni byed pa dang 'dra bas gzhan dang gnyis cig car spyod spyod pa la ni sngar langs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Since the act is similar to the offense, there is an offense of wrong conduct for two people who are engaging in sexual intercourse at the same time as someone else.

original: gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na rgan pa shos la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na rgan pa shos la nyes byas so //
translated: If both of them stand up at the same time, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the older one.

original: bcol ba'i yul dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcol ba'i yul dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol ba la nyes byas so //

original: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gnas mal 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gnas mal sdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug cig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba dngos su ma smras pa la nyes byas so //
