original: nye 'khor las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / de nyid du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / de nyid du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in not going beyond the vicinity, not sleeping there, and not entering meditative absorption, and so on.

original: brtul ba dang brtul du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: brtul ba dang brtul du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should be resolute and cause others to be resolute.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: One should request a monk who is present.

original: dge slong do tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong do tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not request a monk who is timid, or who is sick, or who is old, or who is infirm, or who is not fully ordained.

original: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po las gang yang rung ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po las gang yang rung ba dag bya'o //
translated: One should do any of the five kinds of requests.

original: brtul bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: brtul bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: When one has set out the bedding that is to be done, and has gone for alms,

original: gal te rlung dang char ba 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis brtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rlung dang char ba 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis brtul bar bya'o //
translated: if wind or rain should come, those who are in the monastery should be resolute.

original: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyin nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyin nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: If, through forgetfulness, he has gone far or has arrived, and then remembers, he should arouse the thought, “I will not do this in the future,” and he should also say this in words.

original: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If he meets a monk coming along the path, he should entrust it to him.

original: khas blangs pas son pa nyid ni de bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: khas blangs pas son pa nyid ni de bya ba nyid do //
translated: If he has accepted it, he has already done what needs to be done.

original: gnas nas 'phags par gyur pa ni nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags par gyur pa ni nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: If he has left the place and does not encounter any danger, he should gather up the bedding.

original: gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o //
translated: If it has become dirty, he should shake it out.

original: gnas mal g-yar por spyad pa 'gro khar dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal g-yar por spyad pa 'gro khar dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If he is using borrowed bedding, he should return it.

original: gal te dus kyis mi mthun cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba ltan gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dus kyis mi mthun cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba ltan gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If he encounters a time of conflict and danger, he should entrust it to another.

original: @61b su la bcol zhe na /
analyzed: @61b su la bcol zhe na /
translated: To whom should he entrust it?

original: dge slong la'o //🔽de med na dge tshul la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la'o // de med na dge tshul la'o //
translated: To a monk.🔽If there is no monk, then to a novice monk.

original: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o //
analyzed: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o //
translated: If there is no novice monk, then to a layperson.

original: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is nothing at all, he should look in the four directions and leave, hiding the key.

original: gal te lam kar dge slong mthong na phyogs de de la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam kar dge slong mthong na phyogs de de la brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he sees a monk on the way, he should tell him about the situation.

original: gal te 'ongs pa na khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan gzhag ste 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'ongs pa na khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan gzhag ste 'jug par bya'o //
translated: If the monk comes and the door is locked because he has been invited to another house, he should sit on a seat placed near the wall or a tree and wait.

original: dge slong dag mgron du 'bod pa'i khyim gzhan der gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i stan dag g-yar por sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag mgron du 'bod pa'i khyim gzhan der gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i stan dag g-yar por sbyin no //
translated: The monks who have been invited to the other house should bring a seat from the monastery.

original: dge slong dag rang nyid kyis khyim gzhan de nas stan de dag phyir bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag rang nyid kyis khyim gzhan de nas stan de dag phyir bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: The monks should not themselves send the seat back from that other house.

original: gnas mal khyim gzhan nas gtsug lag khang du phyir bskur ba de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi las yin no //
analyzed: gnas mal khyim gzhan nas gtsug lag khang du phyir bskur ba de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi las yin no //
translated: It is the duty of the laypeople and novices to carry the bedding back from the other house to the monastery.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim bdag la bcol te 'dod bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim bdag la bcol te 'dod bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no laypeople or novices, the monks should ask the householder to carry it back and then leave.

original: gal te khyim bdag dag bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na gzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag dag bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na gzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: If the householders say, “We will carry it,” then they should be allowed to do so and the monks should go on their way.

original: de dag gis ma bskyal na nye gnas dag gis blad bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis ma bskyal na nye gnas dag gis blad bar bya'o //
translated: If they do not carry it, then the pupils should carry it.

original: nye gnas dag med na gnas brtan dang / dge slong dag rang gis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nye gnas dag med na gnas brtan dang / dge slong dag rang gis blang bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no pupils, then the elders and the monks themselves should carry it.

original: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos na gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos na gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
translated: If all the monks must carry it, then the gaṇḍī should be struck.

original: yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te rang gi don du stan dag g-yar po byed na g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te rang gi don du stan dag g-yar po byed na g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the donors come to the monastery and borrow seats for their own purposes, they should be lent out.

original: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In order to protect them, a monk should also be left behind.

original: dge slong srung mar gzhag pa des khyim pa dag bza' btung byed cing gtam zer ba'i nad du mi 'jug par phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong srung mar gzhag pa des khyim pa dag bza' btung byed cing gtam zer ba'i nad du mi 'jug par phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is left behind to guard the seats should not join the householders in eating, drinking, and conversation. He should stay in one place.

original: des rang gi las bsam gtan dang kha ton dang klog pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bya'o //
analyzed: des rang gi las bsam gtan dang kha ton dang klog pa dang 'dri ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bya'o //
translated: He should also do whatever work he has been assigned, such as meditation, recitation, reading, or writing.

original: des gdan cha de dag la sems gtad cing ye mig cher bya'o //🔽yon bdag dag dong na gdan cha de dag brtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: des gdan cha de dag la sems gtad cing ye mig cher bya'o // yon bdag dag dong na gdan cha de dag brtul bar bya'o //
translated: He should focus his mind on those seats and keep his eyes open.🔽If the benefactors have left, he should put away the seats.

original: gdan cha khyim pas ma rung bar byas pa yod na dge skos la sogs pas byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: gdan cha khyim pas ma rung bar byas pa yod na dge skos la sogs pas byi dor bya'o //
translated: If the seats have been damaged by householders, the monk in charge of the seats should repair them.

original: chang gis ma rung na chu dag gis bkru'o //
analyzed: chang gis ma rung na chu dag gis bkru'o //
translated: If they have been damaged by alcohol, he should wash them with clean water.

original: snum gyis ma rung na @62a * //
analyzed: snum gyis ma rung na @62a * //
translated: If they have been damaged by oil,

original: chal gyis byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: chal gyis byi dor bya'o //
translated: he should wipe them with a cloth.

original: mi gtsang bas ma rung na sa'am 'dag rdzas sam lci bas sbyang ngo //
analyzed: mi gtsang bas ma rung na sa'am 'dag rdzas sam lci bas sbyang ngo //
translated: If they have been damaged by filth, he should clean them with earth, ash, or cow dung.

original: 'breng bu la sogs pa las byas pa'i thags ma dag mi gcad bar 'gyur ba 'dag rdzas kyis ma dag na bcad de bor zhing sar ba dag gis yang glan bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'breng bu la sogs pa las byas pa'i thags ma dag mi gcad bar 'gyur ba 'dag rdzas kyis ma dag na bcad de bor zhing sar ba dag gis yang glan bar bya'o //
translated: If the warp and weft threads of a woolen cloth seat are not firmly woven, he should cut them with a knife and discard them. He should then reweave the seat with new threads.

original: gdan cha gang dag la khyim pa 'dug 'dug pas gal te ma brtul bar 'dug pa mthong na dge slong gang gis mthong ba de nyid kyis de dag brtul bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gdan cha gang dag la khyim pa 'dug 'dug pas gal te ma brtul bar 'dug pa mthong na dge slong gang gis mthong ba de nyid kyis de dag brtul bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If he sees that the seats are occupied by laypeople, and if he sees that they are not being dismissed, then the very monk who sees them should dismiss them.

original: gal te mthong ba rgas pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba rgas pa 'am /
translated: If the one who sees them is old

original: na ba yin na des dge skos la sbran cing brtul tu gzhug par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: na ba yin na des dge skos la sbran cing brtul tu gzhug par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: or sick, then he should inform the monk who is in charge of the seats and have them dismissed.

original: mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong mi na ba thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong mi na ba thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the monks who belong to that monastery should look after the sick.

original: nad pa'i drung du 'dug ste blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i drung du 'dug ste blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should look after the sick while sitting in front of them.

original: nad pa blta ba de rang gi stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa blta ba de rang gi stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not get up from their seats to look after the sick.

original: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o //
translated: The attendants of the sick should prepare seats there.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis gal te gzhan gyis dge pa'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis gal te gzhan gyis dge pa'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If the preceptor or teacher is going to a virtuous place, the disciples and students should follow him, if they are not increasing their own virtue elsewhere.

original: slob ma 'am nye gnas des bdag kyang slad bzhin mchi'o zhes ma zhus par mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyi stan mi bskur ro //
analyzed: slob ma 'am nye gnas des bdag kyang slad bzhin mchi'o zhes ma zhus par mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyi stan mi bskur ro //
translated: The student or attendant should not remove the teacher’s or preceptor’s seat without asking permission, saying, “I will follow you.”

original: slob ma la sogs pas stan phar khyer ba de slob dpon la sogs pas rang nyid kyis phyir bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pas stan phar khyer ba de slob dpon la sogs pas rang nyid kyis phyir bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the student or the like has carried away the seat, the teacher or the like should return it himself.

original: bla gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char byung na rang rang gi stan brtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char byung na rang rang gi stan brtul bar bya'o //
translated: When listening to the Dharma in the open air, if wind or rain occurs, each person should take his own seat.

original: rgan po rnams kyi gnas mal gzhon rabs kyi bas mtho zhing che bas lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis brtul mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang brtul ba'i las brje bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyi gnas mal gzhon rabs kyi bas mtho zhing che bas lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis brtul mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang brtul ba'i las brje bar bya'o //
translated: If the elderly are unable to carry their own heavy seats because they are higher and larger than those of the young, the young should exchange their seats with the elderly.

original: gnas mal mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas mal mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Seats should be arranged in accordance with the seniority of the monks.

original: gor bu yang gor bu dag dang / dbyam po yang dbyam po dag dang / khri la sogs pa yang khri la sogs pa dag dang mthun mthun du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gor bu yang gor bu dag dang / dbyam po yang dbyam po dag dang / khri la sogs pa yang khri la sogs pa dag dang mthun mthun du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Small cushions should be placed with small cushions, large cushions with large cushions, and benches with benches.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du dge slong dag gdan cha dang / mchod pa'i rdzas dag rnyed na dge 'dun du langs pa'i dge slong dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du dge slong dag gdan cha dang / mchod pa'i rdzas dag rnyed na dge 'dun du langs pa'i dge slong dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the monks in another monastery obtain seats and articles for worship, the monks who have gathered in the saṅgha should send them.

original: gal te de'i @62b tshe char 'bab pa dang char 'bab tu dogs pa med na bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de'i @62b tshe char 'bab pa dang char 'bab tu dogs pa med na bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If at that time there is no rain and no fear of rain, they should send them.

original: gal te lam kar rlung dang char byung na shing ljon pa 'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam kar rlung dang char byung na shing ljon pa 'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o //
translated: If there is wind and rain on the road, they should go into the shelter of a tree or a wall.

original: bcer ba de srung ba dag gis rdzas ngan pa cig gis g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bcer ba de srung ba dag gis rdzas ngan pa cig gis g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: The people who are protecting the shelter should cover them with something that is not a valuable object.

original: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas rnams skam bsrad bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas rnams skam bsrad bya'o //
translated: When they arrive at the monastery, they should dry and spread out the objects.

original: gang yang rung bar me shor tam chu byung na dang por rang gi ltung bzed dang / chos gos dang gang zag gi rdzas gdon par bya zhing /
analyzed: gang yang rung bar me shor tam chu byung na dang por rang gi ltung bzed dang / chos gos dang gang zag gi rdzas gdon par bya zhing /
translated: If a fire breaks out or water appears in any of the buildings, first they should remove their own begging bowls, robes, and personal objects,

original: phyis dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o //
translated: and afterwards they should remove the saṅgha’s.

original: bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In order to protect what has been removed, they should leave a monk who is not able to do heavy work.

original: me dang chu dang brnag mi bzod pa khyad du bsad du mi rung ba'i nang du rdzas gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: me dang chu dang brnag mi bzod pa khyad du bsad du mi rung ba'i nang du rdzas gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter into a place where there is fire, water, or a dangerous situation that is not safe.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi ba bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed de bcu bzhi ba bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the fourteenth downfall.🔽The origin of the downfall of using a new mat

original: // / gding ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / gding ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The origin of the downfall is twofold: due to a prohibition and due to a permission.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the prohibition is as follows: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: lho phogs nas dge slong rgan pa dang gzhon pa gnyis shig bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du mnyan yod 'ongs nas rgan pa shos kyi gtsug lag khang ni gnas mal dang bcas pa zhig tu bskos /
analyzed: lho phogs nas dge slong rgan pa dang gzhon pa gnyis shig bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la phyag 'tshal du mnyan yod 'ongs nas rgan pa shos kyi gtsug lag khang ni gnas mal dang bcas pa zhig tu bskos /
translated: Two monks, one elder and one younger, came from the south to Śrāvastī to pay homage at the feet of the Blessed One. The elder monk was assigned to a temple with bedding,

original: gzhon pa shos kyi gtsug lag khang ni gnas mal med pa zhig tu bskos pa dang / gzhon pa shos de sgrub phod pa zhig yin pas des rtsva mang po zhig blangs nas pus mo nub tsam gyi gding ba bshams so //
analyzed: gzhon pa shos kyi gtsug lag khang ni gnas mal med pa zhig tu bskos pa dang / gzhon pa shos de sgrub phod pa zhig yin pas des rtsva mang po zhig blangs nas pus mo nub tsam gyi gding ba bshams so //
translated: The youngest was appointed to the temple without bedding, and since he was the most capable, he took a lot of grass and spread it out to knee height.

original: rgan pa des bsams pa /
analyzed: rgan pa des bsams pa /
translated: The oldest one thought,

original: gzhon nu de'i gtsug lag khang ji lta bu zhig tu bskos pa ji bltas 'gro'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gding ba bzad po bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu de'i gtsug lag khang ji lta bu zhig tu bskos pa ji bltas 'gro'o snyam nas de der song ba dang / ji tsam na gding ba bzad po bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
translated: “I will go see what kind of temple the youngest has been appointed to.” When he got there, he saw the excellent bedding that had been spread out and thought,

original: bdag ji srid du gnas mal phyir gtod par byed pa de srid du yang 'gro ba 'phyis par 'gyur gyi 'di nyid du 'dug go snyam nas /🔽des gnas mal dang bcas pa'i gtsug lag khang de dge slong ngas mal 'bogs @63a * //
analyzed: bdag ji srid du gnas mal phyir gtod par byed pa de srid du yang 'gro ba 'phyis par 'gyur gyi 'di nyid du 'dug go snyam nas / des gnas mal dang bcas pa'i gtsug lag khang de dge slong ngas mal 'bogs @63a * //
translated: “As long as I am giving out bedding, it will be too late to go, so I will stay here.”

original: pa la phyir gtad nas /
analyzed: pa la phyir gtad nas /
translated: He took the temple with the bedding and gave it to the monk who was assigning the bedding.

original: de gnyi ga gtsug lag khang der mtshan mo gnas nas nang par sngar langs te dong ngo //
analyzed: de gnyi ga gtsug lag khang der mtshan mo gnas nas nang par sngar langs te dong ngo //
translated: Both of them stayed in that temple for the night and left in the morning.

original: phyogs de snum zhing dang ra ba yin bas rtsva bting ba dag la sril dag chags nas gtsug lag khang de'i phyi nang bcas pa thams cad sril gyis khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: phyogs de snum zhing dang ra ba yin bas rtsva bting ba dag la sril dag chags nas gtsug lag khang de'i phyi nang bcas pa thams cad sril gyis khyab par gyur to //
translated: The ground was soft and moist, so that the grain grew together and covered the whole monastery, inside and out.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs ba dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun ni zhugs so //
translated: At that time a certain householder invited the Buddha and the community of monks to a meal in his home. The community of monks had already left,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par bsgrubs so //
translated: but the Blessed One was still in the monastery, having not yet completed his alms round.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu lngas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par sgrub par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu lngas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par sgrub par mdzad de /
translated: There are five reasons why the Blessed Buddhas remain in the monastery and complete their alms round.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: nang du yang dag 'jog bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa la lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog bzhed pa dang / lha rnams la chos ston par bzhed pa dang / nad pa la lta bar bzhed pa dang / gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bzhed pa'o //
translated: and to establish the bases of training for the disciples in the monastic code.

original: don 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: don 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das gnas mal la rtog par bzhed pa dang / 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar bzhed pas rdzas las byung ba na bzhugs shing bsod snyoms mngon par sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: In this case, the Blessed One, wishing to inspect the sleeping quarters and establish the bases of training for the disciples in the monastic code, was staying in Śrāvastī and accomplishing alms.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas lde mig bsnams te kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /🔽gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas lde mig bsnams te kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar / gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, knowing that it had not been long since the assembly of monks had left, took his key and went from monastery to monastery,🔽from temple to temple,

original: khang khyim du /
analyzed: khang khyim du /
translated: from house to house,

original: 'chags nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar gshegs shing mthar gyis gshegs pa na /
analyzed: 'chags nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar gshegs shing mthar gyis gshegs pa na /
translated: He went to the place where he was walking back and forth, and when he went to the place where he was walking back and forth,

original: gtsug lag khang de gal ba der gshegs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gtsug lag khang de sril dag gis phyi nang thams cad khyab par gzigs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de gal ba der gshegs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gtsug lag khang de sril dag gis phyi nang thams cad khyab par gzigs so //
translated: he went to the monastery, and the Blessed One saw that the monastery was completely covered inside and out with lice.

original: gzigs nas kyang ae ma zhes gsungs shing smad nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang ae ma zhes gsungs shing smad nas 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Having seen it, he said, Ema! and having disparaged it, he thought this:

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pags pa dang / @63b sha dang khrag dag btsir zhing btsir zhing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pags pa dang / @63b sha dang khrag dag btsir zhing btsir zhing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
translated: The faithful brahmins and householders, squeezing their skin, flesh, and blood, give gifts and make merit.

original: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed do snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod par byed do snyam du dgongs so //
translated: The monks, not knowing moderation and not discerning, enjoy it all.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas kyang sril dag kyang logs shig tu 'gyur zhing rtsva dag kyang logs shig tu 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ci nas kyang sril dag kyang logs shig tu 'gyur zhing rtsva dag kyang logs shig tu 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One performed a miracle such that the grass was on one side and the straw on the other.

original: 'khor lo dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung dang / lcags kyo dag dang ldan pa'i phyag dra bas 'brel pa bsod nams brgya phrag du ma las 'khrungs pa gnyis kyis sril de dag legs par bsdus te bsil ba'i phyogs su gzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang bkra shis dang g-yung drung dang / lcags kyo dag dang ldan pa'i phyag dra bas 'brel pa bsod nams brgya phrag du ma las 'khrungs pa gnyis kyis sril de dag legs par bsdus te bsil ba'i phyogs su gzhag par mdzad do //
translated: With his two hands, which were marked with wheels, auspicious signs, and swastikas, which were webbed, and which were born from many hundreds of merits, he gathered up the straw and placed it in a cool place.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gtsug lag khang de chag chag btab ste /🔽phyag dar mdzad nas nyal nyil gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du bor te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gtsug lag khang de chag chag btab ste / phyag dar mdzad nas nyal nyil gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du bor te /
translated: Then the Blessed One swept the temple.🔽Having swept, he threw out the trash outside the temple.

original: phyag dang zhabs gnyis bsil nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi slang du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs gnyis bsil nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi slang du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: Having washed his hands and feet, he entered the temple to sit in meditation.

original: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pas bsod snyoms blangs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then the monk who had gone for alms, having received alms, went to the Blessed One.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos nyid kyis bsod snyoms sgrub pa'i dge slong la dge slong ji ltar zas bsod dam /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, by the very nature of things, ask the monk who has gone for alms, “Monk, was the food good?🔽Did you satisfy the community of monks?” and they ask him in this way to make him happy.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji lta zas bsod dam dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa 'dis so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong bsod snyoms sgrub pa la dge slong ji lta zas bsod dam dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim
translated: So the Blessed One asked the monk who had gone for alms, “Monk, was the food good? Did you satisfy the community of monks?”

original: par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa /
analyzed: par byas sam zhes so sor kun dga' bar mdzad pa dang / des gsol pa /
translated: He replied,

original: btsun pa te bor zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par bgyis so //
analyzed: btsun pa te bor zas bsod cing dge slong gi dge 'dun tshim par bgyis so //
translated: “Venerable Sir, the food was good and I satisfied the community of monks.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol du zhabs gnyis bsil te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhal zas kyi bya ba mdzad nas gtsug lag khang gi slad rol du zhabs gnyis bsil te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having finished his meal, washed his hands and bowl, and put his robe and bowl away,

original: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slang du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog gi slang du gtsug lag khang du gshegs so //
translated: He then went to the monastery for the sake of solitary meditation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs @64a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyi dro nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs @64a * //
translated: Then, in the evening, the Blessed One rose from his solitary meditation

original: nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
analyzed: nas dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs so //
translated: and sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he had sat down, the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag ngas 'di na dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par shes nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas 'di na dge slong gi dge 'dun song nas ring po ma lon par shes nas /
translated: “Monks, I knew that the community of monks had not been gone long,

original: lde mig khyer te /
analyzed: lde mig khyer te /
translated: so I took the key

original: kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba nas kun dga' ra bar /
translated: and went from park to park,

original: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas gtsug lag khang du /
translated: from monastery to monastery,

original: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
analyzed: khang khyim nas khang khyim du /
translated: from house to house,

original: 'chags nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar song zhing mthar gyis 'gro ba na /
analyzed: 'chags nas 'chag sar dang / gol bar song zhing mthar gyis 'gro ba na /
translated: from walkway to walkway, and so on.

original: gtsug lag khang zhig gal ba der phyin nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhig gal ba der phyin nas /
translated: Eventually, I came to a monastery

original: ngas gtsug lag khang de sril dag gis phyi nang bcas pa thams cad khyab par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngas gtsug lag khang de sril dag gis phyi nang bcas pa thams cad khyab par mthong ngo //
translated: where I saw that the entire monastery, inside and out, was covered with lice.

original: mthong nas kyang ae ma zhes byas te smad nas 'di snyam du bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pags pa dang / sha dang khrag dag btsir zhing btsing zhing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang ae ma zhes byas te smad nas 'di snyam du bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis pags pa dang / sha dang khrag dag btsir zhing btsing zhing sbyin pa dag sbyin /
translated: Having seen this, he said, “Alas!” and criticized them, thinking, “Monks do not know moderation and do not discriminate when they enjoy the gifts of faithful brahmins and householders who give gifts after squeezing their skin, flesh, and blood.

original: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la /🔽dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod do snyam du dgongs kyi /
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa gang yin pa de la / dge slong dag drod mi shes pa dang so sor mi rtog par yongs su longs spyod do snyam du dgongs kyi /
translated: They enjoy these gifts without thinking of the merit of the donors.🔽Monks, you should enjoy the gifts of the faithful with moderation, without discrimination, and without thought of the merit of the donors.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba la drod ran par yongs su longs spyad pa dang spang zhing yongs su longs spyad pa dang // dus su yongs su longs spyad pa dang / brtag cing yongs su longs spyad pa dang/ khang kyis yongs su longs spyad na legs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis dad pas sbyin par bya ba la drod ran par yongs su longs spyad pa dang spang zhing yongs su longs spyad pa dang // dus su yongs su longs spyad pa dang / brtag cing yongs su longs spyad pa dang/ khang kyis yongs su longs spyad na legs so //
translated: You should enjoy them in a timely way, after examination, and with a sense of shame.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drod ran pa dang / spangs ba dang / dus dang / brtag pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyad pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs nas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis drod ran pa dang / spangs ba dang / dus dang / brtag pa dang / khad kyis yongs su longs spyad pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs nas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised moderation, relinquishment, timeliness, investigation, and gradual enjoyment, and having seen the ten benefits of establishing the precepts, said, “Therefore, the training should be undertaken by my disciples in this way:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba 'am lo ma'i gding ba gding ngam 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug par de nas song na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba 'am lo ma'i gding ba gding ngam 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug par de nas song na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If any monk, in a saṅgha dwelling, spreads out a grass or leaf mat, or has it spread out, and then departs without gathering it up or having it gathered up, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod gang zag ni lho phyogs pa'i dge slong gnyis /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod gang zag ni lho phyogs pa'i dge slong gnyis /
translated: The location was Śrāvastī. The persons were two monks from the south.

original: nyon mongs pa ni drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par @64b yongs su longs spyod par byed pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni drod mi shes pa dang / so sor mi rtog par @64b yongs su longs spyod par byed pa /
translated: The affliction was not knowing moderation and enjoying things without discernment.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du gding ba mang po dag bting nas ma bsdus par de nas song ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du gding ba mang po dag bting nas ma bsdus par de nas song ba'o //
translated: The offense is that after many mats had been spread in the saṃgha’s temple, he left without gathering them up.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the allowance is this: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag 'gron pa don mthun pa dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ba na ri brags shig tu phyin nas /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag 'gron pa don mthun pa dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ba na ri brags shig tu phyin nas /
translated: A large number of monks were traveling through the countryside with a caravan. They arrived at a hill station.

original: der de dag gis khyim bdag la gnas mal g-yar ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: der de dag gis khyim bdag la gnas mal g-yar ba dang / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: There they asked a householder for a place to stay, and the householder said,

original: 'phags pa dag dam tshig gis g-yar bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag dam tshig gis g-yar bar bgyi ste /
translated: “Noble ones, I will lend you one on one condition.

original: gal te bdag gis bsod snyoms gsol te gshegs na g-yar ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis bsod snyoms gsol te gshegs na g-yar ro //
translated: If I can eat my meal and then go, I will lend it to you.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: khyim bdag kho bo cag ni 'gron ba don mthun pa la rag las pa yin pas gal te de dag sdong na bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag kho bo cag ni 'gron ba don mthun pa la rag las pa yin pas gal te de dag sdong na bza' bar bya'o //
translated: “Householder, we are dependent on the caravan. If they move on, we will eat.”

original: de na khri dang khri'u dag med nas de dag gis rtsva bam mang po blangs nas pus mo nub pa tsam gyi gding ba bshams so /'gron pa don mthun pa dag nam ma langs pa nyid du 'phags nas /
analyzed: de na khri dang khri'u dag med nas de dag gis rtsva bam mang po blangs nas pus mo nub pa tsam gyi gding ba bshams so /'gron pa don mthun pa dag nam ma langs pa nyid du 'phags nas /

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /

analyzed: khyim bdag 'di na khri dang khri'u dag med na /

analyzed: kho bo cag sa sgre bo la ji ltar nyal bar bya /

analyzed: bdag mchis brang dang bcas pas de 'dor ba na snga dro ril gyis yol bar gyur to //

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /

analyzed: de dag nyi ma re re zhing 'dor bar byed nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: nyi ma re re zhing dor bar mi bya bar 'di ltar dus dang dus su so sor brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: gal te thams cad du 'dong na de'i tshe bsdus te 'dong bar bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong dag 'chag sa dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na /

analyzed: der sril dag byung nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“You should not put bundles of grass on the ground.

analyzed: thag pas bcings nas shing ljon pa dag la dpyangs te gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: dge slong dag lci ba dag sa la 'jog par byed pa na /
translated: “Monks, when they put the dung on the ground,

analyzed: de dag tu sril dag byung nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the worms came out. The Blessed One said,

original: gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: ‘You should put it on a flat stone.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa rnams dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs ba'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa rnams dang bslab pa la gus pa dang bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs ba'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised those who desire training, those who respect training, and those who are ascetic with regard to the requisites,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: spoke in a way that accords with that, in a way that is mostly in accord with that, and in a way that is consistent with that, and said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma @67a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma @67a * //
translated: “Monks, therefore the former

original: ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: is a rule,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: but this is an exception.🔽My disciples should recite this rule for training as follows:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My śrāvakas should recite this basis of training in the Vinaya:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba 'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang du rtsva'i gding ba 'am lo ma'i gding ba bting ngam /
translated: or has it spread out,

original: 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam /🔽sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: 'ding du bcug nas ma bsdus sam / sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: and then departs without putting it away,

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar de nas song na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de //
translated: or without having it put away, or without asking a monk who is staying there to do it, then for each offense he commits an offense entailing confession, except if there are special circumstances.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this was in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
translated: The individual was a follower of the Buddha.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: As for “a monk,” it is a follower of the Buddha.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o / gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o / gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Of the community” means of the community of disciples of the Buddha.

original: gang du spyod lam bzhis 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung bar ro //
analyzed: gang du spyod lam bzhis 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung bar ro //
translated: “Monastery” means a place where the four modes of deportment—walking, standing, sitting, and lying down—are possible.

original: rtsva'i gding ba 'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva dag go //
analyzed: rtsva'i gding ba 'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva dag go //
translated: “Grass mat” means grass.

original: lo ma'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni lo ma dag go //
analyzed: lo ma'i gding ba zhes bya ba ni lo ma dag go //
translated: “A bed of leaves” means leaves.

original: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bting ngam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Spreads out” means by oneself.

original: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'ding du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Causes to be spread out” means by another.

original: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ma bsdus sam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “Does not gather up” means by oneself.

original: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Does not cause to be gathered up” means by another.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang yod pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la zhes bya ba ni de na dge slong gang yod pa la'o //
translated: “The monks who are staying” means those who are present.

original: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni ma gtad par ro //
analyzed: ma bcol bar zhes bya ba ni ma gtad par ro //
translated: “Without asking” means without informing.

original: de nas song nas zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs nas so //
analyzed: de nas song nas zhes bya ba ni nye 'khor spangs nas so //
translated: “Having gone” means having left the vicinity.

original: de'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do /
analyzed: de'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do /
translated: The vicinity is up to forty-nine bow-lengths away.

original: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
analyzed: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
translated: If it is not surrounded by walls, etc., it is up to the immediate vicinity.

original: bskor ba la sgo gang nas so //
analyzed: bskor ba la sgo gang nas so //
translated: If it is surrounded, it is up to the door.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except in the case of such conditions” means except in the case of such conditions as those mentioned above.

original: lhung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “One commits an offense entailing suspension” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyu zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyu zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang @67b rdo ba dang / bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas snum zhing dang ra ba sril la sogs pa'i srog chags skye ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang ngam bskos pas rtsva 'am gding ba bting ba ma bsdus sam /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang @67b rdo ba dang / bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas snum zhing dang ra ba sril la sogs pa'i srog chags skye ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang ngam bskos pas rtsva 'am gding ba bting ba ma bsdus sam /
translated: Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls through the main part, the preparatory stage, and the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage; through downfalls and non-downfalls; through training and restoration.

original: sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: Here, the main part of a downfall is as follows: A monk who has not made a mat of grass or cloth in a temple of the saṅgha that is not smooth and soft, and that has the fault of being rough and hard, such as having stones and sand, and so on, and that is a place where insects are born, should not roll up the grass or cloth himself or have it rolled up.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su ma gyur kyang rung /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol bar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su ma gyur kyang rung /
translated: If a monk goes beyond the boundary of forty-nine fathoms without asking permission of the resident monks, he commits an offense, even if he does not cause any damage to the monastery.

original: de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: If he falls asleep or enters meditative absorption within that boundary,

original: gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su gyur na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su gyur na nye 'khor las ma 'das kyang rung ste /
translated: he commits an offense, even if he does not cause any damage to the monastery.

original: gding ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gding ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the rule concerning the offense of spreading out one’s mat.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monastery is not that of the Saṅgha.

original: gding ba dang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa sril la sogs pa'i srog chags skye ba'i nyes dmigs yod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gding ba dang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa sril la sogs pa'i srog chags skye ba'i nyes dmigs yod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the mat, grass, leaves, and so on, are rolled up, and so on, and there is no danger of insects being harmed.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid rdo ba dang / bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang / de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang ngam bskos pas bting ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid rdo ba dang / bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang / de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir rang ngam bskos pas bting ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monastery is not made of stone or sand, and so on, and there is no danger of such damage. If the mat is spread by oneself or by someone appointed, there is no offense.

original: ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba la na smad pa med do //🔽brjed pas kyang rung ma brjed par blo sngon du btang bas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ma bsdus sam sdud du ma bcug gam dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba la na smad pa med do // brjed pas kyang rung ma brjed par blo sngon du btang bas kyang rung ste /
translated: There is no offense if he does not collect them, or if he is not asked to collect them, or if he does not ask the resident monks.🔽There is no offense if he forgets, or if he does not intend to stay for more than forty-nine days.

original: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su ma gyur pa la yang na smad pa med do //🔽de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pas gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su gyur na 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las ma 'das kyang na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las 'das par song na gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su ma gyur pa la yang na smad pa med do // de nyid du gnyid log gam snyoms par zhugs pa la sogs pas gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su gyur na 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las ma 'das kyang na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he stays in the monastery for more than forty-nine days, but no harm is done.🔽There is no offense if he stays in the monastery for more than forty-nine days, but no harm is done, because he falls asleep or enters into meditative absorption, etc.

original: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las kyang 'das la /
analyzed: 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i mtha' las kyang 'das la /
translated: There is no offense if he stays in the monastery for more than forty-nine days, and harm is done.

original: gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su yang gyur pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du nyes dmigs su yang gyur pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he stays in the monastery for more than forty-nine days, and harm is done.

original: cig car spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid yin pas cig car spyod spyod na thams cad kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya bar 'dra ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: cig car spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid yin pas cig car spyod spyod na thams cad kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya bar 'dra ba nyid yin te /
translated: If he is a simultaneous practitioner, he is like a monk who is a novice. Therefore, if he is a simultaneous practitioner, all the monks should do the same as him with regard to the duties of relinquishing, etc.

original: ji ltar gnas mal gyi skabs su gnyi cig car spyod spyod pa la ni phyis langs pas bya ba ma yin la /🔽gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na ni gzhon pa @68a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas mal gyi skabs su gnyi cig car spyod spyod pa la ni phyis langs pas bya ba ma yin la / gal te gnyi ga mnyam du langs na ni gzhon pa @68a * //
translated: If both are present at the same time, the one who is later in rising does not do the act.

original: shos kyis bya ba lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: shos kyis bya ba lta bu ma yin te /
translated: If both rise at the same time, the younger does not do the act.🔽But here, if one uses a mat, that very one must discard it and so on.

original: 'di la ni cha gang la gang gis longs spyod pa de de nyid kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya ba yin pas de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni cha gang la gang gis longs spyod pa de de nyid kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya ba yin pas de la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: gding ba'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do //
analyzed: gding ba'i nye 'khor ni 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad do //
translated: The area of the mat is up to forty-nine cubits.

original: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
analyzed: de yang rtsig pa la sogs pas ma bskor ba la ni drung nyid nas so //
translated: If it is not surrounded by walls and so on, it is up to the vicinity.

original: bskor ba la ni sgo khang nas te /
analyzed: bskor ba la ni sgo khang nas te /
translated: If it is surrounded, it is up to the porch.

original: de las 'das pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: de las 'das pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in exceeding that.

original: gding ba'i nyes dmigs ni sril la sogs pa srog chags kyis gtsug lag khang gi phyi nang bcas pa khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gding ba'i nyes dmigs ni sril la sogs pa srog chags kyis gtsug lag khang gi phyi nang bcas pa khyab pa ste /
translated: The disadvantages of the mat are that insects and so on spread throughout the temple inside and out.

original: 'dir srog chags kyi rigs gtso cher yan lag du gzhag pas grang gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po yan chad nas gtsug lag khang phyi nang bcas pa thams cad khyab pa'i bar la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dir srog chags kyi rigs gtso cher yan lag du gzhag pas grang gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po yan chad nas gtsug lag khang phyi nang bcas pa thams cad khyab pa'i bar la na smad pa med do //
translated: Here, since the types of living beings are primarily posited as limbs, there is no fault in the range from one or two up to many, or even in the entire monastery, both inside and out.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gcig pa'i dngos gzhi la ltung ba gcig rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba gcig pa'i dngos gzhi la ltung ba gcig rnam par gzhag go //
translated: One downfall is posited for the actual basis of the single preparation.

original: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong do tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas ba dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ma gtogs pa dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa la /
analyzed: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong do tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas ba dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ma gtogs pa dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa la /
translated: The object of the request is a fully ordained monk who is not a novice, who is not sick, who is not old, who is not ill, and who is not a novice.

original: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gding ba 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gding ba sdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gding ba 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gding ba sdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not do any of the five kinds of work that he was asked to do: to go to the monastery; to look at the monastery; to get a particular mat; to collect the mats; or to lock the door.

original: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du song ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du song ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk goes to beg for alms.

original: nyes dmigs su gyur pa dang / nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa gnyi ga 'am gang yang rung ba la na smad ba med do //
analyzed: nyes dmigs su gyur pa dang / nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa gnyi ga 'am gang yang rung ba la na smad ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not do any of the two kinds of work that he was asked to do: work that is disadvantageous; or work that is beyond the monastery zone.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang / sril la sogs pa skye ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyi gzhir rang ngam bskos pas rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i gding ba byed pa nyid lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / rdo ba dang bye ma'i gzhi nyid la sogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid dang / sril la sogs pa skye ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyi gzhir rang ngam bskos pas rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i gding ba byed pa nyid lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: The agent of this is not the monastery itself, nor the ground of stones and sand, etc., but those who spread the grass, etc., either themselves or appointed by others, on a basis that has such a fault as a hole, etc.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i lhung bar 'gyur re /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i lhung bar 'gyur re /
translated: Here, there are ten factors for the basis of downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag @68b khang nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir bting ba dang / ma bsdus sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag @68b khang nyid dang / rang ngam bskos pas de lta bu'i nyes dmigs yod pa nyid kyis gzhir bting ba dang / ma bsdus sam /
translated: The monastery itself, and the basis spread by oneself or appointed by others with such a fault as a hole, etc.

original: sdud du ma bcug gam /
analyzed: sdud du ma bcug gam /
translated: Not gathering it up or not having it gathered up.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nye 'khor las 'das sam /🔽de nyid du gnyid log gam /
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la ma bcol ba dang / nye 'khor las 'das sam / de nyid du gnyid log gam /
translated: Not asking the resident monks or going beyond the vicinity.🔽Falling asleep or entering meditative absorption right there.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa dang / nyes dmigs sril la sogs pa gang byung yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa dang / nyes dmigs sril la sogs pa gang byung yang rung ba'o //
translated: Any fault that occurs, such as a hole.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are incomplete, it is a partial downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du gding ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du gding ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of sleeping in the same sleeping place as a fully ordained woman, but has not yet reached the actual downfall, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so /
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o // gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so /
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual downfall that one has begun, there is a minor infraction.🔽If the person is a fully ordained monk, the infraction is a minor one.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
translated: If the person is a fully ordained nun, the infraction is a minor one.

original: nyes dmigs dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa'i mdun rol du sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes dmigs dang nye 'khor gyi mtshams las 'das pa'i mdun rol du sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If one has begun the preparation for the actual downfall in a place that is not the boundary or in a place that is beyond the boundary, the infraction is a minor one.

original: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcol ba'i yul ni dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one asks a fully ordained monk who is shameless, who is sick, who is old, who is ill, or who is not fully ordained to do the work, the infraction is a minor one.

original: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gding ba 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gding bsdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba dngos su ma smras pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po gtsug lag khang 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gtsug lag khang ltos shig ces bya ba dang / gding ba 'de re zhes bya ba dang / gding bsdus shig ces bya ba dang / sgo lcags chug shig ces bya ba dag las gang yang rung ba dngos su ma smras pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There are five kinds of entrusting: “This is the temple,” “Look at the temple,” “This is the mat,” “Gather the mats,” and “Lock the door.”

original: re zhig gi dus su gzhan 'dug pa'i bar du yang nyes dmigs su gyur na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: re zhig gi dus su gzhan 'dug pa'i bar du yang nyes dmigs su gyur na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If there is a problem even while staying for a while in between, it is also a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas so //
translated: In all preparations, it is a minor offense.

original: bslab par bya ba las 'das pa la nyes byas so//
analyzed: bslab par bya ba las 'das pa la nyes byas so//
translated: If one transgresses the precepts, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many as the preparations, there are also that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation for a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni bsdu ba byas sam byed du bcug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni bsdu ba byas sam byed du bcug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has already made a mat or has had one made.

original: bcol ba'i dge slong yod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bcol ba'i dge slong yod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has a monk who is an attendant.

original: tshul khrims dang srog gi bar chad la sogs pa nyam nga ba dang phrad ba la ltung ba med do//
analyzed: tshul khrims dang srog gi bar chad la sogs pa nyam nga ba dang phrad ba la ltung ba med do//
translated: There is no offense if one is in a situation of danger, such as a threat to one’s ethical discipline or one’s life.

original: @69a * // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa dag la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: @69a * // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa dag la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, or for someone who is insane or mentally disturbed, or for someone who is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gding ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gding ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is stated in this way: “A monk should not in any way rely on a mat that is made in any region and used in any region.”

original: nye 'khor las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / de nyid du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: nye 'khor las 'das pa'i phyir 'gro ba dang / de nyid du gnyid log pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should not go beyond the vicinity of the monastery, nor should one sleep there, enter meditative absorption there, and so on.

original: bsdu ba dang / sdud du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba dang / sdud du gzhug pa dag bya'o //
translated: One should gather the materials and have a mat made.

original: dge slong 'khod pa la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'khod pa la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: He should request a monk who is present to do it.

original: dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang / nad dang bcas pa dang / rgas pa dang / na ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la bcol bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not request a monk who is shameless, or who is sick, or who is old, or who is sick and old, or who is not fully ordained.

original: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: bcol ba rnam pa lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba dag bya'o //
translated: He should do one of the five kinds of requests.

original: bsdu bar bya ba bting ste /
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba bting ste /
translated: He should spread out the bedding that is to be collected.

original: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na /
translated: When he has gone out for alms,

original: gal te nyes dmigs byung na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nyes dmigs byung na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: if a problem arises, those who are present in the monastery should collect it.

original: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyi nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o //
analyzed: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyi nas dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o //
translated: If he has forgotten and gone far away, or if he regains his mindfulness later, he should arouse his mind and say aloud, “From now on I will not do this.”

original: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If he meets a monk who is coming along the road, he should request him to do it.

original: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na de bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na de bya ba nyid do //
translated: If he has gone there by his own accord, he should do it himself.

original: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gding pa bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gding pa bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: If he is going to a place where he will not encounter danger, he should take his mat.

original: khyim gzhan du gding ba byas pa khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan du gding ba byas pa khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o //
translated: If he has spread his mat in someone else’s house, he should ask the householder’s permission to leave it there.

original: dgon par ni yang na dor bar bya yang na glong bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgon par ni yang na dor bar bya yang na glong bar bya'o //
translated: In the wilderness, he should either leave it or roll it up.

original: glong ba de ni rtsva la sogs pa'i mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: glong ba de ni rtsva la sogs pa'i mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid do //
translated: Rolling it up is simply reversing the order of spreading it out, starting with the edges and ending with the middle.

original: gos dag bskem pa'i phyir rtsva bting ba gang zag 'ga' zhig slong ba la dor bar khas len na sbyin no //
analyzed: gos dag bskem pa'i phyir rtsva bting ba gang zag 'ga' zhig slong ba la dor bar khas len na sbyin no //
translated: If someone asks for the grass mat that he has spread out to dry his robes, he should give it to him, if he agrees.

original: 'chag sa dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chag sa dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
translated: If the soles of his feet are rough, he should spread out grass on the walking path.

original: de dag kyang dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang dor bar bya'o //
translated: He should also leave it there.

original: 'chag sa gtong zhing gud du 'gro ba'i dus nye bar gnas par gyur pa na sngar 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva dag rdog shags la sogs pas phye mar brlags shing srogs chags @69b dag mi skye ba ma gtogs pa gzhan dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chag sa gtong zhing gud du 'gro ba'i dus nye bar gnas par gyur pa na sngar 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva dag rdog shags la sogs pas phye mar brlags shing srogs chags @69b dag mi skye ba ma gtogs pa gzhan dor bar bya'o //
translated: When the time comes to go out and walk in the yard, the grass spread out on the walking path should be gathered up and put aside, except for what has been trampled and what the insects have not left.

original: 'chag sa mi gtong zhing gud du mi 'gro ba'i tshe ni /
analyzed: 'chag sa mi gtong zhing gud du mi 'gro ba'i tshe ni /
translated: When one does not go out for a walk,

original: 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva dag la dus dus su so sor brtag pa dang / bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
analyzed: 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva dag la dus dus su so sor brtag pa dang / bsgyur bzlog bya'o //
translated: one should examine the grass spread out on the walking path from time to time, and turn it over.

original: de yang sa snum pa dang dngar bar ni nyin re zhing ngo //
analyzed: de yang sa snum pa dang dngar bar ni nyin re zhing ngo //
translated: If the ground is moist and fertile, this should be done daily;

original: gzhan du zla ba phyed cing ngo //🔽'chag sa dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag 'chags sar dgram pa'i thog tu thag pas bcings shing ljon pa la dpyangs shing gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zla ba phyed cing ngo // 'chag sa dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag 'chags sar dgram pa'i thog tu thag pas bcings shing ljon pa la dpyangs shing gzhag par bya'o //
translated: otherwise, every half-month.🔽The bundles of grass on the walking path should be tied together with rope and hung on a tree.

original: 'dag rdzas kyi rgyu lci ba dag gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dag rdzas kyi rgyu lci ba dag gyo mor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The dung used for cleaning should be put in a pit.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remedy is as before.

original: gding ba'i ltung byed de bco lda pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gding ba'i ltung byed de bco lda pa bshad zin to /
translated: The Vinaya Verses states:

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium, a commentary on the Prātimokṣasūtra,

original: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: Volume twenty-two

original: skrong ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: skrong ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the downfall of boasting

original: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: is twofold: due to prohibitions and due to permissions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the prohibition is as follows: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la /
translated: At that time, the venerable Udayī said to some newly ordained monks:🔽“Venerables, come, let us go wandering in the countryside.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dong dang / der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dong dang / der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
translated: There we will defeat our opponents

original: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
analyzed: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
translated: and proclaim our own fame.

original: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: We will also acquire some wealth.

original: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang chos gos dang dra ba dang phor bu dang ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang klag pa dang kha ton dang rnal 'byor dang yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas nas 'char kas de dag rang la gnas 'char bcug nas /
analyzed: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang chos gos dang dra ba dang phor bu dang ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang klag pa dang kha ton dang rnal 'byor dang yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas nas 'char kas de dag rang la gnas 'char bcug nas /
translated: After encouraging them, Udayi let them stay with him.

original: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas 'char ka'i nye gnas rnams ni nang du dong ste /
analyzed: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas 'char ka'i nye gnas rnams ni nang du dong ste /
translated: When they arrived at a monastery near a mountain village, the bell for the Sangha's resting place was rung in that monastery. Udayi's disciples went inside,🔽while Udayi and his own resting place stayed outside.

original: 'char ka dang rang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdang na 'char ka phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas de dag gis 'char ka'i gnas mal gud du bshams te gcig la gcig zhus nas nyal @70a * //
analyzed: 'char ka dang rang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdang na 'char ka phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas de dag gis 'char ka'i gnas mal gud du bshams te gcig la gcig zhus nas nyal @70a * //
