translated: While they were talking about worldly affairs, it got dark and Udayi did not come. They prepared Udayi's resting place separately, asked each other, and went to sleep.

original: ba dang / ji tsam mig lam chad pa'i dus kyi tshe 'char ka 'ongs nas sgo brdungs te nye gnas de dag phyi rol du bskrad do //
analyzed: ba dang / ji tsam mig lam chad pa'i dus kyi tshe 'char ka 'ongs nas sgo brdungs te nye gnas de dag phyi rol du bskrad do //
translated: When the sun had set, Udayin came and beat on the door. He drove out the attendants.🔽They spent the night in the open air, and in the morning they went to Śrāvastī. They told the monks in detail what had happened to them.

original: de dag de na mtshan thog thag bla gab med par lhags pas nyen cing na bar gyur nas nang par sdar langs te mnyan yod du dong nas bdag cag ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: de dag de na mtshan thog thag bla gab med par lhags pas nyen cing na bar gyur nas nang par sdar langs te mnyan yod du dong nas bdag cag ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: The monks who were of few desires complained, “Why did the monks drive out the monk from the saṅgha’s temple?”🔽They criticized him,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having assembled the saṅgha of monks, asked Udayin about it,

original: 'char ka la rmas nas /
analyzed: 'char ka la rmas nas /
translated: and he asked him about the rest.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not the way of mendicants.🔽It is not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not proper.🔽It is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: It is not something that should be done by those who have gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: He saw ten benefits in establishing the rules of training and said, “Therefore the monks should recite this rule of training:

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod dam skrod du 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te yi ma rangs nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod dam skrod du 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk, angry and displeased, throws out or has someone else throw out a monk from a monastery belonging to the saṅgha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni 'char ka /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'char ka /
translated: The person is the monk Udayi.

original: nyon mongs pa ni gnod sems /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni gnod sems /
translated: The affliction is any of the three.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod pa'o //
translated: The action is to throw out a monk from a monastery belonging to the saṅgha.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyen yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyen yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction is this: The Lord Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: mnyan yod na sa'i gtsug lag khang zhig yod pa de na dge slong nad pa zhig 'dug nas ji tsam na sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas dge slod rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: mnyan yod na sa'i gtsug lag khang zhig yod pa de na dge slong nad pa zhig 'dug nas ji tsam na sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas dge slod rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a monastery, and in it there was a sick monk. Then a five-colored cloud gathered, and the monks said to him,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus pas gtsug lag khang rdib par 'gyur srid kyi phyir byung zhig @70b kho bo rang 'byung mi nus so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus pas gtsug lag khang rdib par 'gyur srid kyi phyir byung zhig @70b kho bo rang 'byung mi nus so //
translated: “Venerable, a five-colored cloud has gathered. It is possible that the monastery will collapse, so come out. I am unable to come out on my own.”

original: dge slong rnams kyi 'gyod bsam byung nas char babs te gtsug lag khang rdib nas dge slong de non te dus la bab pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi 'gyod bsam byung nas char babs te gtsug lag khang rdib nas dge slong de non te dus la bab pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks were worried, and when it rained and the monastery collapsed, the monk was crushed. When the time came, the monks told the Blessed One about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training,

original: de dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: spoke this discourse to the monks, which was consistent with that, in keeping with that, and in conformity with that.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la /
translated: “Monks, therefore the former was a rule,

original: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: but this is an exception.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: ‘If a monk, angry and displeased,

original: yi ma rangs nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod dam skrod du bcug na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te lhung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yi ma rangs nas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas dge slong skrod dam skrod du bcug na de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te lhung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad de /
translated: expels a monk from the monastery or has him expelled, he commits a wrongdoing.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa /
translated: The person is a Buddhist.

original: nyon mongs pa dang snyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang snyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is free of afflictions and free of reactive emotions.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba 'di ni 'char ka 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba 'di ni 'char ka 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin ba'o //
translated: In this case, the monk named Upasena is the one who is meant.

original: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
analyzed: khros 'khrugs rngam par gyur te /
translated: He was angry, upset, and displeased.

original: yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khro zhing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
analyzed: yi ma rangs nas zhes bya ba ni khro zhing khro ba'i zil gyis non nas so //
translated: He was angry, upset, and displeased means he was overcome by anger and rage.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: The Saṅgha’s means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s śrāvakas.

original: gtsug lag khang nas zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba nas so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba nas so //
translated: From the monastery means from where the four modes of deportment—walking, standing, sitting, and lying down—are possible.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: The monk means a Buddhist monk.

original: skrod dam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: skrod dam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Expel means himself.

original: skrod du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: skrod du 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: Or have expelled means by another.

original: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen gzhag ste'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rkyen ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba'i rkyen gzhag ste'o //
translated: Except in such a case means except if such a condition exists.

original: lhung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall” is as above.

original: de la lhung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor bas lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcas pa @71a * //
analyzed: de la lhung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor bas lhung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcas pa @71a * //
translated: How does one fall?

original: rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this through the basic transgression, the preparation, the downfall through preparation, the absence of a downfall, the training, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas rang ngam /🔽dge slong gzhan nam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas rang ngam / dge slong gzhan nam /
translated: Here, the basic transgression is as follows: If a monk, in the monastery of the Saṅgha, expels a monk,🔽whether himself,

original: dge slong gzhan nam /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan nam /
translated: another monk,

original: dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'am /
translated: a nun,

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas dge slong bskrad par bya ba de la gnod pa srog gi bar chad la sogs pa bskyed par dogs pa yod dam /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas dge slong bskrad par bya ba de la gnod pa srog gi bar chad la sogs pa bskyed par dogs pa yod dam /
translated: or a novice, and if there is a danger that he will cause harm up to the loss of life,

original: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i dogs pa yod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skyes bar dogs pa yod dam /
analyzed: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i dogs pa yod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skyes bar dogs pa yod dam /
translated: or if there is a danger that the conflict will not be pacified, or if there is a danger that the Saṅgha will split,

original: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas dge slong skrod na skrod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas dge slong skrod na skrod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The antidote to the fear that the monk will not be pacified is to expel him with any kind of attitude that is not one of desire.

original: gtsug lag khang nas bskrad par bya ba'i gtsug lag khang de dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gang yin na de la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas bskrad par bya ba'i gtsug lag khang de dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gang yin na de la na smad pa med do //
translated: The temple from which the monk is to be expelled is the temple of the Sangha.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa rang ngam dge slong gzhan gyis dge slong skrod dam skrod du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa rang ngam dge slong gzhan gyis dge slong skrod dam skrod du 'jug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the monk who expels him or in the other monks who make him expel him.

original: bskrad par bya ba dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa rang bzhin du gnas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: bskrad par bya ba dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa rang bzhin du gnas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in expelling a fully ordained monk who has not lost his status and who is in his normal state.

original: gal te dge slong bskrad par bya ba de la gnod pa srog gi bar chad la sogs pa skye bar dogs pa yod dam /
analyzed: gal te dge slong bskrad par bya ba de la gnod pa srog gi bar chad la sogs pa skye bar dogs pa yod dam /
translated: If there is a danger that the monk to be expelled will harm himself or others,

original: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye bar dogs pa yod dam /
analyzed: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye bar dogs pa yod dam /
translated: There is the fear that the schism will not be settled, and there is the fear that a dispute in the Saṅgha will arise.

original: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa'i gnyen po 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod pa'i gnyen po 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if there is no intention to disrespect any of the monks who are the opponents to the fear that the schism will not be settled.

original: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas skrod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nas skrod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is dominated by another, and the other makes him leave the Saṅgha’s temple.

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / khyim pa dang / khyim pa mos dge slong skrod du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / khyim pa dang / khyim pa mos dge slong skrod du bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is made to leave by a nun, a female trainee, a novice monk, a novice nun, a layman, or a laywoman.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / gang nas bskrad par bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dag ni byed pa po nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / gang nas bskrad par bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dag ni byed pa po nyid do //
translated: The monk who is being expelled and the Saṅgha’s temple from which he is being expelled are the agents of the action.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are five limbs for the downfall of expulsion:

original: bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / @71b gang nas bskrad par bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / rang ngam dge slong gzhan nam dge slong ma 'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gang yang rung pas bskrad pa dang / gal te de la gnod pa dang /
analyzed: bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid dang / @71b gang nas bskrad par bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / rang ngam dge slong gzhan nam dge slong ma 'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gang yang rung pas bskrad pa dang / gal te de la gnod pa dang /
translated: the monk who is to be expelled; the monastery of the saṅgha from which he is to be expelled; the one who expels him, whether it is the monk himself, another monk, a nun, or a novice; the harm that is done to him;

original: dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba dang / nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen po 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas skrod pa dang bskrad pa mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba dang / nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen po 'dod pa ma yin pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung bas skrod pa dang bskrad pa mthar thug pa'o //
translated: and the expulsion, with any of the attitudes that are not the attitude of wanting to remedy a schism in the saṅgha and to bring about its pacification.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these limbs is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du skrod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du skrod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparations for the downfall of expulsion, but has not reached the point of culmination, one has a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each separate preparation for the main part, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang zag gi gtsug lag khad la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khad la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is a temple of a person, it is a wrong action.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is a temple of the community of nuns, it is a wrong action.

original: bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid ma yin pa dang / nyams pa dang / lta ba dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: bskrad par bya ba dge slong nyid ma yin pa dang / nyams pa dang / lta ba dang / mtshan mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the one who is to be expelled is not a monk, or is degenerate, or has a different view, or has a different mark, or is not fully ordained, or is a renunciate of another religion, or is a layperson, it is a wrong action.

original: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / dud 'gro la nyes byas na smad do //
translated: If it is a non-human being or an animal, it is a downfall.

original: bzhad gad kyis skrod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bzhad gad kyis skrod na nyes byas so //
translated: If one expels with laughter, it is a wrong action.

original: bskrad pa mthar ma thug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bskrad pa mthar ma thug na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not complete the expulsion, it is a wrong action.

original: dge slong gis bskos pa'i dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dag la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis bskos pa'i dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dag la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one expels a nun, novice monk, or novice nun who has been appointed by a monk, it is a wrong action.

original: bskrad par bya ba de dag nyid la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bskrad par bya ba de dag nyid la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one expels those who are to be expelled, it is a wrong action.

original: khyim pa rnams la ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang ngo//
analyzed: khyim pa rnams la ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang ngo//
translated: For householders, there is much non-merit.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through transgression of the rules is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snying pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snying pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The transgression of the rules of the rules is as many as the rules.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The transgression of the rules of the minor offenses is also a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni /
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni /
translated: There is no downfall

original: gal te de la gnod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba dang / nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa'i bsam pas skrod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te de la gnod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba dang / nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa'i bsam pas skrod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if one banishes with the intention of benefiting, when there is danger to the community, when there is danger of schism, and when there is no possibility of reconciliation;

original: dge slong dang dge tshul nyams pa nyid chos bzhin du skrod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge tshul nyams pa nyid chos bzhin du skrod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if one banishes a monk or novice who is corrupt in accordance with the Dharma;

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: and if one is a beginner, insane, deranged, or overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab @72a * //
analyzed: bslab @72a * //
translated: The training

original: par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skrod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du skrod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The action is the monk not attending to the downfalls that cause expulsion in all cases and in all regions.

original: gang du nyed dmigs 'byung ba'i gnas su 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang du nyed dmigs 'byung ba'i gnas su 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not stay in a place where one is known to be a monk who has committed a downfall.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is as before.

original: skrod pa'i ltung byed de bcu drug pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: skrod pa'i ltung byed de bcu drug pa bshad zin to /
translated: The sixteenth downfall of a novice monk has been explained.

original: // / phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The introduction to the downfall of reviling.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.🔽At that time, the venerable Udayī said to some new monks, “Venerables, come, let us go wandering in the countryside.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dod ba dang/ der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dge slong gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dod ba dang/ der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
translated: There we can defeat our opponents

original: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
analyzed: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
translated: and proclaim our own good reputation.

original: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: You should also acquire material things.🔽You should not be busy with begging bowls, Dharma robes, water filters, bowls, belts, giving oral transmissions, reading, reciting, yoga, or mental engagement.”

original: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas nas 'char kas de dag rang la gnas 'char bcug ste /
analyzed: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya bas brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas nas 'char kas de dag rang la gnas 'char bcug ste /
translated: When they were inspired in this way, Udayī allowed them to stay with him.

original: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na gtsug khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas 'char ka'i nye gnas rnams ni nang du dong ste /
analyzed: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na gtsug khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas 'char ka'i nye gnas rnams ni nang du dong ste /
translated: They went to a temple in a mountain village, and in that temple the monks’ quarters were locked. Udayī’s disciples went inside,

original: 'char ka dang rang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
analyzed: 'char ka dang rang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
translated: but Udayī and his own disciples stayed outside.

original: 'char ka phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas /
analyzed: 'char ka phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas /
translated: Udayī was distracted by worldly conversation and did not come in until nightfall.

original: de dag gis 'char ka'i gnas mal gud du bshams te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'char ka'i gnas mal gud du bshams te /
translated: They prepared a separate bed for Udayī.

original: gcig la gcig zhus nas nyal ba dang / ji tsam mig lam 'chad pa'i dus kyi tshe 'char ka 'ongs nas sgo brdungs te nang du zhugs nas /
analyzed: gcig la gcig zhus nas nyal ba dang / ji tsam mig lam 'chad pa'i dus kyi tshe 'char ka 'ongs nas sgo brdungs te nang du zhugs nas /
translated: They slept together, and when it was time to leave, Udayana came, knocked on the door, and entered.

original: des de dag kha cig la gru mos bsnun /
analyzed: des de dag kha cig la gru mos bsnun /
translated: He struck some of them with his elbows,

original: kha cig la ni pus mos bsnun nas sul gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te phyis gnon byas nas nye gnas de dag phyi rol du phyung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig la ni pus mos bsnun nas sul gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te phyis gnon byas nas nye gnas de dag phyi rol du phyung ngo //
translated: and some with his knees, and having made them leave, he expelled his disciples outside.

original: de dag de na mtshan thog thag bla gab med par lhags pas nyen cing na bar gyur @72b nas /
analyzed: de dag de na mtshan thog thag bla gab med par lhags pas nyen cing na bar gyur @72b nas /
translated: They spent the night outside, tormented by the cold.

original: nang par sdar langs te mnyan yod na dong nas bdag cag ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dge slong dag snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: nang par sdar langs te mnyan yod na dong nas bdag cag ji ltar gyur pa dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dge slong dag snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: “Why, knowing that the monks were already staying in the saṅgha’s temple, did these monks arrive later, and then, because of the inconvenience,

original: phyis gnon byed cing stan la nyal ba dang 'dug par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: phyis gnon byed cing stan la nyal ba dang 'dug par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: lie down and sit on the seats?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having assembled the saṅgha of monks with this account and this basis and this cause,

original: 'char ka la rmas nas /
analyzed: 'char ka la rmas nas /
translated: asked Upacelā,🔽“Is it true, Upacelā, that you did this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “It’s true, Blessed One.”

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not suitable.🔽It is not proper.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: It is not in accord with the Dharma.

original: rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: It is not something that should be done by one who has gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dag slong dag snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam 'dug na ltung byed
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang na dag slong dag snga na 'khod par shes bzhin du phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam 'dug na ltung byed
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, you should recite this rule for training:

original: do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk, knowing that monks have already taken up residence in a monastery belonging to the Sangha, arrives later and, having made a bed or a seat for himself, lies down or sits on it, knowing that it will disturb others, then that is an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /🔽gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod / gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.🔽The person was Udayī.🔽The affliction was disrespect.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong la phyis gnon byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong la phyis gnon byed pa'o //
translated: The misdeed was disturbing other monks.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka 'am /
translated: “Monk” means the monk Udayi,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or anyone else like him.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Community” means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: the community of disciples of the Tathagata.

original: gtsug khang na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug khang na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In the temple” means

original: gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba na'o //
analyzed: gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba na'o //
translated: in a place where the four modes of behavior—walking, standing, sitting, and lying down—are possible.

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Monks” means

original: chos 'di pa dag go //
analyzed: chos 'di pa dag go //
translated: those who are followers of this doctrine.

original: snga nas 'khod par zhes bya ba ni snga na gnas par ro //
analyzed: snga nas 'khod par zhes bya ba ni snga na gnas par ro //
translated: “Who have already settled in” means who have already taken up residence.🔽“Deliberately” means

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang gis rig par @73a * //🔽gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang gis rig par @73a * // gyur pa 'am /
translated: that he himself has become aware of it,

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: or that others have told him.

original: phyis 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyis 'ongs nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Later” means

original: de'i 'og tu 'ongs nas so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'ongs nas so //
translated: after that.

original: su la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni su bde ba la reg par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: su la gnod pa zhes bya ba ni su bde ba la reg par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Who is harmed” means who will not be comfortable.

original: de 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de de nas gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'gro bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni de de nas gzhan du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He will go” means that he will go from there to another place.

original: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du byas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having made that the condition” means

original: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: that it is not something else.

original: phyis gnon byas nas zhes bya ba ni gnod pas zil gyis mnan nas so //
analyzed: phyis gnon byas nas zhes bya ba ni gnod pas zil gyis mnan nas so //
translated: “Having been oppressed” means having been oppressed by harm.

original: stan la zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la'o //
analyzed: stan la zhes bya ba ni gnas mal la'o //
translated: “On a seat” means on a bed.

original: nyal lam zhes bya ba ni lus bsnyal na'o /
analyzed: nyal lam zhes bya ba ni lus bsnyal na'o /
translated: “Lying down” means having laid down the body.

original: 'dug na zhes bya ba ni rkub tshos gzhag na'o//
analyzed: 'dug na zhes bya ba ni rkub tshos gzhag na'o//
translated: “Sitting” means having placed the buttocks.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” is as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the offense should be understood by the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the non-offenses, the trainings, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong sngar zhugs pa nyid du shes bzhin du /🔽phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong sngar zhugs pa nyid du shes bzhin du / phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas te /
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is as follows: Except in the case of a sick or frightened monk, if a monk, knowing that another monk is already staying in a temple of the saṅgha,🔽deliberately sits or lies down on the same bedding with the intention of harassing him, and the other monk leaves because of this,

original: phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam 'dug na phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong phyis gnon byed pa na ba dang 'jigs pa dang na ba'i dbang ma gtogs pa lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam 'dug na phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro // dge slong phyis gnon byed pa na ba dang 'jigs pa dang na ba'i dbang ma gtogs pa lan smad pa med do //
translated: then this is the actual downfall of lying down or sitting on the same bedding.🔽There is no offense if the monk is sick or frightened, or if he is sick and the other monk is lying down or sitting with the intention of nursing him.

original: tho 'tshams par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: tho 'tshams par 'dun pa'i bsam pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is lying down or sitting with the intention of harassing the other monk.

original: bsam pa de lta bus phyis gnon byed pa ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: bsam pa de lta bus phyis gnon byed pa ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: The intention to harass is merely an example.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i bar sdom las /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i bar sdom las /
translated: The summary verses in the Vinaya Verses state:

original: nan dang gsod dang grang dro dang // chol zangs dang ni bkru sman dang // rnal 'byor mthun dang kha ton dang // 'jigs dang bcas dang 'jigs med do //
analyzed: nan dang gsod dang grang dro dang // chol zangs dang ni bkru sman dang // rnal 'byor mthun dang kha ton dang // 'jigs dang bcas dang 'jigs med do //
translated: with fear, and without fear.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dag gis dge slong la ji tsam cung zad tho 'tshams par byed pa thams cad bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir gtogs pa'i ltung byed la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu dag gis dge slong la ji tsam cung zad tho 'tshams par byed pa thams cad bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir gtogs pa'i ltung byed la na smad pa med do //
translated: As stated, all the ways that a monk is harmed, even to the slightest degree, are included in this training precept.

original: gang du phyis gnon bya ba'i gnas dge 'dun @73b gyi gtsug lag khang nyid yin na de lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: gang du phyis gnon bya ba'i gnas dge 'dun @73b gyi gtsug lag khang nyid yin na de lan smad pa med do //
translated: If the place where one is to be punished is the Saṅgha's temple itself, there is no fault.

original: phyis gnon pa'i dge slong gzhan dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: phyis gnon pa'i dge slong gzhan dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma nyams pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the monk who is to punish another is fully ordained and not degenerate, there is no fault.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong gzhan sdar zhugs pa nyid la der 'du shes dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong gzhan sdar zhugs pa nyid la der 'du shes dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If another monk has already entered the place of the Saṅgha's temple, and one has the perception of that and doubts, there is no fault.

original: phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do //🔽phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam /
analyzed: phyis 'ongs nas su la gnod pa de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de nyid rkyen du byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do // phyis gnon byas nas stan la nyal lam /
translated: Later, when he comes back, if he is harmed by someone, then there is no fault in his having made that very condition.

original: 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: Later, if he is harmed by someone, then there is no fault in his lying down or sitting on the seat.

original: dus yun ring thung dang nyin mtshan dang skya rengs la sogs pa'i cha la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus yun ring thung dang nyin mtshan dang skya rengs la sogs pa'i cha la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the length of time, or in the day or night, or in the time of dawn, and so on.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong gzhan sngar zhugs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong gzhan sngar zhugs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: The agent of this is not the one who is the chief in the perception of the monk who has entered the monastery of the Saṅgha first, except in the case of a sick or frightened monk.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual basis is five-branched:

original: gang la phyis gnon bya ba dge slong nyid dang / gang du phyis gnon bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa dang / na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par phyis gnon byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la phyis gnon bya ba dge slong nyid dang / gang du phyis gnon bya ba dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa dang / na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang ma gtogs par phyis gnon byed pa'o //
translated: and the action is to press down on him, except if he is sick or in danger.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If the factors are incomplete, then a downfall is not accrued, but a misdeed is accrued.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall is accrued by the misdeed of preparation.

original: ji srid du phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du phyis gnon gyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as the preparation for the downfall of pressing down on someone is begun but the actual act is not done, a misdeed is accrued.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations for the actual act, a misdeed is accrued.

original: gang la phyis gnon bya ba de dge slong nyid ma yin pa dang / mtshan dang lta ba mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang la phyis gnon bya ba de dge slong nyid ma yin pa dang / mtshan dang lta ba mi mthun pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the one who is pressed down on is not a fully ordained monk, or if he is of a different gender or has different views, or if he is not fully admitted, a misdeed is accrued.

original: gang du phyis gnon bya ba gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //🔽dge slong ma'i 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang / mu stegs can dang / khyim pa'i gnas la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang du phyis gnon bya ba gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so // dge slong ma'i 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang / mu stegs can dang / khyim pa'i gnas la nyes byas so //
translated: If one presses down on a person’s temple, it is a fault.🔽If one presses down on a nun’s temple, or on a temple of a non-Buddhist or a householder, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong sdar ma zhugs pa nyid la zhugs par 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi gnas su dge slong sdar ma zhugs pa nyid la zhugs par 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk enters the temple of the Saṅgha, and he is a coward, and he has the idea that he is entering, and he has doubt, it is a minor infraction.

original: tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa nyid ma yin ba ma @74a * //
analyzed: tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa nyid ma yin ba ma @74a * //
translated: If he does not have the thought of harming,

original: brtags par spyod pa tsam la nyes byas so //
analyzed: brtags par spyod pa tsam la nyes byas so //
translated: it is a minor infraction to just engage in the behavior.

original: sbyor pa'i sbyor pa'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor pa'i sbyor pa'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The downfall through preparation for a downfall through preparation is a minor infraction.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many preparations for a downfall as there are downfalls.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for a downfall through preparation is a minor infraction, a minor infraction.

original: ltung ba med pa ni tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / der 'du shes pa med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa med pa dang / der 'du shes pa med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you have no intention to harm, or if you do not perceive the other person as such.

original: na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang gis ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba dang 'jigs pa'i dbang gis ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you are sick, or if you are in danger.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you are a beginner, or if you are insane, deranged, or in pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du phyis gnon gyi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du phyis gnon gyi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is stated in the verse: “A monk should not step over a monk who is lying down.”

original: gtsug lag khang dang grong la sogs par shes bzhin du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dang grong la sogs par shes bzhin du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: You should enter monasteries, towns, and so on mindfully.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed de bcu bdun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: phyis gnon gyi ltung byed de bcu bdun pa bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the seventeenth downfall.

original: // / rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall for sitting on a seat with removable legs that is higher than that of a preceptor or teacher.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.🔽At that time, Venerable Upasena said to the young monks, “Come, Venerables, let us go wandering in the countryside.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nye dgas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dong dang / der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nye dgas dge slong gsar bu gsar bu dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag tshur shog ljongs rgyur 'dong dang / der bdag cag gis rgol ba dag kyang tshar gcad par bya /
translated: There we will defeat our opponents,

original: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
analyzed: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrags par bya /
translated: spread our own fame,

original: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa yang bsgrub par bya zhing /
translated: and acquire wealth.

original: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nad g-yog gis brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang /
analyzed: khyed cag kyang lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang / dra ba dang / phor bu dang / ska rags dang / lung dbog pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba dang / nad g-yog gis brel ba med par bya'o zhes spro bar byas pa dang /
translated: You should not be busy with your alms bowls, robes, water filters, water strainers, belts, teaching, recitation, chanting, yoga, mental focus, or nursing the sick.”

original: de gang gi tshe na dge slong rnams kyis 'di gnas dan len kun du spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'ga' yang de dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba med do //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe na dge slong rnams kyis 'di gnas dan len kun du spyod pa yin no zhes bya bar shes par gyur pa de'i tshe na 'ga' yang de dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba med do //
translated: When the monks found out that he was a practitioner of bad behavior, no one wanted to go wandering with him.

original: bsod snyoms pa zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa zhig gis smras pa /
translated: A monk who was a panhandler said,

original: btsun pa nye dga' kho bo khyod dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ngo /
analyzed: btsun pa nye dga' kho bo khyod dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur 'dong ngo /
translated: “Venerable Upasena, I’ll go wandering with you.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bsod snyoms pa de la smras @74b pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bsod snyoms pa de la smras @74b pa /
translated: The monks said to the panhandler,

original: bsod snyoms pa de ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin pas khyod la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa de ni gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa yin pas khyod la tho 'tshams par 'gyur ro //
translated: “That panhandler is a practitioner of bad behavior. He’ll harass you.”

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa kho bo ni lo 'das pa yin pas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa kho bo ni lo 'das pa yin pas /
translated: The panhandler said, “I’m a veteran.

original: kho bo de la gnas bca' ba dang / lung ma nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba'i rag lus pa cung zad kyang med pas des kho bo la ci byar yod ces des dge slong de dag gi tshig tshig ma yin par byas te /
analyzed: kho bo de la gnas bca' ba dang / lung ma nod pa dang / klag pa dang / kha ton dang / rnal 'byor dang / yid la bya ba'i rag lus pa cung zad kyang med pas des kho bo la ci byar yod ces des dge slong de dag gi tshig tshig ma yin par byas te /
translated: I have no need for it, so what can I do with it?”

original: de dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur song ngo //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig ljongs rgyur song ngo //
translated: He rejected the monks’ words and went on his way.

original: nye dgas gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mtshams 'das pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi mtshams 'das pa de'i tshe na smras pa /
translated: When they had passed beyond the outer boundary, Udayī said,🔽“Alms-master, carry this basket for a while.”

original: bsod snyoms pa gtur bu 'di re zhig khyer cig / btsun pa nye dga' ci khyod kyis sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun ma mthong ngam /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa gtur bu 'di re zhig khyer cig / btsun pa nye dga' ci khyod kyis sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun ma mthong ngam /
translated: “Venerable Udayī, have you not seen the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha?

original: yo byad don med pa 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: yo byad don med pa 'dis ci bya /
translated: What is the point of this useless equipment?”

original: nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa /
translated: Udayī said,

original: bsod snyoms pa khyod re zhig mi khyer ba ni yus na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa khyod re zhig mi khyer ba ni yus na /
translated: “Alms-master, if you won’t carry it,

original: ci khyod kho bo bas kyang mkhas pa yin snyam mam ci na khyod kho bo la de skad zer /
analyzed: ci khyod kho bo bas kyang mkhas pa yin snyam mam ci na khyod kho bo la de skad zer /
translated: do you think you are more learned than I am? Why do you say that to me?”

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
translated: The alms-master said,

original: mkhas pa ma yin yang rigs pa tsam smra'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ma yin yang rigs pa tsam smra'o //
translated: Although he was not learned, he did speak a little logic.

original: nye dgas bsams pa /
analyzed: nye dgas bsams pa /
translated: Udayī thought,

original: bsod snyoms pa 'di mi dga' bar bya'o snyam nas de gnyis mthar gyis ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa 'di mi dga' bar bya'o snyam nas de gnyis mthar gyis ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na /
translated: “I will make this alms-goer unhappy.” The two of them gradually traveled through the countryside.

original: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na /
analyzed: ri brags kyi gtsug lag khang zhig gi 'dab tu phyin pa na /
translated: They came to a temple on the outskirts of a town.

original: gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas bsod snyoms pa ni nang du song ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der dge 'dun gyi gnas mal gyi gand'i brdungs nas bsod snyoms pa ni nang du song ste /
translated: The monks in that temple were ringing the bell to announce the time for the monks to return to the temple. The alms-goer went inside,

original: nye dga' dang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
analyzed: nye dga' dang rang gi gnas mal mnos te bsdad na /
translated: but Udayī took his own bed and stayed outside.

original: nye dga' phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas /
analyzed: nye dga' phyi rol na 'du 'dzi'i gtam la yengs pa nam sros kyi bar du ma 'ongs nas /
translated: Udayī was distracted by worldly conversation and did not come inside until nightfall.

original: bsod snyoms pa des khang thog tu nye dga'i gdan bshams nas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa des khang thog tu nye dga'i gdan bshams nas /
translated: The alms-goer set out a seat for Udayī on the roof of the building,

original: rkang pa'i chu dang / rkang pa bkru ba mtha' gcig tu bzhag nas /
analyzed: rkang pa'i chu dang / rkang pa bkru ba mtha' gcig tu bzhag nas /
translated: and he set out water for his feet and a foot stool.

original: bdag nyid gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas 'og khang du mal bshams par zhugs te nyal ba dang / ji tsam mig lam chad pa'i dus kyi tshe nye dga' 'ongs nas sgo brdungs pa dang / bsod snyoms pas sgo ma phye bar /
analyzed: bdag nyid gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas 'og khang du mal bshams par zhugs te nyal ba dang / ji tsam mig lam chad pa'i dus kyi tshe nye dga' 'ongs nas sgo brdungs pa dang / bsod snyoms pas sgo ma phye bar /
translated: The alms-begging monk did not open the door, but said,

original: steng du mal bshams par nyol cig ces smras so //
analyzed: steng du mal bshams par nyol cig ces smras so //
translated: “Lie down on the bed upstairs.”

original: nye dga' khang thog tu 'dzegs nas rkang pa gnyis bkrus te /
analyzed: nye dga' khang thog tu 'dzegs nas rkang pa gnyis bkrus te /
translated: Upasena climbed up to the roof and washed his feet.

original: gnas khang du zhugs nas /🔽bsod @75a * //
analyzed: gnas khang du zhugs nas / bsod @75a * //
translated: He entered the room,🔽and called out, “Alms-begging monk!”

original: snyoms pa zhes bos pa dang / bsod snyoms pas btsun pa nye dga' ci zer zhes byas so //
analyzed: snyoms pa zhes bos pa dang / bsod snyoms pas btsun pa nye dga' ci zer zhes byas so //
translated: The alms-begging monk said, “Venerable Upasena, what is it?”

original: nye dga' sgra la mkhas pas /
analyzed: nye dga' sgra la mkhas pas /
translated: Upasena was skilled in sounds.

original: des bsod snyoms pa'i dpral ba'i thad kar khri rkang gtad de /
analyzed: des bsod snyoms pa'i dpral ba'i thad kar khri rkang gtad de /
translated: He pointed the leg of the bed at the alms-begging monk’s forehead and said,🔽“Alms-begging monk, what is it?”

original: ci nas kyang khri rkang gis khang thog brtol bas bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar 'bab par 'gyur ba de ltar shugs drag pos mnan pa dang / des bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar phog ste /
analyzed: ci nas kyang khri rkang gis khang thog brtol bas bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar 'bab par 'gyur ba de ltar shugs drag pos mnan pa dang / des bsod snyoms pa de'i dpral bar phog ste /
translated: He pressed down with such force that the leg of the bed broke through the roof of the house and struck the alms-goer on the forehead.

original: dpral ba zho mo //
analyzed: dpral ba zho mo //
translated: His forehead became a lump.

original: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas smras pa /
translated: The alms-goer said,

original: btsun pa nye dga' kho bo gnad do //
analyzed: btsun pa nye dga' kho bo gnad do //
translated: “Venerable Upasena, I’m in pain.”

original: nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas smras pa /
translated: Upasena said,

original: kva ye bsod snyoms pa ci zer /
analyzed: kva ye bsod snyoms pa ci zer /
translated: “Hey, alms-goer, what do you say?”

original: bsod snyoms pas bsams pa /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pas bsams pa /
translated: The alms-goer thought,

original: gal te skad phyung na 'dis rgan rims kyi bdag gi khri yang phrog par 'gyur ro snyam nas de cang mi smra bar 'dug 'dug nas nang par sngar langs te /
analyzed: gal te skad phyung na 'dis rgan rims kyi bdag gi khri yang phrog par 'gyur ro snyam nas de cang mi smra bar 'dug 'dug nas nang par sngar langs te /
translated: “If I speak out, he will take away my bed, which is the best in the community.” He remained silent.

original: mnyan yod du song nas bdag nyid ji ltar gyur pa de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la thog bor bar khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung ba la shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste /🔽'dug pa dang nyal bar byed ces smod par byed phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: mnyan yod du song nas bdag nyid ji ltar gyur pa de dge slong rnams la rgyas par brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la thog bor bar khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung ba la shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste / 'dug pa dang nyal bar byed ces smod par byed phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: “Why do the monks knowingly sit down and lie down on the ground, on beds, and on benches that are in the sky above the saṅgha’s temple?”🔽They told the Blessed One what had happened,🔽and the Blessed One, on this occasion, in this situation, assembled the community of monks and asked the monks,

original: nye dga' la smras nas /
analyzed: nye dga' la smras nas /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the monks did this?”

original: dge slong gi tshul ma yin ba /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul ma yin ba / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: “Monks, this was not done properly by those foolish men.🔽It is not suitable.🔽It is not proper.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: It is not conducive to confidence in those without it.🔽And it increases the confidence of those who have it.”

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: This is not something that should be done by those who have gone forth.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: He saw ten benefits of establishing the rules and said, “My disciples, you should recite this rule in the following way:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la thog bor bar khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung ba la shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste 'dug gam nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la thog bor bar khri'am khri'u rtsa ba 'byung ba la shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste 'dug gam nyal na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk knowingly sits or lies down on a bed or bench with detachable legs in the upper storey of a monastery, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul @75b ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul @75b ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni nye dga'/
analyzed: gang zag ni nye dga'/
translated: The person is Nyagrodha.

original: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni tho 'tshams pa /
translated: The affliction is disrespect.

original: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi yang thog tu rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi yang thog tu rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'o //
translated: The offense is sitting on a bed with detachable legs in the upper storey of a monastery.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i bu nye dga' 'am /
translated: In this case, “a monk” refers to Nyagrodha, a son of the Śākyas,

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: or any other monk like him.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi'o //
translated: “The Saṅgha’s” means the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: gtsug lag khang gi zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba'i'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba'i'o //
translated: “Monastery” means a place where the four modes of deportment—walking, standing, sitting, and lying down—are possible.

original: steng gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni steng gi nam mkha' la'o //🔽thog bor bar zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i thog gam /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni steng gi nam mkha' la'o // thog bor bar zhes bya ba ni rtsva'i thog gam /
translated: “In the sky above” means in the sky above.

original: lo ma'i thog bor bar ro //🔽khri 'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
analyzed: lo ma'i thog bor bar ro // khri 'am zhes bya ba ni khri nyid do //
translated: “On the roof” means on a roof of grass or leaves.🔽“A bed” means a bed.

original: khri'u zhes bya ba ni khri'u nyid do //
analyzed: khri'u zhes bya ba ni khri'u nyid do //
translated: “A bench” means a bench.

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'byung ba la'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'byung ba la'o //
translated: “On the ground” means on the ground.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
translated: “Mindfully” means that he himself is aware of it,

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //🔽ljid kyis phab ste zhes bya ba ni mthus mnan te'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so // ljid kyis phab ste zhes bya ba ni mthus mnan te'o //
translated: or others tell him.🔽“Having lowered it” means having pressed it down with his body.

original: 'dug gam zhes bya ba ni rku ba tshos 'jog par byed na'o //
analyzed: 'dug gam zhes bya ba ni rku ba tshos 'jog par byed na'o //
translated: “Sits down” means he sits down on the stolen goods.

original: nyal na zhes bya ba ni lus bsnyal na'o //
analyzed: nyal na zhes bya ba ni lus bsnyal na'o //
translated: “Lying down” means lying down the body.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means an offense entailing confession.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, the offense is to be understood through the basis, the preparation, the preparation for the preparation, the non-offenses, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam /
translated: Here, the offense is to be understood through the basis.🔽If a monk, in the monastery of the Saṅgha,🔽on the roof,

original: spang leb nyid dam /
analyzed: spang leb nyid dam /
translated: on the floor,

original: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin par mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba phur bu ltar phyung ba dang / gzhug tu rung ba ma bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid ma yin par shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste gnon par byed pa rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin par mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba phur bu ltar phyung ba dang / gzhug tu rung ba ma bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid ma yin par shes bzhin du ljid kyis phab ste gnon par byed pa rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not covered with something similar, and if the base of a bed or bench that is suitable for lying down on is dug out like a stake, and if it is not a bed or bench that is not suitable for lying down on, then if one knowingly sits down on it with one’s full weight, one commits the act of failure that is a root downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid la na smad pa med do //🔽steng gi thog byin gyis gzhol bar g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / spang leb kyis @76a * //🔽g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang de dang 'dra bar sra bas g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang nyid la na smad pa med do // steng gi thog byin gyis gzhol bar g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang / spang leb kyis @76a * // g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dang de dang 'dra bar sra bas g-yogs pa ma yin pa nyid dag la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the saṅgha’s temple.🔽There is no offense if the upper part of the wall is not covered with plaster, or if it is covered with wooden planks, or if it is covered with something similar that is solid.

original: mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba phur bu ltar dbyung ba dang / gzhug tu rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba phur bu ltar dbyung ba dang / gzhug tu rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the base of a bed or bench that is suitable for lying down on is dug out like a stake.

original: de ma bkan pa nyid dang rkang rten ma bcug pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de ma bkan pa nyid dang rkang rten ma bcug pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he does not prop it up or put a support under it.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog dang mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yang de lta bu nyid yin la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog dang mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba yang de lta bu nyid yin la /
translated: The same applies to the base of a bed or bench in the Sangha’s dwelling that is fit to be used as a prop.

original: dge slong gis kyang de ltar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de ltar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk perceives it that way and is unsure of it.

original: de la ljid kyis phab ste gnon pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de la ljid kyis phab ste gnon pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if he presses down on it and then gets on it.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog nyid dang / mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba nyid gnon pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog nyid dang / mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba nyid gnon pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factor in this downfall is the monk’s perception that the base of the bed or bench in the Sangha’s dwelling is not fit to be used as a prop.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /🔽dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te / dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dam /
translated: The downfall is completed by five factors:🔽the Sangha’s dwelling;

original: spang leb nyid dam /
analyzed: spang leb nyid dam /
translated: the base of a bed or bench in the Sangha’s dwelling that is not fit to be used as a prop;

original: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / ljid kyis phab pa dang /
analyzed: de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / mnan par 'os pa khri la sogs pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid ma yin pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / ljid kyis phab pa dang /
translated: or one has the perception of that, or one is not putting down one’s weight,🔽or one is not pressing down.

original: gnon pa'o // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: gnon pa'o // de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of those limbs are incomplete, one is not faulted, as is appropriate.

original: spyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: spyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall through transgression is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the root downfall of sitting on a high and luxurious seat, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the many preparations for the actual basis that are begun separately, there is a minor offense.

original: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for a person’s temple.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang / mu stegs can dang / khyim pa'i gnas la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang dang / mu stegs can dang / khyim pa'i gnas la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense for a nun’s temple, or for a non-Buddhist or a layman’s residence.

original: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang ma yin pa dang / mnan par 'os pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid la de nyid yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang ma yin pa dang / mnan par 'os pa'i rtsa ba 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid la de nyid yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not the Saṅgha's temple, and it is not a place where the root downfall of trampling on the root mantra would occur, then if one has the perception that it is, or if one is unsure of it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ljid kyi sa mi gnon par gyi na 'dug pa tsam la nyes byas so //
analyzed: ljid kyi sa mi gnon par gyi na 'dug pa tsam la nyes byas so //
translated: If one is not able to press down on the ground with one's weight, but just sits down, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba @76b yad de snyed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba @76b yad de snyed do //
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations for the preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation for the preparation is a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dang / spad leb nyid dang / de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang gi thog byin gyis gzhol ba nyid dang / spad leb nyid dang / de dang 'dra bas g-yogs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is on the roof of the Saṅgha's temple, or if it is a place covered with planks or something similar.

original: mnan par 'os pa'i rtsa ba mi 'byung ba nyid dang / bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mnan par 'os pa'i rtsa ba mi 'byung ba nyid dang / bkan pa nyid dang / rkang rten bcug pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the root is not suitable to be pressed down, if it is pressed down, or if the foot rest is inserted.

original: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is without conception.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, if one is insane, if one is deranged, or if one is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
