analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is stated in this way: “A monk should train by not resorting to any of the ways of sitting with the root showing in any place or at any time.”

original: khri la sogs pa la shes bzhin du 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: khri la sogs pa la shes bzhin du 'dug par bya'o //
translated: One should sit on a bed, etc., in a way that is not obvious to others.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de bco brgyad pa bshad zin to /
translated: This completes the explanation of the eighteenth downfall.

original: // / srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of using water containing living beings

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kūṭāgāraśālā in the grove of Anāthapiṇḍada in the city of Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na tsho dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tsho dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs par byed /
translated: At that time, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita knowingly used water containing living beings to water grass, clay, and earth,

original: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: and had others do the same. The monks said to him,

original: cho dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang / sa la ma 'debs shig /'debs su ma 'jug cig /
analyzed: cho dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang / sa la ma 'debs shig /'debs su ma 'jug cig /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, don’t knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, and earth, and don’t have others do the same.”

original: 'dun pas smras pa /🔽kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te /
analyzed: 'dun pas smras pa / kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita said,

original: gtad dam ci /🔽shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: gtad dam ci / shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: “Why do you count me among those who are not to be trusted?🔽Why do you not trust me?🔽What is wrong with going to the great ocean in the east?

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /🔽lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /🔽lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: What is wrong with going to the great ocean in the south,🔽in the west, or in the north?”

original: 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'jug na ci nyes zhes zer nas /🔽dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bab chu dang / mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'jug na ci nyes zhes zer nas / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du /
translated: “What’s wrong with using water that contains living creatures to water the grass, to make mud, or to make clay?”🔽The monks who had little desire complained, “Why do monks knowingly use water that contains living creatures to water the grass, to make mud, or to make clay?”

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha @77a * //🔽zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jug par byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha @77a * // zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They criticized him, saying, “How can the monks do this?”🔽They reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /🔽'dun pa la rmas nas /🔽dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de / 'dun pa la rmas nas / dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed One then assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned them about this matter, asking, “Is it true, monks, that the monks are doing this?”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed One rebuked them, saying, “Foolish men, it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy of a renunciant, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar smad de /
translated: This is not something that should be done by one who has gone forth.🔽” After rebuking them in many ways, the Blessed One gave a teaching and addressed the monks,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, you should recite the following training rules of the monks:

original: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am /🔽lci ba 'am /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am / lci ba 'am /
translated: ‘If a monk knowingly pours water that contains living beings onto grass,🔽earth,

original: sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: sa la 'debs sam /
translated: or clay,

original: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: or he has it poured, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
translated: The place was in Kauśāmbī.

original: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
translated: The person was Indravāmanā.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa /
translated: The affliction was carelessness.

original: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu dang spyod pa'i don las gzhan du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu dang spyod pa'i don las gzhan du spyod pa'o //
translated: The misdeed was knowingly using water containing living beings and acting in a way that was not in keeping with the purpose.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, “a monk” refers to Indravāmanā or anyone similar.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Knowingly” means

original: de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa 'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa 'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: that he himself knows or that others tell him.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: “With living beings” means two things:

original: gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: those that can be seen with the eyes and those that can be caught with a strainer.

original: chu zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so //🔽rtsva 'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
analyzed: chu zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so // rtsva 'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
translated: “Water” means with water.🔽“Grass” means with grass.

original: lci ba zhes bya ba yang lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba zhes bya ba yang lci ba nyid do //
translated: “Mud” means with mud.

original: sa la zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
analyzed: sa la zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
translated: “On the ground” means on the ground.

original: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
analyzed: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis so //
translated: “Spreads” means to do it oneself.

original: 'debs su 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Has it spread” means to have another do it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means as before.

original: 'dir srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed dang / 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed ces 'byung na /
analyzed: 'dir srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed dang / 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed ces 'byung na /
translated: Here, the offense of using water with living beings is mentioned, and below the offense of using water with living beings is mentioned.

original: de gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
translated: The general characteristics of these two are similar.

original: bye brag tu na 'di ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par @77b gzhag go //
analyzed: bye brag tu na 'di ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par @77b gzhag go //
translated: In particular, it is established in the domain of the two, engaging in the meaning that is not one’s own practice and engaging in that which is to be engaged.

original: 'og ma ni rang spyod pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'og ma ni rang spyod pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The latter is established in the domain of the two, engaging in the meaning that is one’s own practice and engaging in that which is to be engaged.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one fall into that?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of this through the presentation of the downfalls by way of the main part, the preparation, and the preparation of the preparation, and through the presentation of the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restoration.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am /
translated: Here, the presentation of the downfalls of the main part is as follows: If a fully ordained monk, knowingly, with water containing living beings, waters grass,

original: lci ba 'am sa la sogs pa dang rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i yul la 'debs sam 'debs su 'jug na /
analyzed: lci ba 'am sa la sogs pa dang rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i yul la 'debs sam 'debs su 'jug na /
translated: or earth, etc., or engages in the meaning that is not one’s own practice,

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags re re shi ba'i mthar srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags re re shi ba'i mthar srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: For each animal that dies after being killed by a monk, the actual basis of a downfall is incurred.

original: chu yang srog chags dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: chu yang srog chags dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
translated: Water is also considered to be living.

original: dge slong gis kyang de ltar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de ltar 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: However, there is no fault if the monk perceives it to be that way and is unsure of it.

original: chu dang rtsab mo dang / 'o ma dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa rang spyod pa ma yin pa chag chag dang / me shing la sogs pa dang / khrus la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du yod do chug la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: chu dang rtsab mo dang / 'o ma dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa rang spyod pa ma yin pa chag chag dang / me shing la sogs pa dang / khrus la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du yod do chug la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the water, grass, milk, grass, wood, and so forth are not for one’s own use, but are for sprinkling, for kindling a fire, and so forth, or for external purposes.

original: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skyes gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the animal is not considered to be an animal.

original: rang nyid 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang nyid 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one is not the one who actually kills, but only orders it.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srogs chags re re shi ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srogs chags re re shi ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the animal dies while being used by someone else.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this downfall is the monk who, with the intention of using water containing living beings, is the primary cause of the death of the living beings.🔽The basis of the downfall is the monk himself using the water.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual basis is fivefold:🔽the water containing living beings,🔽the intention to use it,🔽the recognition that the water contains living beings,🔽the action of using the water,

original: rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don gang yang rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / spang ba dang srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
analyzed: rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don gang yang rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / spang ba dang srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
translated: and the death of the living beings.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is absent, it is a minor transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ji srid du srog chags dang bcas ba la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba @78a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ji srid du srog chags dang bcas ba la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba @78a * //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the monk himself.🔽The downfall is accrued when the monk uses the water.

original: brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins but does not reach the main part, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one begins the main part, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srog chags med pa nyid la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: srog chags med pa nyid la srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not a living being, but one perceives it as a living being, or one is unsure, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srog chags ma shi na sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: srog chags ma shi na sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If the living being does not die, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the preparation.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo sta /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo sta /
translated: The offense of preparation for the preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed do //
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for the preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for the preparation of an offense of wrong conduct is also an offense of wrong conduct, a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni srog chags med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni srog chags med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is not a living being.

original: sha'i mig gis mi mthong ba'i srog chags la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis mi mthong ba'i srog chags la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not see the living being with one's physical eye.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / chor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / chor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or disturbed, or suffering from pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad dus srog chags dad bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad dus srog chags dad bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not using any living being in any way, in any country, at any time.

original: chu dang / sa dang / lci ba dang / shing la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du spyod do cog la srog chags med par legs par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang / sa dang / lci ba dang / shing la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du spyod do cog la srog chags med par legs par brtag par bya'o //
translated: He should examine well all external objects, such as water, earth, dung, wood, and so on, to make sure they are free of living beings.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the explanation of the nineteenth root downfall, using living beings.

original: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na /
analyzed: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na /
translated: The origin story for the downfall of staying in a temple

original: gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the grove of Kāśī.

original: de'i tshe na drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing 'phyas 'dogs pa dge slong rnams kyis smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal skyes nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing 'phyas 'dogs pa dge slong rnams kyis smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal skyes nas /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita became proud and said,

original: des koo sh'amb'i na bram ze phyug pa /🔽nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: des koo sh'amb'i na bram ze phyug pa / nor mang ba longs spyod che ba /
translated: In Kauśāmbī there is a wealthy brahman🔽with much wealth, great enjoyments,

original: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che la /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che la /
translated: and vast and extensive possessions.🔽He is stingy, has narrow eyes, and does not even give scraps to crows. He is a miser.

original: ser sna can mig phra ba bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba yo byad kun 'dzin pa de dad pa skyes nas rdzas las byung ba'i bsong na mas bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
analyzed: ser sna can mig phra ba bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba yo byad kun 'dzin pa de dad pa skyes nas rdzas las byung ba'i bsong na mas bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
translated: When he generated faith, he praised the seven bases of giving that arise from material things and agreed to build a temple.

original: @78b k'ar sh'a pa na dag sbyar te smras pa btsun pa bdag la k'ar sh'a pa na dag ni mchis na bsod nams kyi grogs bgyid pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: @78b k'ar sh'a pa na dag sbyar te smras pa btsun pa bdag la k'ar sh'a pa na dag ni mchis na bsod nams kyi grogs bgyid pa ma mchis so //
translated: He prepared the gold coins and said, 'Venerable, I have the gold coins, but I have no companion for merit.'

original: 'dun pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dun pas smras pa /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita said,🔽 If you have the gold coins, I will be your companion for merit.

original: kho bos khyod kyi bsod nams kyi grogs bya'i //
analyzed: kho bos khyod kyi bsod nams kyi grogs bya'i //
translated: I will be your meritorious friend.🔽In this way, you should have me appointed as the monk in charge of the Saṅgha’s property.”

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis kho bo dge 'dun gyi lag gi slar bskor chug shig / bram ze dag gtsug lag khang du song ste dge 'dun la gsol pa dang / de na dge 'dun gyi nang na tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan byed pas 'dun pa la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis kho bo dge 'dun gyi lag gi slar bskor chug shig / bram ze dag gtsug lag khang du song ste dge 'dun la gsol pa dang / de na dge 'dun gyi nang na tsho dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan byed pas 'dun pa la smras pa /
translated: The brahmins went to the monastery and requested the Saṅgha, and at that time the elder of the Saṅgha was Śāriputra, who was endowed with the highest qualities. He said to Saṅgharakṣita:

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita,

original: gang gi cho kho bos rgyal byed kyi tshal brtsig tu bcug pa de'i tsho na yang kho bo sus kyang lag gi blar ma bskos so //
analyzed: gang gi cho kho bos rgyal byed kyi tshal brtsig tu bcug pa de'i tsho na yang kho bo sus kyang lag gi blar ma bskos so //
translated: when I had the Jetavana Monastery built, no one appointed me as the monk in charge of the Saṅgha’s property.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba brtsig tu bcug pa de'i chen yang sus kyang lag gi blar ma bskos /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba brtsig tu bcug pa de'i chen yang sus kyang lag gi blar ma bskos /
translated: When the venerable Mahācunda had the Ārāḍa Kālāma Monastery built, no one appointed him as the monk in charge of the Saṅgha’s property.

original: khyod kyang gal te gtsug lag khang byed du 'jug par 'dod na ma bskos pa nyid du chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas bsams pa ltung bzed nag po can bdag cag mthong bar yang mi dga' na /
analyzed: khyod kyang gal te gtsug lag khang byed du 'jug par 'dod na ma bskos pa nyid du chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas bsams pa ltung bzed nag po can bdag cag mthong bar yang mi dga' na /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita thought, “The dark-complexioned ones don’t like to see us,🔽so how could they appoint us to a position of authority?”

original: lag gi blar bsko bar ga na 'gyur snyam nas de bram ze'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: lag gi blar bsko bar ga na 'gyur snyam nas de bram ze'i gan du song ste /
translated: He went to the brahmin and took the kārṣāpaṇas.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na blangs nas so phag mkhan dang / phyag mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / zhal zhal mkhan dang / ri mo mkhan dang / bla ma'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na blangs nas so phag mkhan dang / phyag mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / zhal zhal mkhan dang / ri mo mkhan dang / bla ma'i gan du song ste /
translated: He then went to the brickmakers, carpenters, woodworkers, plasterers, painters, and his teacher,

original: ka'r sh'a pa na dag byin nas /
analyzed: ka'r sh'a pa na dag byin nas /
translated: and gave them the kārṣāpaṇas.

original: de nyi ma gcig kha nas gtsug lag khang sum brtsegs sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas dang / gtan pa'i gnas dang / skar khung dang chu khung gi gnas dag kyang ma bzhag par /
analyzed: de nyi ma gcig kha nas gtsug lag khang sum brtsegs sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas dang / gtan pa'i gnas dang / skar khung dang chu khung gi gnas dag kyang ma bzhag par /
translated: In a single day, he built a three-story temple with a courtyard, a room for the permanent residents, and windows and skylights.

original: de bzhin kho nar sbyang 'dra bar brtsigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar sbyang 'dra bar brtsigs te /
translated: He built it just like the one he had seen.

original: de bram ze de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: de bram ze de'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: He went to the brahmin and said,🔽“

original: bram ze khyod kyi gtsug lag khang zin gyi tshur shog / dge 'dun la phul cig / bram zas smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze khyod kyi gtsug lag khang zin gyi tshur shog / dge 'dun la phul cig / bram zas smras pa /
translated: The Brahmin said,

original: 'phags pa deng bdag gis zhal zas sta gon ma bgyis kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa deng bdag gis zhal zas sta gon ma bgyis kyi /
translated: 'Noble ones, today I have not prepared any food.

original: sang bdag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyis te mchi'o /
analyzed: sang bdag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyis te mchi'o /
translated: Tomorrow I will prepare food and come.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Bhagavan thought,

original: gtsug lag khang 'di deng nyid du rdib par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di deng nyid du rdib par 'gyur te /
translated: This temple will collapse today.

original: gal te yongs su ma spyod pa kho nar @79a * //
analyzed: gal te yongs su ma spyod pa kho nar @79a * //
translated: If it collapses without being used,

original: rdib par gyur na bram ze de khrag tsha ba skyugs te dus byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: rdib par gyur na bram ze de khrag tsha ba skyugs te dus byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: there is a possibility that the Brahmin will vomit hot blood and die.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa thob pa dag mtshan mo'i thun dang po la gtsug lag khang der bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das nyid brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa mtshan mo'i gung thun la der chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa thob pa dag mtshan mo'i thun dang po la gtsug lag khang der bzhag nas bcom ldan 'das nyid brgya byin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pa mtshan mo'i gung thun la der chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having placed the monks who had attained the state of meditative absorption in that monastery during the first watch of the night, the Blessed One himself, together with the retinue of Indra, Brahma, and so forth, taught the Dharma there during the middle watch of the night and then departed.

original: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas /
translated: In the last watch of the night, a five-colored cloud gathered.

original: des gtsug lag khang de dper na sbyang chus gang bar gyur pa bzhin du chus gang bar gyur nas rdib par gyur to //
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang de dper na sbyang chus gang bar gyur pa bzhin du chus gang bar gyur nas rdib par gyur to //
translated: It filled that monastery with water as if it were filled with water for bathing, and it collapsed.

original: drug ste dag gis de zos nas skrag ste bros so //
analyzed: drug ste dag gis de zos nas skrag ste bros so //
translated: The six ate that and fled in fear.

original: bram ze des kyang phyi de nyin par bca' ba dang / bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas shing rta bkang ste der 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: bram ze des kyang phyi de nyin par bca' ba dang / bza' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas shing rta bkang ste der 'ongs pa na /
translated: The next day, that brahmin filled a cart with clean, wholesome food and came there.

original: rang gi gtsug lag khang rdib par mthong nas brgyal te sa la 'gyel lo //
analyzed: rang gi gtsug lag khang rdib par mthong nas brgyal te sa la 'gyel lo //
translated: He saw his temple collapsing and fainted, falling to the ground.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tsho dang ldan pa kun dga' bo las bram ze de la bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tsho dang ldan pa kun dga' bo las bram ze de la bka' stsal te /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke to the brahmin through the Venerable Ānanda:

original: mang po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la bsdos te gtsug lag khang dag byed du bcug pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su ma spyad kyi /
analyzed: mang po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la bsdos te gtsug lag khang dag byed du bcug pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su ma spyad kyi /
translated: The many who have had temples built for the Tathāgata out of devotion to him are not using them.

original: khyod kyi gtsug lag khang gang yin pa de ni ma dang mtshan mo'i thun dang po la dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis yongs su longs spyod //
analyzed: khyod kyi gtsug lag khang gang yin pa de ni ma dang mtshan mo'i thun dang po la dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis yongs su longs spyod //
translated: The temple that is yours is being used by the elder monks in the first watch of the night and the first part of the night.

original: 'di lta bu mtshan mo'i gung thun la yang bcom ldan 'das brgya byi na dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas yongs su longs spyod pas /
analyzed: 'di lta bu mtshan mo'i gung thun la yang bcom ldan 'das brgya byi na dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas yongs su longs spyod pas /
translated: In the middle watch of the night, the Blessed One, Śakra, Brahmā, and others are using it with their retinues.

original: khyed kyis ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do zhes bsgo'o //
translated: You have gained a good gain.

original: de nas bram ze des btsun pa kun dga' bo gal ta de lta na bdag gdugs re re zhing gtsug lag khang 'di lta bu sha stag bgyid du stsol par yang spro'i zhes zer ba drug sde dag gis thos nas der lhags pa dang / bram ze des de dag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon zhing /
analyzed: de nas bram ze des btsun pa kun dga' bo gal ta de lta na bdag gdugs re re zhing gtsug lag khang 'di lta bu sha stag bgyid du stsol par yang spro'i zhes zer ba drug sde dag gis thos nas der lhags pa dang / bram ze des de dag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon zhing /
translated: The group of six heard this and came there. The brahman gave each of them a new woolen shawl.

original: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs pa dang / drug sde dag kho bo cag @79b gis de ltar bram ze de'i nor de snyed chud gsan du zin kyang /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs pa dang / drug sde dag kho bo cag @79b gis de ltar bram ze de'i nor de snyed chud gsan du zin kyang /
translated: The group of six said, “We have caused that brahman to waste that much wealth,

original: 'on kyang des kho bo cag la ras yug chen sar pa ro re bskon zhing yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs par gyur pa de ltar kho bo cag gis bram ze mngon par dad par bya so zhes rlom par byed nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang des kho bo cag la ras yug chen sar pa ro re bskon zhing yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs par gyur pa de ltar kho bo cag gis bram ze mngon par dad par bya so zhes rlom par byed nas /
translated: but he gave each of us a new woolen shawl and provided us with all the necessities. We have made that brahman have faith in us.”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lag lag gang gis ngo tsha bar byas pa'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag lag lag gang gis ngo tsha bar byas pa'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why, monks, do you, who have few desires, disparage the monks by saying, ‘By whatever limb a monk is ashamed, by that very limb he is conceited’?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported to the Blessed One the circumstances of the situation.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this as the occasion, with this as the cause, with this as the situation, assembled the community of monks and asked the monks:

original: drug ste dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug ste dag la rmas nas /
translated: “Monks, is it true that you do this?”🔽“It is true, O Blessed One.”

original: mi mdzes so zhes rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad de /
analyzed: mi mdzes so zhes rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad de /
translated: Having rebuked them in many ways, the Blessed One spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di star gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di star gdon par bya ste /
translated: and having seen ten benefits, the Blessed One laid down a training rule for his disciples, that is, for the monks:

original: dge slong gis gtsug lag khang chen po zhig rtsig tu 'jug na sgo'i sbubs dang / gtan pa dang / snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis sa brtag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis gtsug lag khang chen po zhig rtsig tu 'jug na sgo'i sbubs dang / gtan pa dang / snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis sa brtag pa nas bzung ste /
translated: If a fully ordained monk builds a large temple, then from the time of examining the site up to the time of the completion of the temple, he must have the perception of the size of the door, the threshold, and the light of the temple.

original: pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum pa brtsig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum pa brtsig par bya'o //
translated: If a fully ordained monk builds a large temple, he should build two or three layers of stone and mud up to the size of the door frame, the threshold, and the window openings.

original: de las lhag par brtsigs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par brtsigs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he builds more than that, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The place is Kauśāmbī. The person is one of the six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni las dan pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni las dan pa la dga' ba /
translated: The affliction is delighting in work.

original: nyes pa ni gtsug lag khang pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum las lhag par brtsig pa'o //🔽de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni drug ste 'am /

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pas so //

analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhin po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang nyal ba dag byar rung ba'o //

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis te /

original: don 'dir ni gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gnyis ka yin par dgongs so //

analyzed: snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis zhes bya ba ni skar khung ri dag dang chu khung gi gnas rtsam gdod par bya ba'i 'du shes kyis so sa brtag pa nas bzung ste pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum zhes bya

translated: Here, the downfalls are to be understood by the characteristics of the basic transgression, the preparatory action, the subsequent action, the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the restoration.

analyzed: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o zhes ma smras pa la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: nyin gcig la pha gu 'jim pa dang bcas pa ri ma pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: bdag gis brtsigs pa dang / gzhan rtsig tu bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one builds a wall

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the wall is built in another place, or if it is more than three stories high, or if it is built without mud and straw.

original: rang gi gnas su chu khung dag ma btod pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su chu khung dag ma btod pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the water channel is not dug in its proper place.

original: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the foundation is dug but not set.

analyzed: sgo skyes la sogs pa sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the door frame and so on are not installed.🔽It is the property of the saṅgha, of an individual,

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'am gang zag gi 'am / khyim pa dbang ba gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam zhing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi 'am /🔽gang zag gi 'am /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam zhing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi 'am / gang zag gi 'am /
translated: The agent of this downfall is anyone who builds a temple that can accommodate the four modes of activity, but which is not made of stone, brick, or wood, and which lacks a roof to protect against rain, and which belongs to the saṅgha,🔽to an individual,

original: khyim pa dbang ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dbang ba'o //
translated: or to a layperson.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This downfall has five branches:

original: gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: A temple is any building that can accommodate four people sitting in the full lotus posture. It must be made of stone, brick, or wood, not of other materials. It must not be covered to protect it from rain. It must be the property of the Sangha,

original: gang zag gi 'am /🔽khyim pa dbang ba yang rung ba dang / yon bdag gis byas nas blta'o zhe 'am zin nas blta'o zhes dge slong la ma smras pa /

translated: of an individual,🔽or of a layperson. If a monk does not tell the owners of the temple,

original: chu khung dag ma btod pa 'am /🔽brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs sa ba sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa gang yang rung ba dang / rang ngam ga zhan gang yang rung bas rtsig pa dang / nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
analyzed: chu khung dag ma btod pa 'am / brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs sa ba sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa gang yang rung ba dang / rang ngam ga zhan gang yang rung bas rtsig pa dang / nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
translated: “I will look at it,” or “I will see about it,” and if he does not have a drain dug,🔽or have a hole dug in the foundation, or have the upper part of the door frame put in place, and if he or someone else builds a wall or lays three or more courses of bricks and mortar in a single day,

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med pa rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med pa rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa'o //

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs par na smad do // sbyar ba'i ltung @81a * //
translated: If they are incomplete, then one commits a minor offense.

original: ba ni nyes byas te /

analyzed: ji srid du gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of damaging a residence but has not yet reached the actual downfall, one commits a minor offense.

analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations that are different from the actual downfall, one commits a minor offense.

original: gtsug lag khang ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not a residence, one commits a minor offense.

original: spyod lam bzhi mi shong ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi mi shong ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one cannot fit in the four postures, one commits a minor offense.

original: sgo cha gong ma las gzhan ma bcug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: sgo cha gong ma las gzhan ma bcug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not insert the upper part of the door, one commits a minor offense.

analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /

analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The preparation for a minor offense is also a minor offense.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a very minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni gal te thams cad rdo ba 'am so phag gam /🔽shing las byas pa yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni gal te thams cad rdo ba 'am so phag gam / shing las byas pa yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: or wood.

original: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa byas pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa byas pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one builds a roof to protect against rain.

original: yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o zhes smras pa la ltung ba med do//
analyzed: yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o zhes smras pa la ltung ba med do//
translated: There is no offense if one says, “I will look after it has been built by the patron.”

original: nyin gcig la pha gu 'jim pa dang bcas pa rim pa gsum man chad brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyin gcig la pha gu 'jim pa dang bcas pa rim pa gsum man chad brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one builds a wall one story high in one day, provided it has no more than three stories and is not made of stone, brick, or wood.

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pha med pa rim pa gsum man chad brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pha med pa rim pa gsum man chad brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one builds a wall one story high in one day, provided it has no more than three stories and is not made of stone, brick, or wood.

original: rang gi gnas su chu khung dag btod pa la ltung ba med do //🔽brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba btsugs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //🔽sgo skyes la sogs pa'i sgo cha gong ma btsug pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su chu khung dag btod pa la ltung ba med do // brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba btsugs pa nyid la ltung ba med do // sgo skyes la sogs pa'i sgo cha gong ma btsug pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one digs a well in one’s own house.🔽There is no offense if one digs a foundation pit.🔽There is no offense if one builds a door frame.

original: nyi ma snga ma la rim pa snga ma dag brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nyi ma snga ma la rim pa snga ma dag brtsigs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one builds the lower stories on the first day and the upper stories on another day.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or in pain because of an illness, or if one is the first offender.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad du mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //

translated: The training rule is that a monk should train by not resorting to any of the ways of staying in a temple that constitute a downfall.

analyzed: sgo cha dang po gzhug par bya'o // sgo grags dag kyang gzhug par bya'o //

original: skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o //

original: chu khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: chu khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o //

analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no // gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed de nyi shu pa bshad zin to /

analyzed: bcu pa gsum pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
