original: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / gcig pu 'dug pa dang / gcig pu 'gred ba dang / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / gcig pu 'dug pa dang / gcig pu 'gred ba dang / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: (7) traveling in a boat with a nun, (8) staying in private, (9) walking in private, and (10) eating food to which a nun has added something.

original: de la ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni byung ba dang bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The origin of the downfall of teaching without being appointed is threefold: with an occurrence, with permission, and with a request.

original: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: byung ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin with an occurrence: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong ma 'phags ma nyan thos chen mo gnas brtan mo 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong ma 'phags ma nyan thos chen mo gnas brtan mo 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, the elder nuns, the noble great hearers, were:

original: skul byed ma dang / min da dang / man da ba dang / pa thad tsar dang / 'brog gnas dang / bde ba dang / zla ba dang / goo ta mi skem mo dang / autpa la'i mdog dang / dge slong ma skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i dang /
analyzed: skul byed ma dang / min da dang / man da ba dang / pa thad tsar dang / 'brog gnas dang / bde ba dang / zla ba dang / goo ta mi skem mo dang / autpa la'i mdog dang / dge slong ma skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i dang /
translated: Cunda, Mettiyā, Selā, Bhaddā Kuṇḍalakesā, Thullanandā, Aḍḍhakāsikā, Nandā, Sundarī, Sundarā, Gotamī Kumbhadhanī, Utpalavarṇā, and the nun Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: de dag dang / gzhan yang dge slong ma 'phags ma nyan thos chen mo gnas brtan mo gnas brtan mo dag mnyan yod du dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal bo'i kun dga' ra bar dbyar gnas par khas blangs so //
analyzed: de dag dang / gzhan yang dge slong ma 'phags ma nyan thos chen mo gnas brtan mo gnas brtan mo dag mnyan yod du dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal bo'i kun dga' ra bar dbyar gnas par khas blangs so //
translated: and other elder nuns, great disciples of the Buddha, also spent the rainy season in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'i'i 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'i'i 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, together with an entourage of five hundred nuns, went to the place where the Blessed One was staying.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: When she arrived, she bowed her head at the Blessed One’s feet

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //🔽mtha' gcig tu 'dug @82a * //🔽nas bcom ldan 'das skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goonya m'i la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go // mtha' gcig tu 'dug @82a * // nas bcom ldan 'das skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goonya m'i la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /
translated: and sat to one side.🔽When she had sat to one side, the Blessed One, with a Dharma discourse that was appropriate for her, instructed, inspired,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' par mdzad do //
translated: enthused, and delighted Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: He taught her in many ways with Dharma talk,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: encouraged her, uplifted her, and delighted her.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas goo ta m'i khyod kyi dus yin gyi song shig ces bskul bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas goo ta m'i khyod kyi dus yin gyi song shig ces bskul bar mdzad do //
translated: Then he urged her, “Gautami, your time has come. Go now.”

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
translated: Then Mahaprajapati Gautami rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas sod ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas sod ngo //
translated: She touched her head to the Blessed One’s feet and took leave of the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then, not long after Mahaprajapati Gautami had left, the Blessed One understood.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said to the monks,🔽“Monks,

original: dge slong dag / nga ni rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa yin pas 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston na ngal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge slong dag / nga ni rgan po rgas pa dgog tu gyur pa yin pas 'khor bzhi po dag la chos ston na ngal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: “Bhikṣus, I am old now, aged, and quite advanced in years. Teaching the Dharma to the four assemblies tires me.🔽Therefore, bhikṣus, from this day forward, the most senior bhikṣus will teach the bhikṣuṇīs.”

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na ded phyin chad dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis dge slong ma la ston cig / de'i tshe na dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams res kyis dge slong ma la ston par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na ded phyin chad dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis dge slong ma la ston cig / de'i tshe na dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams res kyis dge slong ma la ston par byed do //
translated: At that time the most senior bhikṣus taught the bhikṣuṇīs in turn.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni res babs pa na dge slong ma la ston par mi btub po //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni res babs pa na dge slong ma la ston par mi btub po //
translated: But the venerable Nandaka was not able to teach the bhikṣuṇīs when it was his turn.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i 'khor lnga brgya dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i 'khor lnga brgya dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs nas /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, with an entourage of five hundred, came into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos bstan nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la chos bstan nas song ngo //
translated: The Blessed One taught the Dharma to her, and she left.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta ma'i song nas ring po ma lon par thugs su chud nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing that it had not been long since Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī had left,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan gang dag dge slong ma la res kyis ston par byed ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan gang dag dge slong ma la res kyis ston par byed ngam /
translated: “Ānanda, which elder monks regularly teach the nuns?”

original: btsun pa dge slong gnas @82b brtan gnas brtan dag phal cher dge slong ma la res kyis ston par bgyid de /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gnas @82b brtan gnas brtan dag phal cher dge slong ma la res kyis ston par bgyid de /
translated: “Venerable Sir, most of the elder monks regularly teach the nuns.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni res babs kyang dge slong ma la ston bar mi 'tshal lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ni res babs kyang dge slong ma la ston bar mi 'tshal lo //
translated: But the venerable Nandaka does not want to regularly teach the nuns, even though it is his turn.”

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed 'khor de nyid na 'dug cing mthun par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed 'khor de nyid na 'dug cing mthun par gyur to //
translated: At that time, the venerable Nandaka was in the assembly. He heard what the Blessed One said and agreed with it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Nandaka,

original: dga' byad khyod kyis dge slong ma la thoms shig dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
analyzed: dga' byad khyod kyis dge slong ma la thoms shig dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
translated: “Nandaka, you must teach the nuns. You must regularly teach the nuns.

original: dge slong ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig de ci'i phyir zhe na dga' byed /
analyzed: dge slong ma la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig de ci'i phyir zhe na dga' byed /
translated: You must speak Dharma to the nuns. Why is that, Nandaka?

original: dge slong ma la da'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma la da'am /
translated: Because, Nandaka,

original: khyod kyis gtams kyang rung zhing rjes su bstan kyang rung la /
analyzed: khyod kyis gtams kyang rung zhing rjes su bstan kyang rung la /
translated: whether you fill it or not, whether you teach it or not,

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byar yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam byar yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is suitable for a Dharma-consistent conversation.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las dang du blangs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las dang du blangs so //
translated: The Venerable Nandaka accepted the Blessed One’s request by remaining silent.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang bar byas te /
translated: Then the Venerable Nandaka rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song do //
translated: and then he departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos ltung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos ltung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: Then, after the night had passed, the Venerable Nandaka dressed in the morning, took his bowl and his robe,

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: and entered Śrāvastī for alms.🔽Then, after wandering for alms in Śrāvastī, he ate his meal,

original: de nas mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /
translated: and after the meal,

original: phyi dro bsod snyoms mi byed nas ltung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
analyzed: phyi dro bsod snyoms mi byed nas ltung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab ste /
translated: He did not go out for alms in the afternoon, but put away his alms bowl and Dharma robes.

original: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
translated: He washed his feet and entered the temple to go into solitary retreat.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed phyi ma red nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed phyi ma red nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
translated: Then, in the late afternoon, the venerable Nandīpāla rose from his solitary retreat,

original: snam sbyar thogs te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge spyod dge slong zhig dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: snam sbyar thogs te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge spyod dge slong zhig dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: put on his Dharma robes, and, with a monk attendant following behind him, went to the nunnery of the king’s park.

original: dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed thag ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed thag ring po kho na nas mthong ngo //
translated: The nuns saw the venerable Nandīpāla coming from a distance.

original: mthong nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi phyir stan shom par byed cing 'di skad ces kyang smras so //🔽btsun pa dga' byed tshur gshegs /🔽btsun pa @83a * //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi phyir stan shom par byed cing 'di skad ces kyang smras so // btsun pa dga' byed tshur gshegs / btsun pa @83a * //
translated: When they saw him, they prepared a seat for the venerable Nandīpāla and said,🔽“Come, Venerable Nandīpāla!🔽Welcome, Venerable Nandīpāla!

original: dga' byed byon pa legs so //
analyzed: dga' byed byon pa legs so //
translated: It is good that you have come, Venerable Nandīpāla!”

original: btsun pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs su gsol tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
analyzed: btsun pa dga' byed gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs su gsol tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed stan bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
translated: “Venerable Nandaka, please sit on the seat that has been prepared.” The venerable Nandaka sat on the seat that had been prepared.

original: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Then the nuns prostrated at the feet of the venerable Nandaka and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis /🔽dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis / dge slong ma de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When they had sat to one side, the venerable Nandaka🔽said to the nuns:🔽“Sisters, ask whatever questions you wish about the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One. I will answer your questions and satisfy your minds.”

original: sring mo dag khyed cag rnam par sel ba yongs su dris shig dang / chos dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sring mo dag khyed cag rnam par sel ba yongs su dris shig dang / chos dang ldan pa'i gtam brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable Nandaka, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has taught the Dharma in many ways, saying,🔽‘Monks, the eye is impermanent. What is impermanent is suffering. What is suffering is nonself. What is nonself should be seen as it truly is with correct wisdom thus: “This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.”

original: de la khyod kyis kun shes pa dag gis kyang kun shes so zhes brjod par gyis shig / kun mi shes pa dag gis kyang kun mi shes so zhes brjod par gyis shig / gang gis smras pa dang / gang gi don kun shes pa des ni de kho na bzhin du zung shig / gang gis smras pa /
analyzed: de la khyod kyis kun shes pa dag gis kyang kun shes so zhes brjod par gyis shig / kun mi shes pa dag gis kyang kun mi shes so zhes brjod par gyis shig / gang gis smras pa dang / gang gi don kun shes pa des ni de kho na bzhin du zung shig / gang gis smras pa /
translated: “ ‘Those who say, “I know everything,” should be asked, “What is the meaning of what you say?”

original: gang gi don kun mi shes pa de ni bdag nyid la btsun pa dga' byed smras pa 'di'i don ci lags /
analyzed: gang gi don kun mi shes pa de ni bdag nyid la btsun pa dga' byed smras pa 'di'i don ci lags /
translated: “ ‘Those who say, “I know nothing,” should be asked, “What is the meaning of what you say?”’”

original: 'di ji lta bu lags zhes yongs su dris shig ces nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug po dag la bdag dang bdag gi med par chos bstan pas /
analyzed: 'di ji lta bu lags zhes yongs su dris shig ces nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang / reg pa'i tshogs drug dang / tshor ba'i tshogs drug dang / sred pa'i tshogs drug po dag la bdag dang bdag gi med par chos bstan pas /
translated: “ ‘Thus, the six inner sense sources, the six outer sense sources, the six collections of consciousness, the six collections of contact, the six collections of feeling, and the six collections of craving are taught to be devoid of self and what belongs to self.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One predicted that those five hundred nuns would become non-returners.

original: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: de nas yang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis de dag la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: Then the venerable Nandaka also taught the Dharma to them with a Dharma talk,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: encouraged them, uplifted them, and delighted them.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag mchog nyid du lung bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma lnga brgya po de dag mchog nyid du lung bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One predicted that those five hundred nuns would become supreme.

original: 'di ni re zhig 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is the origin story.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: For a while, the Blessed Buddhas do not establish training precepts for the hearers in the Vinaya.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story of the rules: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: bcom ldan @83b 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na de dag ji tsam pa de tsam bstan nas🔽de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
analyzed: bcom ldan @83b 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na de dag ji tsam pa de tsam bstan nas de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
translated: When it was the turn of the group of six monks to teach the nuns, they taught them as much as they knew.🔽They then harassed them,

original: kun du rtse bar byed /
analyzed: kun du rtse bar byed /
translated: played with them,

original: kun du ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: kun du ca co 'don par byed /
translated: and made loud noises with them.🔽They also made sidelong remarks, threw things, and hit them.

original: gzhogs stegs dang 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed de de nas gang dag bdag gir byed pa de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
analyzed: gzhogs stegs dang 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed de de nas gang dag bdag gir byed pa de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
translated: Those who took offense at that harassed them,

original: kun du rtse bar byed /
analyzed: kun du rtse bar byed /
translated: played with them,

original: kun du ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: kun du ca co 'don par byed /
translated: and made loud noises with them.

original: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed do //
analyzed: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed do //
translated: They also made sidelong remarks, threw things, and hit them.

original: gang dag bdag gir mi byed pa de dag ni 'chags dang dag ra dang / sgo gang dag na gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la ston par byed do zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: gang dag bdag gir mi byed pa de dag ni 'chags dang dag ra dang / sgo gang dag na gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la ston par byed do zhes smod par byed /
translated: Those who do not accept them say, “They are teaching us to engage in such bad behavior as building and cleaning and opening doors.”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticize,🔽and gossip.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks report this to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One says,

original: dge slong drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o //
translated: “You should not appoint the group of six monks as teachers of nuns.”

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis drug sde dag dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One says, “You should not appoint the group of six monks as teachers of nuns,”

original: de dag gcig gis gcig bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste /
analyzed: de dag gcig gis gcig bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du dong ste /
translated: they appoint one another, and then they go outside the monastery zone.

original: gcig gis gcig bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams dang mi mthun par byas te gcig gis gcig bskos te /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams dang mi mthun par byas te gcig gis gcig bskos te /
translated: They were appointed by each other, and sick monks in the vicinity took turns and did not agree with the rest, and they were appointed by each other.

original: dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston par byed pa na nyes dmigs de nyid du gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When they taught the nuns, the same problems occurred. The monks reported this to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: ma bskos pa dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams dang mi mthun par byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya ba dang 'di ltar gso @84a * //
analyzed: ma bskos pa dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du bskos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du dge slong nad pa rnams kyis 'dun pa blangs te lhag ma rnams dang mi mthun par byas nas gcig gis gcig bskos te dge slong ma la bstan par mi bya ba dang 'di ltar gso @84a * //
translated: “They should not be appointed by each other, appointed outside the boundary, or appointed in the vicinity by sick monks who take turns and do not agree with the rest. They should not teach the nuns. They should be appointed like this.

original: sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid kyi tshe dge 'dun thams cad 'dun cing mthun par gyur pa na dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid kyi tshe dge 'dun thams cad 'dun cing mthun par gyur pa na dge slong chos lnga dang ldan pa bsko bar bya ste /
translated: When the entire saṅgha is in agreement and harmony, a monk who possesses five qualities should be appointed.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal tshab lta bu dang / grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa dang / des dge slong ma la lus kyis reg pas sun ma phyung zhing /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / mang du thos pa dang / gnas brtan rgyal tshab lta bu dang / grong khyer ba'i skad dang ldan pa dang / des dge slong ma la lus kyis reg pas sun ma phyung zhing /
translated: He is ethical, learned, a senior monk like a regent, he speaks the local language, and he has not defiled a nun through physical contact.

original: gal te sun phyung na yang des ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te sun phyung na yang des ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byas pa 'am /
translated: If he has defiled a nun, he has rectified the downfall in accordance with the teaching.

original: yang na dge slong ma'i ston pa phyi ma ni srid mo dag ci khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshegs sam yongs su dag gam /
analyzed: yang na dge slong ma'i ston pa phyi ma ni srid mo dag ci khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshegs sam yongs su dag gam /
translated: The nun instructor asks the nuns, “Sisters, is the saṅgha of nuns complete? Are you pure?

original: mthun nam / khan ma tho ba med dam /
analyzed: mthun nam / khan ma tho ba med dam /
translated: Are you in agreement? Are there any transgressions?

original: khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed dam /
analyzed: khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed dam /
translated: Has anyone been appointed by the saṅgha to teach the nuns?”

original: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo //
analyzed: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo //
translated: “You should receive instruction from the Saṅgha.”

original: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' yang ston par mi spro'o //
analyzed: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' yang ston par mi spro'o //
translated: “We don’t dare to instruct any monk.”

original: khyed cag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so //🔽sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba de ston nus pa ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so // sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba de ston nus pa ste /
translated: “You should receive instruction and guidance from the Saṅgha.”🔽“You should practice heedfully.”

original: de lta bus spro bar bya zhing gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus spro bar bya zhing gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bsko bar bya'o //
translated: “You should be appointed through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken,

original: drug sde dag ma bskos pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par byed nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag ma bskos pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par byed nas /
translated: the group of six monks continued to instruct the nuns without being appointed.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ma bskos pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag ma bskos pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why, with so few monks, do monks instruct the nuns without being appointed?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident and with this cause and with this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: and questioned the group-of-six:🔽“This is not the way of a śramaṇa,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not the way of a spiritual practitioner,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,🔽it is not the way of the Dharma,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: it is not the way of the Vinaya.”🔽Having censured them in many ways,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di @84b ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di @84b ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: seeing ten benefits, he laid down a training rule for his disciples, saying,

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par dge slong ma la ston na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par dge slong ma la ston na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: “If any monk teaches a nun without being appointed by the saṅgha, he commits a pāyantika.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug snga /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug snga /
translated: The individuals were the group-of-six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni gtogs 'dod /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni gtogs 'dod /
translated: The affliction was desire to be in charge.

original: nyes pa ni ma bskos par dge slong ma la ston pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni ma bskos par dge slong ma la ston pa'o //
translated: The offense is teaching a nun who has not been appointed.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas spyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The story of the permission: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod na bram ze zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chud ma blangs nas /🔽de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: mnyan yod na bram ze zhig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chud ma blangs nas / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a brahmin. He took a wife from a family of the same class.🔽He played with her, had fun, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: dga' mgur spyod bar byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod bar byed do //
translated: He had sex with her.

original: de'i bu btsas so cog dus byas nas /
analyzed: de'i bu btsas so cog dus byas nas /
translated: Every son they gave birth to died.

original: dus gzhan zhig na de'i chung ma la sems can zhugs par gyur nas /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na de'i chung ma la sems can zhugs par gyur nas /
translated: Later, his wife conceived again.🔽The brahmin put his elbow on his knee and sat there, brooding.🔽Not far from him, an old woman was sitting. She saw him and said,

original: de nas bram ze de lag pa 'gram pa la gtad de sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa dang / de dang ha cang thag mi ring ba na bud med rgan mo zhig 'dug pa des de mthong nas des smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bram ze de lag pa 'gram pa la gtad de sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa dang / de dang ha cang thag mi ring ba na bud med rgan mo zhig 'dug pa des de mthong nas des smras pa /
translated: “Brahmin, why are you sitting there like that?”

original: bram ze ci'i slad du khyod lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de sems khong du chud cing bzhugs /
analyzed: bram ze ci'i slad du khyod lag pa la 'gram pa gtad de sems khong du chud cing bzhugs /
translated: “Brahmin, why do you sit with your cheek in your hand, lost in thought?”

original: bram ze des smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze des smras pa /
translated: The brahmin said,

original: kho bo'i bu btsas so cog dus byas te /
analyzed: kho bo'i bu btsas so cog dus byas te /
translated: “Every son I have fathered has died.

original: nga yang kho bo'i chung ma la sems can zhugs par gyur pas bu gzhan btsa' bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang dus byed par 'gyur bas mya ngan mad po 'byin te 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga yang kho bo'i chung ma la sems can zhugs par gyur pas bu gzhan btsa' bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang dus byed par 'gyur bas mya ngan mad po 'byin te 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Now that my wife has conceived again, I am filled with sorrow, thinking that the child will die and I will be filled with sorrow.”

original: rgan mo des smras pa /
analyzed: rgan mo des smras pa /
translated: The old woman said,🔽“When your queen gives birth, remind me.”

original: gang gi tshe khyod kyi btsun mo btsa' bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na kho mo spron cig / de nas dus gzhan zhig na de'i chung ma btsa' ba'i dus la bab nas bram ze des bud med rgan mo de bos nas de yang 'ongs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod kyi btsun mo btsa' bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na kho mo spron cig / de nas dus gzhan zhig na de'i chung ma btsa' ba'i dus la bab nas bram ze des bud med rgan mo de bos nas de yang 'ongs so //
translated: Later, when the brahmin’s wife was about to give birth, the brahmin called the old woman, who came.🔽When the brahmin’s wife gave birth, a boy was born. The old woman bathed the boy

original: ji tsam na de'i chung ma btsas pa dang de las khye'u zhig byung nas bud med rgan mo des khye'u de khrus byas te /
analyzed: ji tsam na de'i chung ma btsas pa dang de las khye'u zhig byung nas bud med rgan mo des khye'u de khrus byas te /
translated: and said to the brahmin,🔽“Brahmin, you should not be sad. This son of yours will live a long life. He will be prosperous and have many children.”

original: ras dkar pos dkris nas de'i kha zhun mar gyis bkang ste bu mo zhig gi lag tu byin nas des bu mo de la smras pa /
analyzed: ras dkar pos dkris nas de'i kha zhun mar gyis bkang ste bu mo zhig gi lag tu byin nas des bu mo de la smras pa /
translated: He wrapped it in a white cloth, filled its mouth with ghee, and gave it to a girl. He said to her,

original: bu mo khye'u 'di lam po che'i bzhi mdor zung la gal te dge slong ngam bram ze 'ga' snang na de la rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshol la /
analyzed: bu mo khye'u 'di lam po che'i bzhi mdor zung la gal te dge slong ngam bram ze 'ga' snang na de la rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshol la /
translated: “Girl, hold this child at the crossroads of the main street. If any monk or brahman appears, with respect and reverence bow down at his feet.

original: de la 'di skad ces khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal @85a * //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal @85a * //
translated: Say to him, ‘This child bows at the feet of the noble ones.’

original: lo zhes gyis shig / nyi ma nub pa na gal te gson na khyer te shog shig / gal te dus byed na de nyid du 'or cig //
analyzed: lo zhes gyis shig / nyi ma nub pa na gal te gson na khyer te shog shig / gal te dus byed na de nyid du 'or cig //
translated: If he is alive at sunset, bring him back. If he has died, leave him there.”

original: bu mo de grims pa sgrub phod pa yin pas /
analyzed: bu mo de grims pa sgrub phod pa yin pas /
translated: That girl was diligent and capable.

original: des khye'u de khyer nas lam po che'i bzhi mdor song nas 'dug go //
analyzed: des khye'u de khyer nas lam po che'i bzhi mdor song nas 'dug go //
translated: She took the child and went to the crossroads of the main street and sat down.

original: mu stegs can dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni nang par sngar langs te chu dogs su nye reg gi phyir 'gro ba yin pas mu stegs can chu ngogs su nye reg gi phyir 'dong ba dang der lhags nas bu mo des rdzas dang bcas gus pa dang
analyzed: mu stegs can dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni nang par sngar langs te chu dogs su nye reg gi phyir 'gro ba yin pas mu stegs can chu ngogs su nye reg gi phyir 'dong ba dang der lhags nas bu mo des rdzas dang bcas gus pa dang
translated: The non-Buddhist tīrthikas always got up early and went to the riverbank to bathe. When the tīrthikas went to the riverbank to bathe, the girl went there with her goods and with respect.🔽

original: bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
analyzed: bcas pas rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te smras pa /
translated: The non-Buddhists’ custom is to rise early and go to the riverbank to bathe. When the non-Buddhists went to the riverbank to bathe, the girl approached them, and with respect and with her belongings, she bowed down at their feet and said,

original: 'phags pa dag khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Noble ones, this boy bows down at the feet of the noble ones.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽“May you live long! May you live a long life! May the wishes of your parents be fulfilled!”

original: yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag kyang snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te
analyzed: yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag kyang snga dro sham thabs bgos lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te
translated: The elder monks put on their lower robes and, carrying their outer robes and bowls, went to the village for alms.

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bu mo des rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dang / bu mo des rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: and the girl, with respect and reverence, bowed down at the feet of the elder monks.

original: smras pa / 'phags pa dag khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: smras pa / 'phags pa dag khye'u 'di 'phags pa dag gi zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: She said, “Noble ones, this boy bows down at the feet of the noble ones.”

original: gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis smras pa /
translated: The elder monks said,🔽“May you live long! May you live a hundred years! May the wishes of your parents be fulfilled!” The girl carried the boy to the path leading to the Jetavana,

original: yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / bu mo des khye'u de rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi lam kar khyer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis snga dro sham thabs gsol lhung zed dang chos gos bsnams te /
analyzed: yun ring du 'tsho bar gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur cig / bu mo des khye'u de rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi lam kar khyer ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis snga dro sham thabs gsol lhung zed dang chos gos bsnams te /
translated: and the Blessed One, having dressed in the morning, took his bowl and his robe,

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la gshegs nas /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la gshegs nas /
translated: and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: bu mo des rgya cher rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
analyzed: bu mo des rgya cher rjes dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal te gsol pa /
translated: The girl, with great respect, bowed down at the feet of the Blessed One and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das khye'u 'di bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khye'u 'di bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: “Blessed One, this child bows down at the feet of the Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“May you live long! May you live a long life! May the Dharma-filled intentions of both your parents be fulfilled!”

original: yun ring du 'tsho par gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bsams pa yongs su @85b rdzogs par gyur cig / bu mo des nyi ma nub kar bltas na de gson par mthong nas /
analyzed: yun ring du 'tsho par gyur cig / tshe ring du skyong bar gyur cig / pha ma gnyis kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bsams pa yongs su @85b rdzogs par gyur cig / bu mo des nyi ma nub kar bltas na de gson par mthong nas /
translated: When the sun set, the girl looked and saw that the child was still alive.

original: des khye'u de khyer te khyim du 'ongs pa dang / de dag gis bu mo de la dris pa khye'u gson nam /
analyzed: des khye'u de khyer te khyim du 'ongs pa dang / de dag gis bu mo de la dris pa khye'u gson nam /
translated: She took the child and returned home, and they asked the girl, “Is the child alive?”

original: bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: bu mos smras pa /
translated: The girl said,🔽“He is alive.”

original: gson no // de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gson no // de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: khyod kyis gang du bzung /
analyzed: khyod kyis gang du bzung /
translated: “Where did you find him?”

translated: By meditating at night, he attained the special mental attentions of the higher stages and knew this five-part wheel of cyclic existence, moving and unmoving.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis zil gyis mnan nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar @87b dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa thams cad nyams pa dang / ltung ba dang / rnam par 'thor ba dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i chos nyid kyis zil gyis mnan nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar @87b dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu
translated: Having abandoned all afflictions, sons of noble family, for the sake of which you shave your head and face and, wearing the saffron robes, go forth from the household to become a renunciant,

original: 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa de /
translated: you will reach the unsurpassed end of pure conduct.🔽In this very life, you will actualize and accomplish it with your own supernormal knowledge, and you will understand,

original: tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: ‘My births have come to an end.

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing /
translated: I will know no other life than this one.’

original: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: You will become an arhat, free from the attachments of the three realms,

original: bod ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
analyzed: bod ba dang gser du mnyam pa /
translated: equal to gold,

original: nam mkha' dang lam mthil du mnyam pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang lam mthil du mnyam pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: He had a mind as even as the surface of the earth and the sky.

original: tsan dan zhag lon par bzhag ba lta bu rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: tsan dan zhag lon par bzhag ba lta bu rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
translated: His insight had cracked open the shell of nescience,

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: and he had attained knowledge, supernormal powers, and the analytical knowledges.

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: He had turned his back on the acquisitions and honors of the world and of the gods,

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / rjed par bya ba dang / mngon du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
translated: and he was worshipped, revered, and saluted by the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa rab tu byung ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa rab tu byung ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When the venerable Mahāpanthaka went forth,

original: lam chung ba'i longs spyod bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur nas /
analyzed: lam chung ba'i longs spyod bsrabs pa dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par gyur nas /
translated: the possessions of Cūḍāpanthaka were diminished, exhausted, and used up.

original: des tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyar bar brtsams so //
analyzed: des tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyar bar brtsams so //
translated: He began to make a living by great hardship.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahāpanthaka thought,🔽“

original: bdag gis thob par bya ba gang yin pa de bdag gis thob kyi /
analyzed: bdag gis thob par bya ba gang yin pa de bdag gis thob kyi /
translated: I have attained what I needed to attain.

original: bdag mnyan yod du song la bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag mnyan yod du song la bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will go to Śrāvastī and serve the Blessed One.”🔽Then the venerable Pūrṇa, traveling through the country of Kosala with a retinue of five hundred, arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa 'khor lnga brgya dang / ko sa la ngag tu ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin pa dang / mnyan yod pa'i skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de thos nas srog chags brgya phrag du ma dag der dong ba lam chung bas mthong nas de yang der song ba dang /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa 'khor lnga brgya dang / ko sa la ngag tu ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na mnyan yod du phyin pa dang / mnyan yod pa'i skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de thos nas srog chags brgya phrag du ma dag der dong ba lam chung bas mthong nas de yang der song ba dang /
translated: When a large crowd of people in Śrāvastī heard this, many hundreds of living beings went there. When Pūrṇika saw this, he also went there.

original: lam chen pas de mthong nas smras pa dang / de yang rab tu 'byung bar gsol to //
analyzed: lam chen pas de mthong nas smras pa dang / de yang rab tu 'byung bar gsol to //
translated: When Pūrṇa saw him, he said, “I request to go forth.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pas de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bcud zad yod dam zhes bltas na yod par mthong ngo /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pas de la dge ba'i rtsa ba bcud zad yod dam zhes bltas na yod par mthong ngo /
translated: The venerable Pūrṇa examined whether he had any remaining roots of virtue and saw that he did.

original: su la rag las snyam na bdag nyid la rag las par mthong nas des smras pa /
analyzed: su la rag las snyam na bdag nyid la rag las par mthong nas des smras pa /
translated: He thought, “To whom does he belong?” and saw that he belonged to himself. Pūrṇa said,🔽“Son, you have no remaining roots of virtue.

original: lam pa thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab 'di la ni rigs gces pa ma yin @88a * //
analyzed: lam pa thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab 'di la ni rigs gces pa ma yin @88a * //
translated: But in the teachings of the Muni, the Lord of Sages,

original: rus gces pa ma yin /
analyzed: rus gces pa ma yin /
translated: one is not valued for one’s caste,🔽one is not valued for one’s family,

original: thos pa gces pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thos pa gces pa ma yin gyi /
translated: one is not valued for one’s learning,🔽but one is valued for one’s practice. If you wish, go forth.”

original: sgrub pa gces pa yin gyis gal te 'dod na rab tu byung zhig /'phags ba rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa gces pa yin gyis gal te 'dod na rab tu byung zhig /'phags ba rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: The noble one said, “I will go forth.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pos lam chung ba de rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pos lam chung ba de rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: The venerable Mahāpanthaka gave him the going forth and the ordination.

original: des de klog tu gzhug par brtsams pa dang / lus ngag yid kyis sdig pa mi bya zhing //
analyzed: des de klog tu gzhug par brtsams pa dang / lus ngag yid kyis sdig pa mi bya zhing //
translated: He began to teach him to read, but after three months he had not learned even this verse:🔽“Do not commit any evil,

original: 'jig rten kun la yongs 'dzin 'dod bral ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la yongs 'dzin 'dod bral ba //
translated: do not long for the possessions of the world,

original: dran dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can gyis ni //
analyzed: dran dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can gyis ni //
translated: be endowed with mindfulness and introspection,

original: snod ldan sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di zla ba gsum gyis kyang lobs par ma gyur to //
analyzed: snod ldan sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya // zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di zla ba gsum gyis kyang lobs par ma gyur to //
translated: and rely on the suffering of those who are vessels.”

original: ba lang rdzi dang phyugs rdzi gzhan dag gis thos nas lobs par gyur pa la /
analyzed: ba lang rdzi dang phyugs rdzi gzhan dag gis thos nas lobs par gyur pa la /
translated: Other cowherds and shepherds heard it and learned it.

original: de rje sa dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas de dag gi gan du song ste dris pa dang / de dag gis de la bstan to //
analyzed: de rje sa dang bcas gus pa dang bcas pas de dag gi gan du song ste dris pa dang / de dag gis de la bstan to //
translated: and they taught it to him.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos chen po rnams kyi nyan thos 'dus pa chen po'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa lam chen po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas gang dag ljongs su dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas chos gos byas
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das dang / nyan thos chen po rnams kyi nyan thos 'dus pa chen po'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa lam chen po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas gang dag ljongs su dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas chos gos byas
translated: When the Blessed One and the great hearers had a great gathering of hearers, the venerable Mahāpanthaka's companions and pupils who had accepted the rains retreat in the countryside, after the three months of the rains retreat had passed, made their robes,

original: pa dang ldan chos gos zin pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: pa dang ldan chos gos zin pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: and having made their robes,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa'i rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa ga la ba der dong nas phyin pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa lam chen pa'i rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod ngo //
translated: taking their bowls and robes, went to where the venerable Mahāpanthaka was. Having arrived, they bowed at the feet of the venerable Mahāpanthaka and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas de dag kha cig ni ji ltar thob pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas de dag kha cig ni ji ltar thob pa rjod par byed do //
translated: Having sat to one side, some of them spoke of what they had attained,

original: kha cig ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dag gi kha ton dag dang / yongs su dri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang chos mngon pa dag gi kha ton dag dang / yongs su dri ba dag tshol bar byed do //
translated: Some of them sought to learn recitations of the sūtras, the Vinaya, and the Abhidharma, and to ask questions about them.

original: de na gad dag bul ba mchog tu bul ba /
analyzed: de na gad dag bul ba mchog tu bul ba /
translated: Among them were some who were slow, very slow,🔽small, very small. They relied on the group of six,

original: chung ba mchog tu chung ba de de dag drug sde dag la rten par byed /
analyzed: chung ba mchog tu chung ba de de dag drug sde dag la rten par byed /
translated: approached them,

original: bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: bsnyen par byed /
translated: and served them.

original: bsnyen bkur byed pas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa yang drug sde dag la rten par byed /🔽bsnyen par byed /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa yang drug sde dag la rten par byed / bsnyen par byed /
translated: The venerable Mālaka also relied on the group of six,🔽approached them,

original: bsnyen bkur byed pa na /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pa na /
translated: and served them.

original: nye dgas de la smras pa /
analyzed: nye dgas de la smras pa /
translated: Upatiṣya said to him,🔽“Mālaka, even your preceptor, who is the same as yours, seeks recitations and questions from his preceptor. You too should go and seek recitations and questions from your preceptor.

original: lam pa khyod kyi mkhan po gcig pa 'di dag kyang mkhan po las kha ton dag @88b dang / yongs su dri ba dag tshol bar byed kyi khyod kyang sod la re zhig mkhan po las kha ton dag dang yongs su dri ba dag tshol cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsad tshig ge dri ba ni mi klog pa yin no zhes ma gsungs sam /
analyzed: lam pa khyod kyi mkhan po gcig pa 'di dag kyang mkhan po las kha ton dag @88b dang / yongs su dri ba dag tshol bar byed kyi khyod kyang sod la re zhig mkhan po las kha ton dag dang yongs su dri ba dag tshol cig / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsad tshig ge dri ba ni mi klog pa yin no zhes ma gsungs sam /
translated: Hasn’t the Blessed One said, ‘One should not ask questions in verse’?”

original: re zhig lhogs shig dang tshigs su bcad ba ci'i phyir lobs par mi 'gyur tshol cig / lam pa song ste smras pa /
analyzed: re zhig lhogs shig dang tshigs su bcad ba ci'i phyir lobs par mi 'gyur tshol cig / lam pa song ste smras pa /
translated: Study for a while. Then you can try to learn the verses.

original: mkhan po bdag la re zhig kha ton dag stsol cig / tshe dang ldan pa la ma chen pas /🔽de smad pas 'dus ba yin bar mkhyen nas /
analyzed: mkhan po bdag la re zhig kha ton dag stsol cig / tshe dang ldan pa la ma chen pas / de smad pas 'dus ba yin bar mkhyen nas /
translated: Panthaka went and said, Preceptor, please give me some oral instructions.

original: des de'i gnya' pa nas bzung ste /🔽rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi phyi rol du bskrad nas smras pa /🔽khyod ni re zhig bul ba mchog tu bul ba /
analyzed: des de'i gnya' pa nas bzung ste / rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi phyi rol du bskrad nas smras pa / khyod ni re zhig bul ba mchog tu bul ba /
translated: The elder monk knew that Panthaka was a slow learner, so he said, You are a slow learner.

original: chung ba mchog tu chung ba yin na khyod bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas ci bya 'di nyid na 'dug shig / lam pas bsams pa 'di na bdag dge sbyong yang ma yin la /
analyzed: chung ba mchog tu chung ba yin na khyod bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa la rab tu byung nas ci bya 'di nyid na 'dug shig / lam pas bsams pa 'di na bdag dge sbyong yang ma yin la /
translated: You are the slowest of the slow, the smallest of the small. What are you going to do by becoming a monk in the teachings of the Bhagavat? Stay right here!

original: bram ze yad ma yin no snyam nas des du bar brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bkas rmas te tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bram ze yad ma yin no snyam nas des du bar brtsams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bkas rmas te tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: Panthaka thought, Here I am not a monk, nor am I a brahman. He began to cry. The Bhagavat saw him and asked him what was wrong. He spoke this verse:

original: byis pa bstod pa gang yin dang // mkhas par dmod pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: byis pa bstod pa gang yin dang // mkhas par dmod pa gang yin pa //
translated: cursing the wise,

original: 'di ni mkhas dmod mchog yin gyi //
analyzed: 'di ni mkhas dmod mchog yin gyi //
translated: this is the supreme curse of the wise,

original: byis pa bstod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa bstod pa ma yin no //
translated: not the praise of the childish.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said,

original: lam pa khyod de bzhin gshegs pa las klog nus sam /
analyzed: lam pa khyod de bzhin gshegs pa las klog nus sam /
translated: Lamp, can you recite from the Tathāgata?

original: gsol pa btsun pa bdag ni bul ba mchog tu bul ba mchog tu chung ba lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa btsun pa bdag ni bul ba mchog tu bul ba mchog tu chung ba lags so //
translated: He replied, Venerable, I am slow, extremely slow, very slow.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di la tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di la tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke a verse about this event:

original: gang gis byis pa byis nyid rig / de la des na de mkhas yin //
analyzed: gang gis byis pa byis nyid rig / de la des na de mkhas yin //
translated: Whoever knows the childishness of the childish, by that he is wise.

original: byis pa mkhas par rlom byed pa //
analyzed: byis pa mkhas par rlom byed pa //
translated: The childish one who boasts of being wise,

original: de 'dir shin tu byis pa yin //
analyzed: de 'dir shin tu byis pa yin //
translated: that one here is extremely childish.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams tshig re re nas chos 'don par mdzad pa ni gnas ma yin /🔽skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams tshig re re nas chos 'don par mdzad pa ni gnas ma yin / skabs ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the Blessed Buddhas recite the Dharma word by word.🔽That is not the occasion.

original: de ni gnas med pas /
analyzed: de ni gnas med pas /
translated: That is impossible.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,🔽Ānanda, go to the monastery and assemble all the monks in the assembly hall.

original: kun dga' bo khyod kyis lam pa klog tu chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos lam pa klog tu gzhug par brtsams pa dang / des klog ma @89a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo khyod kyis lam pa klog tu chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos lam pa klog tu gzhug par brtsams pa dang / des klog ma @89a * //
translated: The venerable Ānanda began to make Lampka read,🔽but he was unable to do so.

original: nus nas / kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: nus nas / kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: Ānanda said,

original: btsun pa bdag gis re zhig ston pa la yang bsnyen bkur bgyi 'tshal /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gis re zhig ston pa la yang bsnyen bkur bgyi 'tshal /
translated: “Lord, I must serve the Teacher,

original: thos pa yang bzung 'tshal /
analyzed: thos pa yang bzung 'tshal /
translated: I must retain what I have heard,

original: tshogs dag kyang klog tu stsal 'tshal /
analyzed: tshogs dag kyang klog tu stsal 'tshal /
translated: I must make the assembly read,

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag mchis shing lhags pa rnams la yang chos bstan par bgyi 'tshal bas bdag gis lam pa klog tu stsol ba'i rngo mi thogs so //
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag mchis shing lhags pa rnams la yang chos bstan par bgyi 'tshal bas bdag gis lam pa klog tu stsol ba'i rngo mi thogs so //
translated: and I must teach the Dharma to the brahmins and householders who come and go. I am unable to make Lampka read.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la rdul spang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la rdul spang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One said to him, “Abandon dust!🔽Abandon stains!”

original: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis bka' stsal nas des tshig de gnyis ma zin nas /
analyzed: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis bka' stsal nas des tshig de gnyis ma zin nas /
translated: He was unable to grasp those two words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di'i las sbyang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di'i las sbyang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought, “I will purify his karma,” and said,🔽“Lampka, read!”

original: lam pa khyod kyis dge slong rnams kyi mchil lham dang / lham sgrog gu can dag phyis shig / dge slong rnams la yang bka' stsal pa dge slong dag dge slong lam pa khyed kyi mchil lham dang lham sgrog gu can dag phyir chug la 'di la tshig gnyis kyi kha ton dag kyang rjes su slobs shig / lam
analyzed: lam pa khyod kyis dge slong rnams kyi mchil lham dang / lham sgrog gu can dag phyis shig / dge slong rnams la yang bka' stsal pa dge slong dag dge slong lam pa khyed kyi mchil lham dang lham sgrog gu can dag phyir chug la 'di la tshig gnyis kyi kha ton dag kyang rjes su slobs shig / lam
translated: “Pathika, you should clean the monks’ sandals and shoes.”🔽He also said to the monks, “Monks, have the monk Pathīka clean your sandals and shoes, and teach him the two lines of the recitation.”🔽When Pathīka was cleaning the monks’ sandals and shoes, the monks taught him the two lines of the recitation, “Remove the dust!

original: pas dge slong rnams kyi mchil lham dang lham sgrog gu can dag 'phyi pa na dge slong rnams kyis de la rdul spang ngo //
analyzed: pas dge slong rnams kyi mchil lham dang lham sgrog gu can dag 'phyi pa na dge slong rnams kyis de la rdul spang ngo //
translated: Remove the dirt!”

original: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i kha ton gnyis po dag kyang bslabs nas lam pas dus gzhan zhig na /🔽kha ton gnyis po de yang lo bas par gyur to //
analyzed: dri ma spang ngo zhes bya ba'i kha ton gnyis po dag kyang bslabs nas lam pas dus gzhan zhig na / kha ton gnyis po de yang lo bas par gyur to //
translated: After some time, Pathīka had memorized the two lines of the recitation.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa mtshon mo'i nam langs pa'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa mtshon mo'i nam langs pa'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, when the night was nearly over, the venerable Pathīka thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdul spad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdul spad do //
translated: “The Blessed One has said, ‘Remove the dust!’

original: dri ma spang ngo zhes bka' stsal pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi rdul la dgongs te bka' stsal tam /
analyzed: dri ma spang ngo zhes bka' stsal pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis nang gi rdul la dgongs te bka' stsal tam /
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‘Abandon the defilements.’ Did the Blessed One say that with regard to the inner dust,

original: 'on te phyi rol gyi rdul la dgongs te bka' stsal snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on te phyi rol gyi rdul la dgongs te bka' stsal snyam mo //
translated: or did he say it with regard to the outer dust?”

original: de de ltar sems pa na /

translated: Having wandered for alms in Śrāvastī and returned from his alms round, after his meal he put his dwelling in order himself, took his bowl and robe, and without informing his personal attendants,

original: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis bkrus nas nang du yang dag 'jog gi phyir gtsug lag khang du zhugs so //
translated: he set out on foot for the Gabled Hall in the Great Forest.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa phyi 'bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te snam sbyar thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong zhig dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa phyi 'bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs te snam sbyar thogs nas phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong zhig dang / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal po'i kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then, after the night had passed, the venerable Māluṅkyāputta rose from his seclusion in the late afternoon, put on his lower robe and upper robe, took his bowl, and, without informing his personal attendants, set out on foot for the Gabled Hall in the Great Forest.

original: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis de mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: A large crowd of people saw this and said,

original: dge slong ma'i ston pa de gang yin /🔽ci dge sbyong snga ma yin nam /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ston pa de gang yin / ci dge sbyong snga ma yin nam /
translated: “Who is the teacher of that nun?”🔽“Is it the monk who was here before?”

original: 'on te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong yin /
analyzed: 'on te phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong yin /
translated: “Or is it the monk who is following behind?”

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others said,

original: khyed kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig dge slong ma la ston par byed ces thos sam /
analyzed: khyed kyis phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig dge slong ma la ston par byed ces thos sam /
translated: “Have you heard that a monk who is following behind teaches a nun?”

original: dge slong snga ma nyid dge slong ma'i ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong snga ma nyid dge slong ma'i ston pa yin no //
translated: “The monk who was here before is the nun’s teacher.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'dis zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig klags na de yang ma lobs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dis zla ba gsum gyis tshigs su bcad pa gcig klags na de yang ma lobs pa yin na /
translated: “In three months she has not even learned one verse.

original: des dge slong ma sde snod gnyis pa dang gsum pa chos sgrog pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can dag la ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: des dge slong ma sde snod gnyis pa dang gsum pa chos sgrog pa rigs pa dang grol ba'i spobs pa can dag la ji ltar ston par 'gyur /
translated: How will she teach nuns who know two or three collections of scriptures, who proclaim the Dharma, and who have the eloquence of knowledge and freedom?”

original: dge sbyong ma sgre byi mo 'di dag gis bdag cag brid par gyur gyis tshur shog 'dong ngo //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma sgre byi mo 'di dag gis bdag cag brid par gyur gyis tshur shog 'dong ngo //
translated: “These shameless nuns have deceived us. Come, let’s go!”

original: gzhan @91b dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan @91b dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others said,🔽“Let’s see what he does. Let’s wait a bit.”

original: ji ltar byed pa yang bltas re zhig sdod cig / de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam ba 'khor de'i nang du zhugs nas seng ge'i khri ga la ba der song ba dang / ji tsam na yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag la seng ge'i khri bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa yang bltas re zhig sdod cig / de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam ba 'khor de'i nang du zhugs nas seng ge'i khri ga la ba der song ba dang / ji tsam na yal ga khru bcu gnyis pa dag la seng ge'i khri bshams pa mthong nas des bsams pa /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa entered the assembly and went to the lion throne. When he saw the lion throne set up on branches twelve cubits long, he thought,

original: ci re zhig dad par gyur pa dag gis bshams par gyur pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci re zhig dad par gyur pa dag gis bshams par gyur pa yin nam /
translated: “Did those who have faith set it up,

original: 'on te tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams pa yin snyam na /
translated: or did those with malicious intent set it up?”

original: ji tsam na tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams par mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa can dag gis bshams par mthong ngo //
translated: When he saw that it was set up by those with malicious intent,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pas /
translated: the venerable Pūrṇa

original: glang po che'i sna lta bu'i lag pa brkyang ste seng ge'i khri de ji ltar gnas su bshams pa /
analyzed: glang po che'i sna lta bu'i lag pa brkyang ste seng ge'i khri de ji ltar gnas su bshams pa /
translated: extended his arm, which was like an elephant’s trunk, and sat on the lion throne just as it was set up.

original: de ltar bzhugs nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ci nas kyang kha cig gis mthong /
analyzed: de ltar bzhugs nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ci nas kyang kha cig gis mthong /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa sat on the lion throne in such a way that some saw him from the front,🔽some from the back,🔽and some from the side.

original: kha cig gis ma mthong ba de ltar seng ge'i khri la 'dug go //
analyzed: kha cig gis ma mthong ba de ltar seng ge'i khri la 'dug go //
translated: Some saw him sitting on the lion throne, and some did not.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa lam pa ting nge 'dzin 'di lta bu la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana entered this kind of samādhi.

original: ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na rang gi stan las mi snad bar gyur cing /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mnyam par gzhag na rang gi stan las mi snad bar gyur cing /
translated: As his mind was in equipoise, he rose up without leaving his seat

original: shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: and ascended into the sky above in the eastern direction.

original: spyod lam bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: He performed the four types of conduct there,

original: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byed do /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byed do /
translated: namely walking, standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: me'i khams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: me'i khams la yang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: He also entered the fire element samādhi.

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus las 'od zer sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam pa me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs pa'i lus las 'od zer sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: From the body of the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, who had entered the fire element samādhi, various light rays emerged,

original: sngon po dag dang / ser po dag dang / dmar po dag dang / dkar po dag dang / btsod ka dag dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon po dag dang / ser po dag dang / dmar po dag dang / dkar po dag dang / btsod ka dag dang / shel dang dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung ngo //
translated: namely blue, yellow, red, white, crimson, crystal, and silver-colored.

original: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang rnam par ston te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung dag kyang rnam par ston te /
translated: He also displayed the double miracle.

original: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi smad nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
translated: fire blazes from the lower part of his body, and a stream of cold water flows from the upper part of his body.

original: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi stod nas me 'bar zhing lus kyi smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun dag 'byin par byed do //
translated: fire blazes from the upper part of his body, and a stream of cold water flows from the lower part of his body.

original: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho dang nub dang byang phyogs su yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as in the east, so it is in the south, west, and north.

original: des phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: des phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bzhi bstan nas /
translated: Having displayed the four kinds of miraculous power in the four directions,

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de phyir bsdus te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de phyir bsdus te /
translated: he withdrew that miraculous power.

original: 'khor gyi gung la seng ge'i khri bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
analyzed: 'khor gyi gung la seng ge'i khri bshams pa nyid la 'dug go //
translated: He sat down on the seat prepared for him in the middle of the assembly.

original: 'dug nas @92a * //
analyzed: 'dug nas @92a * //
translated: Having sat down,

original: tshe dang ldan pa lam pas dge slong ma rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa lam pas dge slong ma rnams la smras pa /
translated: the Venerable Revata said to the nuns,

original: srid mo dag kho bo zla ba gsum gyis /
analyzed: srid mo dag kho bo zla ba gsum gyis /
translated: “Sisters, I have been invited for three months🔽by the Licchavi people of Vaiśālī to enter the rains.

original: lus ngag yid kyis sdig pa mi bya zhing //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyis sdig pa mi bya zhing //
translated: I will not commit any evil by body, speech, or mind,

original: 'jig rten kun la yongs 'dzin 'dod bral ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun la yongs 'dzin 'dod bral ba //
translated: and I will be free from desire for the possessions of the world.

original: dran dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can gyis ni //
analyzed: dran dang ldan zhing shes bzhin can gyis ni //
translated: The one who is mindful and has introspection

original: snod ldan sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya //
analyzed: snod ldan sdug bsngal gang yin bsten mi bya //
translated: should not rely on the vessel of whatever suffering there is.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig bzung ste /
translated: He should memorize this one verse.

original: kho bo tshigs su bcad pa de nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar du tshig gzhan dag dang / tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis don rnam par 'byed par spro'o //
analyzed: kho bo tshigs su bcad pa de nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar du tshig gzhan dag dang / tshig dang yi ge gzhan dag gis don rnam par 'byed par spro'o //
translated: I would delight in explaining the meaning of this verse for seven days and nights with different words, different phrases, and different letters.
